Park the car and follow Joshua Creek north for approximately 1000 feet.  Follow a valley to the west for approximately 500 feet until you find the site.

From US Route 29 South take US Route 460 east.  At the intersection with State Route 626, take 626 north.  Continue following State Route 626 until ½ mile past the border between Campbell and Appomattox Counties.  The site is located about 200 feet to the north of the road.

29 north to 250 east to 64 east.  Take exit 159 to 522 N.  Right 
onto 663 (Owen's creek rd, before the radiotower).  Left onto 610 
(Holly Spring).  Right onto 33 East.  Take 33E to 671 and turn left onto 671.    Pull off to the side of the road approximately 300 yds N of the intersection of 657 and 671 (this will be after having gone approximately 1 and ¾ miles after turning off of 33) and park in the right of way.
properties.OlacNotes: RESCORE THIS SITE

properties.Directions: 29 north to 250 east to 64 east.  Take exit 159 to 522 N.  Right onto 663 (Owen's creek rd, before the radiotower).  Left onto 610 (Holly Spring).  Right onto 33 East.  Take 33E to 671 and turn left onto 671.  Drive 3 and ¾ miles (approximately 1 mile after the intersection of 657 and 671) and turn right onto access road driveway (driveway right before white fence).  There are two driveways right next to each other.  The southern most of the two is the proper driveway.  (The drive way for Rose Hill is approximately 1500 ft. before this driveway).  Drive down driveway approx. 1020 ft until the driveway curves to the south.  At this point, walk straight down the ravine (the can be seen on the topo) about 60 ft until a noticible eleveation change on the southern bank of the drainage basin.
properties.OlacNotes: muscovite

properties.Directions:
29 north to 250 east to 64 east.  Take exit 159 to 522 N.  Right 
onto 663 (Owen's creek rd, before the radiotower).  Left onto 610 
(Holly Spring).  Right onto 33 East.  Take 33E to 671 and turn left onto 671.    Pull off to the side of the road approximately 300 yds N of the intersection of 657 and 671 (this will be after having gone approximately 1 and ¾ miles after turning off of 33) and park in the right of way.

29 north to 250 east to 64 east.  Take exit 159 to 522 N.  Right 
onto 663 (Owen's creek rd, before the radiotower).  Left onto 610 
(Holly Spring).  Right onto 33 East.  Take 33E to 671 and turn left onto 671.    Pull off to the side of the road approximately 300 yds N of the intersection of 657 and 671 (this will be after having gone approximately 1 and ¾ miles after turning off of 33) and park in the right of way.

29 north to 250 east to 64 east.  Take exit 159 to 522 N.  Right 
onto 663 (Owen's creek rd, before the radiotower).  Left onto 610 
(Holly Spring).  Right onto 33 East.  Take 33E to 671 and turn left onto 671.    Pull off to the side of the road approximately 300 yds N of the intersection of 657 and 671 (this will be after having gone approximately 1 and ¾ miles after turning off of 33) and park in the right of way.

Take 64 East to Gum Springs.  Turn left onto 522 South and turn left onto 711 east.  Go approximately 5 miles on 711 and immediately after the bridge with the gauging station, turn left (north) onto 628.  Drive about 40ft and park at the sharp bend in the road.

Take 64 East to Gum Springs.  Turn left onto 522 South and turn left onto 711 east.  Go approximately 5 miles on 711 and immediately after the bridge with the gauging station, turn left (north) onto 628.  Drive about 40ft and park at the sharp bend in the road.  Walk down to the creek and cross it.  Walk north approximately 80ft down the west side of the bank (follow the creek)) until the large rock outcrop appears to the NE.

Take 64 West to 39 West.  Turn left onto 629 North.  Turn left onto 625N, after going approximately 2.5 miles, you will cross over a bridge over Cow Pasture River.  Approximately 10 yards (north) after crossing the bridge, there is a driveway on the left (NNW).  Follow this road .5 miles and the quarry will be on your right (NNE) while the river is on your left.

Take 64 East, turn right onto 605 South, exit 148 Shannon Hill Exit.  Follow 605 South and turn left onto 610 East (White Hall Rd.).  Follow 610 East to 651 South and after approximately one mile, pull off to the side of the road at an access road (forest service road 2957) on the right (west) side.  Park at the end of the access road (was gated at the time of site observation) and walk 
Alternate Directons (which involve less walking): Take 64 East, turn right onto 605 South, the Shannon Hill Exit.  Follow 605 South, and after the intersection of 605 and 610, turn off onto an access road (forest service road 2957)  ¾ of a mile after the intersection.  The trail goes into the woods for 2 miles to the site.  The trail may be gated off about ¼ of a mile before the sites due to the fact that the land is owned by a hunt club.  If this is the case, park at the gate and continue walking to the site.  If this is not the case, drive until the bridge crosses the stream (do not attempt to drive) and walk approximately 1 mile (just slightly more than one mile) to the site.

Drive six miles southeast from Montpelier on  33 until you get to the South Anna River.  2/10ths of a mile past the South Anna Bridge turn right into the first driveway and drive down it until it turns sharply to the left after another 2/10ths of a mile.  The quarry will be a 1000 ft east from this bend.
properties.OlacNotes: Produced aggregate.

properties.Directions: Drive six miles southeast from Montpelier on 33 until you get to the South Anna River.  2/10ths of a mile past the South Anna Bridge turn right into the first driveway and drive down it until it turns sharply to the left after another 2/10ths of a mile.  The quarry will be a 2000 ft east from this bend
properties.OlacNotes: Produced aggregate

properties.Directions: From Charlottesville, take interstate 64 east to exit 148 and turn right onto 605.  Drive on 605 until it intersects with 610.  Drive ¾ of a mile from the intersection of 605 and 610 on 605 and there will be a gravel road on the right.  Follow this gravel road about two miles south until it intersects with the creek.  The sites can be found to the northwest of the intersection with the creek. Site 706 will be about 100 yards to the north of sites 703 and 705.

From Charlottesville, take interstate 64 east to exit 148 and turn right onto 605.  Drive on 605 until it intersects with 610.  Drive ¾ of a mile from the intersection of 605 and 610 on 605 and there will be a gravel road on the right.  Follow this gravel road about two miles south until it intersects with the creek.  The site will be 1500 feet to the northwest of the creek.

Take 64E to 522N.  Pass Rt. 647 on the left and take the dirt road on the right up to the abandoned house.  Site is approximately 100 yds from house in field to the right of the house.  The change in foilage in the valley/field visibly indicates the site location.

Take 64E to 605N.  Turn left on Rt. 646.  Stay on 646 through Yanceyville... pass Rt. 604 on the left and look for two driveways on the right.  Site is halfway between the two drievways on the right and is accessible from a grassy pulloff that connects to a grass access road

From Charlottesville, take interstate 64 east to exit 148 and take a right onto 605.  Take 605 until you get to the community of Tabscott and turn left onto 603.  Drive ¾ of a mile and there will be a gravel road on the left.  Drive this road about 400 yards until it ends.  From this point the site will be about 100 yards to the east.

From Charlottesville, take interstate 64 east to exit 148 and take a right onto 605.  Take 605 until you get to the community of Tabscott and turn left onto 603.  Drive 7/10 of a mile and there will be a gravel road on the right.  Take this right and drive about 500 yards and park on the right.  From there, the site is about 1000 feet to the northwest.
properties.OlacNotes:
Same mine as DMM03330, DMM03331 and DMM17015

J. Rubinstein updated 02/09/2017.  Combined report with Allen Bishop's report of 05/10/1999 (DMM99194)

properties.Directions: Take 64 east for about 15 miles to rt 15 south toward Cumberland County for about 20 minutes, then make a left onto rt 610. Stay on rt 610 for about 1 mile until you get into Cumberland County. Then when you will see a tank farm coming up on your right. Make the right before the tank farm onto rt 609. Take rt 609 for about 3 miles then make a right onto rt 608. Take 608 for about 2.25 miles. Then make a right onto rt 613. Take this for about 0.25 miles of when you will see a mill on the right. Park by the mill and continue walking up rt 613 until you pass the waterfall and cut into the forest to the right. The site will be about 100ft in.

From 29 South, go east on State Route 677.  At the intersection with State Route 622 go east on 622. At the intersection with state route 648 go north on 648.  About 1500 feet before the intersection with state route 613 there is a gravel driveway with a sign about an auction for 3 plots.  This driveway leads up the ridge of the mountain.  About 1 mile up this driveway you will reach the end of it.  Continue along the ridge walking until you reach the peak, about 1000 feet.  Go about 500 feet farther along the ridge and turn east.  About 1000 feet east of this turn you will find the site.

From US Route 29 South take US Route 460 east.  At the intersection with State Route 626, take 626 north.  Continue following State Route 626 until ½ mile past the border between Campbell and Appomattox Counties.  The site is approximately 1/2  of a mile to the northeast of the road.  It is on the west side of Bear Run Trail.

From US Route 29 South take US Route 460 East.  At the intersection with State Route 626, take 626 north.  At the intersection with State Route 609, take 609 east.  There is a y-intersection with state route 659.  Take the right fork, which is 659.  approximately 500 feet from this intersection the road is straightened from what is shown on the quadrangle.  Stop here and go south into the woods.  There are 2 reclaimed mine shafts immediately off the road, about 1500 feet from the road is the prospect.

Take 29 south to Lynchburg, then take 460 E for about 10 miles. Then take 726 N for about 9 miles. Take the left fork in the road when it arises about 7 miles while on this road. Follow along the creek and park at the top of the hill. There should still be a large mountain on your left. Walk NW over and past the top of the mountain. Your site is located about ½ mile NW from the peak of the mountain.

At the intersection of State Route 60 South and Route 26, take 26 South.  Take 26 South until the intersection with County Route 611 take 611 west.  At the intersection with County Route 683, take 683 west.  When County Route 683 intersects with County Route 605, go south on 605. When County Route 605 intersects with County Route 623, take 623 north until it ends in a circle at a planned development.  Go about 500-750 feet through the woods along the ridge and the site is to the south.
properties.OlacNotes: Corresponds to MRV105B_204

properties.Directions: From Andersonville, go south on 638 for 3 to 4 miles. Turn left on 636 and go a little over 3 miles. Go past the entrance to 619 on the right. Not quite half a mile past 619, and a little over 100 yards past the entrance to a dead-end county road on the left, slow down and look carefully for a rather obscure driveway on the right. Park there, walk in past the powerline clearcut. From the dirt road's bend to the left, walk 50 meters due west and look for the shallow rectangular prospect.
properties.OlacNotes: Kyanite

properties.Directions: From the intersection of state routes 616 and 615, go southwest along route 614 approximately 0.4 miles.  Walk along the boundary between the clearing and woodland about 600 ft until you reach the woodland boundary.  Continue straight through the forest about 100 ft (cross stream in middle) until you reach the next clearing.  Follow the woodland boundary to the north another 400 ft until you reach the forest again.  Continue straight approximately 400 ft, until you reach the site.

Driving Directions to DMM041046

From the intersection of Route 726 and 725, go east on 725 for 300 yards.  The site os on the left side of the road.
South of intersection of 29th street and ridge road. The site is located about 100 yards from the intersection on top of the hill.
properties.OlacNotes: 6B

properties.Directions: located about 40 yards to the south of extended 29th street. the site is in a clearing.

located about 200 yards to the south east of the intersection of ridge street and 29th street. park near the storage house and walk south east along trail for 200 yards to get to the site. it cannot be distinguished from site 116

From Lynchburg, take 460 East along the James River.  Then turn off on route 606.  Then turn right onto route 609.  Continue on 609 for nearly 4 miles.  You pass the large quarry on your right, and then at the sharp bend, turn left. Take the road down until the fork, whre you park.  Walk from this location through the woods, then connect with the other gravel road that runs along side the clearcut timber.  Follow this road, until you crest a hill.  Turn right, then walk approximately .25 miles along the ridge and you will reach a number of small depressions and prospects (i.e. site 916).
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: Rt608 off US 360

Take U.S. Route 60 through Buena Vista.  Take a left at the Fitzgerald Lumber and Log Company and park.  Go around the logging camp to an access road behind it.  Follow this for around 100 m.  Go due East, upslope for approximately 400 m upslope.

Off Rt. 29, take Rt. 6 east.  Go about 3 miles (just past county line) on Rt. 6 and park on gravel turnoff on left side of road where gate blocks a long dirt road.  Take access road on northwest side of Rt. 6 and walk slightly over one mile to the Faber Lead mines.  The shafts are on steep west side of Shiloh Mountain.  Site 205 makes up four holes/shafts just NE of the main shaft (site 203).  These holes sit upslope from a large adit (Site 204).
Rt640 to end and hike.

Take 64E to 15S.  Go over the James River and through Arvonia.  Take a right on 671.  The road curves to the right and then curves to the left, the quarry is on the left side of the road before the road curves back again.  Site is accessible by dirt access road visible on the left.
Take Route 630 East.  Take a right on Route 721.  Park just after passing a cemetery and church on the right side of the road.  Hike in on the old road shown  approximately 200 m.

From the intersection of US route 58 and state route 620, go west along 620 and take the third left about 1 mile down the road.  Follow that road due south 0.25 and take the first left.  Turn right at the cemetery and go straight along the road until you reach the gate.  Turn left at the gate and head directly east.  The site is located just south east of the corner of the fence, right above the drainage.

From the intersection of state routes 855 and 934, travel approximately 0.2 miles northwest along 934.  Walk north east, perpendicular to the road about 400 ft.  Site is located in the woods directly behind the first house on the left of 855 after the intersection between 855 and 934.

From the intersection of state routes 855 and 851, travel north on 855 about 0.5 miles, and take the first right onto a dirt farm road.  Go straight along that road about 0.2 miles until you see a po0nd on the right.  The site is located just to the east of the fence that borders the eastern bounds of the pond.
Form the intersection of state routes 851 and 855, travel due east along 851 about 1.5 miles.  The site is located just north of the road.

Take state route 607 south through Beverlytown.  Approximately 1.75 miles after Beverly Town and a half a mile after crossing Brown’s Creek, take the light-duty road to the left.  Travel north on this road.  When you reach the Lynchburg Reservoir, take your first left, heading west.  Drive approximately 1.5 miles and there will be a distinct rightward bend in the road.  The site is located uphill, ~50 ft north of the road, just as the road turns back left, heading westward.
Drive to end of Rt640 and hike to site.
drive to end of Rt640 and hike in to site.
SE from Dryburg on Rt344

Take 64E to Rt. 605N.  Stay on 605N.  Pass Rt. 758 on the left.  Just past the intersection w/ 758, pull into the driveway on the left at the residence 16557.  Site is in the woods 30yds. directly behind the residence.

Take 64E to Rt. 605N.  Pass the intersection of Rt. 605N and Rt. 33.  Pull off on the access road to the left 1 km before trailer park.  Follow access road until gate.  Multiple holes in large vicinity starting from access road and working Southwest.  Potential for further sites in area as well.
properties.OlacNotes: May be related to DMM18019, DMM18020 and DMM18023.

properties.Directions:
Take 64E to Rt15S.  15S turns into Rt15/6.  Sites are accessible from jeep trail on the right about a half a mile before the Fork Union School. 
Site 909 is 100yd west from the fork in the jeep trail.

Take 64E to Rt15S.  15S turns into Rt15/6.  Sites are accessible from jeep trail on the right about a half a mile before the Fork Union School. 
Site 910 is on the left adjacent to the jeep trail.

Take 64E to Rt15S.  15S turns into Rt15/6.  Sites are accessible from jeep trail on the right about a half a mile before the Fork Union School. 
Site 911 runs perpendicular to the east of the jeep trail

Take 64E to Rt15S.  15S turns into Rt15/6.  Sites are accessible from jeep trail on the right about a half a mile before the Fork Union School. 
Site 912 is close to the jeep trail, adjacent to site 911.

Take 64E to Rt15S.  15S turns into Rt15/6.  Sites are accessible from jeep trail on the right about a half a mile before the Fork Union School. 
Site 913 is approximately 30yd East of the jeep trail.

Take Route 257 Northwest to where it intersects 613 Northeast, and 742 Northwest. 257 changes directions there to head Southwest.  Then take 742 Northwest and go .75 mile.  You will pass an elementary school on your right and a farm will be on your left.  Next to the school is a white house which has dolomite on the site.  Right after the white house is a curve in the road that runs along the highwall which is considered to be 504.

Take 64 East to exit 159. Take exit 159 to 522 N.  Right 
onto 663, left on 610 to 33 West to 715 North.  Right on 631. Go ~200 yds and park. Site is on right side of road.

From Scottsville. Take Rt .6 east to 646 south.
Take 646 to end of state road, site is down driveway on left, just before RR tracks
From James River. Take 15 S to just before Arvonia. Turn right onto 672 at gas station complex. Take 2 track when 672 banks hard to left.

From Louisa. Take 33 south to 644. Turn west onto 644 and bear to right as road changes to 2 track. Follow 2 track through clearing until reaching the powerlines, and towers. Follow powerlines/towers on foot after unlocked gate to site.

From Louisa. Take 33 south to 644. Take a right onto 644. Stay to the right when road splits. Follow what is now a 2 track through a clearing until at powerlines. Follow powerlines on foot to the northwest to sites.
From Louisa/Hanover line. Take 33 west. After Locust Creek take 658 heading west. Turn left onto 602 heading south. Site is on left where shoulder is sandy.
From Cuckoo. Take 33 east towards Threemile Corner. Just after Threemile Corner turn into parking lot at radio tower on right. Site is through woods just west of tower.

From Charlottesville, take 64E to 295.  Exit onto 95N and take 54W.  From there you will take 666 towards the southeast.  Look for a small gravel access road on the west side of 666.  This access road is located almost exactly between sites 905 and 906 which are both marked by access roads.  Walk down this gravel access road for about 40 yards, and the site will be about 15 yards into the pine forest on the south side of the access road.
properties.OlacNotes: OLP TO RE-EVALUATE

properties.Directions: From Charlottesville, take 64W to 81N and immediately off to 250W.  Follow 250W then turn onto 42W then turn onto 39N.  Follow 39N for several miles and then take a right onto 629 heading north.  Follow 629 for about 3/4 mile passing exit 625 and 2 buildings on the left.  It will be just on the right side of the road just before the next major left turn.

From Charlottesville, take 64E to 605S.  1/8 mile after passing 681, take a left into a driveway.  From the driveway, you should be able to see a manmade pond with a dam on the other side of the house.  Walk just behind the dam along the south side.  About 20 yards after you pass a creek you should be able to see a shaft that is about 20 yards south of the pond.

From Charlottesville, take 64E to 605S to 603S.  Go about 3/4 mile down the road.  You should see two buildings on the left followed by one on the right.  Pull over and walk perpendicular from the road in the NE direction to get to this site.  The actual possible shaft is located right next to an unmapped gravel road.

From Charlottesville, take 64E to 208N to 33W.  Very shortly after passing through Louisa, take a right onto 669.  Follow 669 north for several miles until you pass a very small bridge over White Creek.  There will be a small gated driveway into a cow pasture on the left side of the road just past the bridge.  You should park there and then follow the path for about 100 yards until you come upon a large mound  topped with cut-down trees and with scattered pieces of granite.

From Charlottesville, take 64E to 15S, and follow 15S for a long time until you cross the James River.  Take a left onto 672. It will be on the left side of the road just after passing Garden Creek.  Follow the creek for at least 100-150 yards.  As the creek starts to bend more and more to the right, you can walk towards the east towards the hill.  There are actually at least 3 or 4 trees with white marks on them lined up in a row.  If you see them, you are in luck, and they will point you to exactly where the shaft is on the hill.  Otherwise walk up to the hill, and the shaft will be located just on the edge of the top of the hill before all of dense pine trees and briars begin.  This is also the point where the hill begins its downward slope towards its end.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM95110 on 2/27/2017, record by Allen Bishop.

properties.Directions: From Charlottesville, take 64E to 15 S.  Follow 15S past the James River, and take a left onto 670.  Follow 670 until it meets up with Garden Creek.  Walk along the east bank of Garden Creek until you reach the second big hill.  There you should see everything towards the top of the slope that faces the creek.

Take 64 East to exit 159. Route 522 South to Highway 60, left on 60 East, make a U-turn at Route 677 and turn right on road before reaching McDonalds. Left on gravel road and stay to the right. Site is just behind graded lot on the right.

Take 29 South to Highway 60. East on 60 until you reach 15. North on 15 to route 20. Northwest on 20 to Route 678 and tun right. Site is located down second gravel road ~.25 miles on left. Park and head left in to the woods for ~20yards.  Extension of gravel road along power lines.
properties.OlacNotes: OLP to rescore site.

properties.Directions: Take 64 East to exit 159. Route 522 South to Highway 60, left on 60 East to Route 613, turn right on 716 and turn left onto Gobbler Ridge Road. Gobbler Ridge Road (not on map). Third driveway on right. Site is located to the back left of the tool shed on the property.
properties.OlacNotes: OLP to restore site.

properties.Directions: take 64 East to exit 167.  Take 617 North to 617 North

Take 64 East to exit 159.  Make right on Cross Country Road.  Veer right onto Sandy Hook ROad.  Turn right on RIver Road West.  Turn left on Scott Road before Exxon Statioin.  Follow gravel circle road until you see the gate.

Take 64 East to exit 159.  Take 522 North to 663 (Owen's Creek Road) before radio tower.  Left onto 610 (Holly Spring Road) to 33 West to 715 North.  Take right onto 631.  Site is behind third house on left.
Take Rt. 605 north from Caledonia, Va for 1½ miles.  Turn left on Shannon Hill Road and then right on first access road.  Site is 1/3 of a mile down access road and 2000 ft SW.
properties.OlacNotes: Revisited by Rubinstein on 10/06/2016.

properties.Directions: Take Rt. 605 north from Caledonia, Va for 1½ miles.  Turn left on Shannon Hill Road and then right on first access road.  Site is 1/3 of a mile down access road and 1500 ft SW.
Take Rt. 605 north from Caledonia, Va for 1½ miles.  Turn left on Shannon Hill Road and then right on first access road.  Site is 1/3 of a mile down access road and 1500 ft SW.
Take Rt. 605 north from Caledonia, Va for 1½ miles.  Turn left on Shannon Hill Road and then right on first access road.  Site is 1/3 of a mile down access road and 1000 ft SW.
properties.OlacNotes: Revised by Rubinstein on 10/06/2016.

properties.Directions: Take Rt. 600 South from Three Square, Va all the way to its end.  Site is adjacent to the RR tracks, 100 ft off the road to the right.

Take Rt. 6 west from Central Plains, Va.  Turn right on Rt. 620.  After 1/3 of a mile access road is on right.  Site is 100 ft north of access road on the far side of a small creek that runs across road
Take Rt. 6 one mile west from Fork Union, Va.  Right on Rt. 651.  Take left before Thessalonian Church and go to end of road.  Site is 1/3 of a mile NW through the woods.
Take Rt. 6 one mile west from Fork Union, Va.  Right on Rt. 651 and go ½ mile.  Site is 1000 ft off of road behind houses and junkyard.
Take Rt. 6 one mile west from Fork Union, Va.  Right on Rt. 651 and go ½ mile.  Site is 1000 ft off of road behind houses.
½ mile south of Mineral, Va down Rt. 665.  Park at residence on long curve to the left.  Site is ½ mile hike W of residence
US Rt. 522 South, Right on Access Road ½ mile after town of Pendleton.  Site is 3/4 mile down access road on right, 10 ft  off of road.
US Rt. 522 South, Right on Access Road ½ mile after town of Pendleton.  Site is ½ mile down access road on right, 10 ft  off of road.
US Rt. 522 South, Right on Access Road ½ mile after town of Pendleton.  Site is ½ mile down access road on right, 10 ft  off of road.
US Rt. 522 South, Right on Access Road ½ mile after town of Pendleton.  Site 200 ft off access road, NW of first house.

Take highway 15 southwest and then when it meets route 671, follow 671 until that reaches the railroad tracks about 2 miles away.  Take a right onto road after railroad that runs right along the railroad.  Park car and then walk along railroad for about .25 mile and when see huge tree sticking out along path right when the railroad curves left, have reached the site.

Take 15 South across the James River to Arvonia. Continue on 15 for about 3 miles. Turn right on 671. After about ¾ of a mile the road will curve sharply to the left. After the curve there will be a house to the left and a gated road to the right. Park near the gate. 704 will be the area to your left as you walk along the dirt road. Walk about 1/8 mile to some wrecked and abandoned cars. The area to your left will be 402.

Take 652 east to an unnamed road. To get here pass Taggart on your left. ¼ a mile later Union Branch Church will be on your right. After the church go about 2.5 miles. Pass 2 roads on your right and one on your left. After the road to the left drive ¼ a mile and the next road on the right is the one you take. Take this ¾ miles to a bridge (a gauging station is on the right on the North side). 604-606 are on the eastern side of the bridge on the south side of the creek. Crossing to the western side of the bridge on the south side of the creek will take you to some tailings piles.
properties.OlacNotes: RESCORE SITE

properties.Directions: From Charlottesville, take 64W to 81N and immediately off to 250W.  Take 250W to 835 and head NE.  Follow 835 to the end and take a right onto 733.  You should pass a one-way bridge and the road will bend right while you see a driveway on the left.  The sight will be located about 100 feet straight up the hill on the right and about 50 feet past the driveway.

Take 29 south to Lynchburg, then take 460 E for about 10 miles. Then take 726 N for about 11 miles. Take the left fork in the road when it arises about 7 miles while on this road. The land will start to get steep, then level off, then become steep again. This is when you park. A drainage should be ahead of you. Walk North for about a ¼ mile to get to the site.

Take 20 or 15 to Dillwyn area. After intersection of 20 with 15, take 15 about ¼ of a mile and take a left onto 1017. There will be a new radio tower in this area. Take 1017 about 1/8 of a mile. Pilings on the right slope indicate the beginning. 402 is on the left side of the road. 403-406 are a series of capped sites beginning on the right. 403 is in a gap area overgrown with secondary growth. There is a marker from the DMM in each of 403-406.
properties.OlacNotes: LONDON VIRGINIA MINE RECLAIMED

properties.Directions: Site 201: Take 20 west past Old Somerset, near the Rapidan River. After the area where east and west 20 are now joined (on the topography map they are separated) you will go about 2 miles to 201. On the way you will pass Rt. 639 on your right. 201 is about 1/10 of a mile past this. 201 is on the right side of the road, left side of the train tracks

From Charlottesville, take 64W to 81N immediately to 250W.  Then take a right onto 629 heading North.  Travel along 629 for a good ways.  You will pass 624 on your right.  It will be on the right side of the road about 1/4 mile after passing 624.  It's a huge highwall really close to the road so you can't miss it.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with 02290 on 2/27/2017, record by R. Sobeck (DMME)

properties.Directions: I-64 to Exit 136.  Turn onto 15S until you pass over the James River and the town of Arvonia.  Once past Arvonia, take a right onto Rt. 671.  Once you cross over the railroad tracks, immediately turn right onto the service road.  The sight is just under a quarter-mile on the left, as you follow the railroad tracks North.  The site is just on the edge of the woodline and there are no large landmarks, but the water in the pit is right on the woodline.

250 W through Staunton to 42N.  Take a right onto Rt. 739 and follow it when it turns into Rt. 733.  Right onto Rt. 835 and follow it until you cross over the creek and come to a farmhouse on your right,about 1 mile.  As you pass the driveway, there will be an old gate that is falling off of its hinges, and it is directly opposite the driveway on the left.  The old limestone quarry is in the middle of a small drainage in the dense overgrowth.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM02852 on 2/27/2017, record by Gary Fisher (UVA)

properties.Directions: 250 W through Staunton.  Right onto 42W, then a right onto Rt. 739.  Just past Rt. 741(Old Quarry Road) there is a parking lot in the pit of the quarry.  You won't miss the high walls on the left.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM02851 on 2/28/2017, record by Gary Fisher (UVA).

properties.Directions: 250 W through Staunton.  Right onto Rt. 732.  the roda will make a ninety-degree right turn and then pass over a creek.  As you pass over the creek, there will be a sone house on your left and a gated service road.  Park to the right and walk back over the road to the gate.  The quarry is beyond the gate forty yards and to the right.

I-64 to Exit 136.  Take 15S until you pass over the Fluvanna County line into Buckingham County.  The line is the James River.  Take a left onto Rt. 670 and head into the town of New Canton.  The road will take a ninety-degree right and then bear to the left.  AS it bears to the left, there will be an abandoned plot where a house once stood on the left.  Pull into the driveway and park in the plot.  Don't pull off to the right of Rt. 670, as you will likely get stuck in the soft ground.  Walk down Rt. 670 further until you reach the junction of the road and the large stream.  Cross into the woods on the right at the stream and follow the stream for a little over a half-mile and you will see a ninety-degree bend in the stream to the left.  The site is on the outside of the bend on the ridge-line.

I-64 to Exit 136.  Take 15S until you pass over the Fluvanna County line into Buckingham County.  The line is the James River.  Take a left onto Rt. 670 and head into the town of New Canton.  The road will take a ninety-degree right and then bear to the left.  AS it bears to the left, there will be an abandoned plot where a house once stood on the left.  Pull into the driveway and park in the plot.  Don't pull off to the right of Rt. 670, as you will likely get stuck in the soft ground.  Walk down Rt. 670 further until you reach the junction of the road and the large stream.  Cross into the woods on the right at the stream and follow the stream for a little over a half-mile and you will see a ninety-degree bend in the stream to the left.  The site is on the outside of the bend on the ridge-line.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM95109 on 3/7/2017, record by Allen Bishop, DMME

properties.Directions: I-64 to Exit 136.  Take 15S until you pass over the Fluvanna County line into Buckingham County.  The line is the James River.  Take a left onto Rt. 670 and head into the town of New Canton.  The road will take a ninety-degree right and then bear to the left.  AS it bears to the left, there will be an abandoned plot where a house once stood on the left.  Pull into the driveway and park in the plot.  Don't pull off to the right of Rt. 670, as you will likely get stuck in the soft ground.  Walk down Rt. 670 further until you reach the junction of the road and the large stream.  Cross into the woods on the right at the stream and follow the stream for a little over a half-mile and you will see a ninety-degree bend in the stream to the left.  The site is on the outside of the bend on the ridge-line.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM95109 on 2/27/2017, record by Allen Bishop (DMME)

properties.Directions:
Terrrel (Margaret Mine):

 I-64 to Exit 136.  Take 15S until you pass over the Fluvanna County line into Buckingham County.  The line is the James River.  Take a left onto Rt. 670 and head into the town of New Canton.  The road will take a ninety-degree right and then bear to the left.  AS it bears to the left, there will be an abandoned plot where a house once stood on the left.  Pull into the driveway and park in the plot.  Don't pull off to the right of Rt. 670, as you will likely get stuck in the soft ground.  Walk down Rt. 670 further until you reach the junction of the road and the large stream.  Cross into the woods on the right at the stream and follow the stream for a little over a half-mile and you will see a ninety-degree bend in the stream to the left.  The site is on the inside of the bend.
properties.OlacNotes:
Merged with DMM95107 on 3/9/2017, record by ALLEN BISHOP (DMME) inspected 1/17/1995.

THE SITE CONSISTS OF AN OPEN MINE SHAFT (60' DEEP) ON THE END OF A LOW HILL IN A WOODED TERRAIN.  THE SITE POSES A SEVERE HAZARD TO THE PUBLIC'S HEALTH & SAFETY DUE TO FALL HAZARDS. 

IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT  THE SHAFT BE CAPPED WITH A CONCRETE SEAL TO ELIMINATE THE HAZARDS TO THE PUBLIC'S HEALTH AND SAFETY.

properties.Directions: I-64 to Exit 136.  Take 15S until you pass over the Fluvanna County line into Buckingham County.  The line is the James River.  Take a left onto Rt. 670 and head into the town of New Canton.  The road will take a ninety-degree right and then bear to the left.  AS it bears to the left, there will be an abandoned plot where a house once stood on the left.  Pull into the driveway and park in the plot.  Don't pull off to the right of Rt. 670, as you will likely get stuck in the soft ground.  Walk down Rt. 670 further until you reach the junction of the road and the large stream.  Cross into the woods on the right at the stream and follow the stream for a little over a third of a mile and you will see a large increase in the height of the stream bank and begin walking in marshy land.  The site is just off of the bank to the right of the stream when you get to the marshy land.  On the terrain map, it is the second increase of elevation you come to as you follow the stream South.

Take 20 S to Dillwyn, turn left on 15, and left again immediatly onto Gold Mine Road. and another left onto 1017. Halfway down the straight away, about 1000 ft. along park, there are mounds of dirt on either side of the road. Site 403 is on the right,  and is capped. Proceed in a NNE direction along the line of other caped sites, over the ridge and into the small valley. Site 408 is about 400 feet down on the right side of the bottomlands.

Take 250 east about 2 miles past OIlville to route 632 and turn left.  Then take 632 to 637.  Once on 637 go about 1.5 miles past 635 and stop at the first road past 635.  Turn right at this paved road and drive about 20 feet and the site is located about 20 feet from the paved road.

Take 250 east and turn left at 632 and follow 632 to 637.  Once on 637 go past 635 and 634 and then take the second road on the right, one mile after 634 which will be an unimproved road entrance to two houses.  Land is owned by a man named Otto.  So once on his property, follow driveway to lake and head into woods and see mica pit.

From Charlottesville, take 64 East to Goochland County.  Get off at Rt. 629 going south towards Rt. 250.  Make a left at the T onto 250 East, stay on it for ~3 mi, then make a left onto Rt. 700.  The path to the site will be on the left shortly after turning onto 700.  It is an unmarked gravel road with a gate, but enough room to park.  Follow the path up the hill past the stream to the fork in the path (open burnt area) and use the drawn map to find the site (on the border between open area and woods.  Watch out for thorns.

From Charlottesville, take 64 east to Goochland County and get off at Rt. 629 going north.  Follow 629 for 4-5 mi until it ends, then make a left onto 522 north.  The site will be on the right side of the road before crossing the South Anna River.  Look for the exposed rock face.
0.25 miles east of Rt 11 and 0.1 miles south of Opequon Creek

From Andersonville, go south on 638 about 1 mile. At mailbox numbered 7890 (directly across road from house with said number), walk into the woods to the west. First pit is 50 feet from the road. Other pits are in a line running westward.
From Lynchburg take 640E approximatetly 2 or 3 miles.  Take a left onto rt 726 and continue for approximately half a mile to a mile.
From the intersection of US route 58 and state route 614, take 614 northeast approximately 0.3 miles.  The site is located just off the right shoulder of the road.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: From Schuyler at the intersection of 617 and 693, take 617 East for approximately ¼ mile and park on the side of the road.
Take 220 South.  Left on 902 South, left on 782, Right on 642.  To the left of the first dirt road or right of the second dirt road (between the 2 in other words) after about 2 miles on the right.
From Business 220 going south, take a right on Church St. and a right on Twin Oak Dr.  Site will be on the right in a yard.
220 South, left on 87 East, left on 750 North.  Site is on the right across from a trailer park.

Take 220 South, take a left on 87 East, then another Left on 750 North, followed by another left on 636 East, then a right on 632 South.  Site will be on your left after you pass road 948.  Follow the creek to the left.

From Buena Vista, head east on Rt.60. Approximately at the city limits, turn left on gravel drive leading to lumber yard. Park at the lumber yard office building and get permission to cross the lumber yard. MAKE SURE YOU ARE VISIBLE TO THE EQUIPMENT OPERATORS IN THE LUMBER YARD! Go to the far end of the lumber yard and drop down the steep bank to the creek. The site is on the northwest side of the creek, within sight of the lumber yard. It consists of a complex of pits, bank cut-aways, and tailings piles.
park on Rt637 and walk in
Off route 652 west of Mt Zion Ch
Rt 40 east of McKenney
Directly off Rt 634, west of Dolphin
Off of Rt. 644 - locked gate 3737 is code.
Taking 11 North from 716, after passing 3 roads on our left the site will be on your right.  It will be visible from 11 and looking similar to a highway turn off.
Site on right side of Rt 522 North leaving Flint Hill towards Front Royal.
Take Rt 647 east from Flint Hill and follow 0.5 miles to sign "Quarry".  Turn right onto quarry road and follow to site.
Along Rt 647 at Rappahannock/Faquier Cty line.  Park above river and walk in along fence line.
Take 635 from 647 to Hume and follow gravel drive in to site.
1/2 MILE N-NW OF JUNCTION OF ROUTES 605 AND 721

Right onto 15S off of 20S, coming from Charlottesville.  Take the 1st right past 714, which will be an unmarked access road.  Continue down this road approximately a half mile and there will be 2 smaller side roads, take the 1st.   Site 106 is approximately a quarter mile down the road on the right.
properties.OlacNotes:
Revisited by Rubinstein 03/21/2017

Location of Adit:  37.49738, -78.49619

properties.Directions: From Andersonville, take rt 640 in the SW direction approximately a kilometer.  Take a left onto rt 612 and go approximately 100 to 200 meters.  Between houses there is a dirt road on the left.  Go down this road to the end and the site will be off to the left side of the road.

From Rt. 13, go South on Rt. 621. Make a Left onto Rt. 620.  Make a right onto a dirt road after passing a group of trailers on the right.  There should be a road on the other side of 620 running in the opposite direction more or less from the correct dirt road.  You should pass a small pond on the left shortly after getting onto the dirt road.  Follow the road to a white house with a group of red barns and sheds in the back yard.  Across the road from the house is a path overgrown with tall brown grass, but obvious because of the lack of trees, follow this path to the series of circular clearings that is the site.
properties.OlacNotes: SITE HAS BEEN RECLAIMED.

properties.Directions: US522 out of Flint Hill, right on Rt 632, left on Rt 634, follow to end of maintenance and park to walk into sites.
US522 out of Flint Hill to Rt 632, right and then Rt 634 left, continue to end of maintenance area park and hike in to site.
Rt 688 to north side of I 66, left on F284, follow to quarry entrance road.
properties.OlacNotes:
ACTIVE PERMIT 10639AC

BASALT

properties.Directions: Rt 55 to Rt 725, cross north under I 66 and park in lot to walk Appalachian Trail
properties.OlacNotes: BASALT

properties.Directions:
Driving Directions to DMM041108

From the intersection of US Route 460 and route 726, drive north on 726 for three quarters of a mile.  The best way to reach the sites is to park at the first entrance of the factory and walk up the telephone line path to the top of the ridge.  There will be a fire road at the top of the ridge.  Walk north east on the fire road to get to the sites.

Located directly behind the DANA parking lot on the south side. There is an old road that leads from the parking lot to the base of the hill on which the site is. The site is about half a mile from the parking lot and about 30 yards up the slope from the old trail.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: Drive down Quarry Hill road about 40 yards further than the last house and the quarry is visible form the road on the left hand side.
Located 20 yards from route 602 on the north side where the road takes a long looping bend to the left.
Take trail west from route 693 and find the site 20 yards from the trail where it forks on the left side.
Take the trail of route 675 and head south for about 3/4 miles. The trail heads off where route 675 has a very sharp bend. the site is located behind a house at the end of the trail.
park near the storage house on ridge street. the site is located about 200 yards to the south east. there is a trail leading up to the site.

Off of U.S. Route 15 and about 9/10 miles after crossing the James River, take a left turn onto State Route 670.  A little over a mile on 670, the road will make a 90 degree turn to the right.  After continuing for another 2/10 miles, Site 514 is 1/10 miles South of 670 and on the eastern side of a tear drop shaped rise.
 to Railroad Tunnel
outside of New Canton, off RT 670 on side of hill at railroad tracks under power line
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM98184 on 2/27/2017, record by Allen Bishop (DMME)

properties.Directions: From U.S. Route 15, take a left turn onto State Route 670.  After about a mile on 670, make a left turn onto an unmarked road.  Cross the railroad tracks on this road and park in the parking area adjacent to the James River.  Walking back up the road from the River, site 515 is just past the tracks and about 10 yards to the right of the road.

From U.S. Route 522, take a right onto State Route 629, followed closely by another right onto State Route 640.  Site 302 is on the right side of the road about 20 yards past the one lane bridge over the creek.

From U.S. Route 522, take a right onto State Route 629, followed closely by another right onto State Route 640.  Site 302 is on the right side of the road about 20 yards past the one lane bridge over the creek.  To get to site 303, follow the creek from site 302 until the southeast portion of the bend where the creek meets with the South Anna River

Off of U.S. Route 522, take State Route 617 for about 1.25-1.5 miles.  After the road bends right and shortly after it begins to begin left, take the unpaved road which is along the side of a field which contains markers warning of dangers due to use of pesticides.  About 20 yards before this road makes a 90 degree turn to the right, site 801 will be on your left.

Driving southwest on U.S Route 15, take a right turn onto State Route 678.  We parked in the rear parking area of a small church located about a quarter mile from the intersection with Statre Route 675.  After parking , site can be reached by foot from the rear church parking area.
properties.OlacNotes:
Merged with DMM00401 on 2/27/2017, record by Daniel Snead.

Active Mine Permit Number 05745AB

properties.Directions: North of new market take route 11north about 4 miles to route 730 where it changes to gravel. Site 101 is right of the road and is very visible from the road.
Follow 617 from 29 until reaching the railroad tracks.  Cross on other side of river head northwest along the floodplain the site will be visible from the floodplains to the left (southwest)
properties.OlacNotes: GREYWACKE

properties.Directions: From 6 head east then bear onto 727 north until reaching the second road (driveway) on the right.  Follow the driveway along to clearing on the right.  Head to the clearing the site is right before the clearing and the barbed fence.
access through NC along US15
From the intersection of US Rt. 60 and VA Rt 631, drive east on Rt. 60 for a mile.  Park on the clearing on the right side of the road.  Walk .25 miles northeast, uphill into the woods.
properties.OlacNotes: 3B 3C

properties.Directions: hike from RT623 to site
From the intersection of US Rt. 60 and VA Rt 631, drive east on Rt. 60 for a mile.  Park on the clearing on the right side of the road.  Walk .4 miles north- northeast, uphill, into the woods.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: From the intersection of US. Rt 60 and the Blue Ridge Parkway, drive west on Rt. 60 for about 2.5 miles until you get to the Dana factory on your right.  Take a right into the Dana factory drivway and park in the parking lot.  From there, walk about 50 yards NE into the woods.  The first section of  201 is close to the parking lot.  The second section of 201 is about 300 yards NW of the other pits.

Coming down Route 15 South, take a left on State Route 617.  Follow the road for .6 miles and make right onto to a dirt road next to a large pasture.  Follow this road for .6 miles and walk through a pasture about 200 yards to a small alcove of trees.  The site is located in the middle of the alcove.

From the intersection of US. Rt 60 and the Blue Ridge Parkway, drive west on Rt. 60 for about 2.5 miles until you get to the Dana factory on your right.  Take a right into the Dana factory drivway and park in the parking lot.  From there, walk about 200 yards E-NE into the woods.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: Coming down Route 15 South, take a left on State Route 617.  Follow the road for .6 miles and make right onto a dirt road next to a large pasture.  Follow this road for 1 mile until the road comes to an end.  Walk about .1 mile South, first through brush, and then through trees until you come to a small stream located across from a very steep hill.  The site is located about 50 yards from the stream at .1 mile from the end of the road.

1.4 miles east of intersection of State Highway 6 and county road 627.  Turn right onto gravel driveway.  Proceed to end of the driveway past the last house.  Cross pasture and take the trail at the end of the pasture to the site.
properties.OlacNotes: USED FOR AGGREGATE

properties.Directions:
Directions:

From the intersection of US Rt634 and US Rt.60, go west on rt 60 for 1/3 mile.  Pull in on the driveway to your left and walk .4 miles SW to the site.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: When traveling south on 15, turn left at the intersection with 617.  Drive 2/10 of a mile to an access road on the right and drive 100yards down this road.  This site can be found on the right.

From the junction of 627 and 6 at Porters, VA; head north on 627 for half a mile.  Turn right by New Green Mountain Church.  Follow the road behind the church, bear right when the road splits.  Stop at the driveway at the end of the road.  Walk 1/8 mile up the hill S-SE.  Site is near the top of the hill.

Follow Virginia State route 605 from US 29 until it joins with Virginia State Route 721 at a fork with Route 721 coming in on the left.  Follow this road about .8 miles, until it connects with route 671.  About .1 mile on the right is a jeep trail.  Follow the trail in the southwest direction for about 1.2 miles.  At this point turn east and walk about .1 mile on the ridge top to the site.  There is a road on the ridge connecting the two pits and the trench.

From intersection of state road 6 and 627 in Porters, drive approximately ¾ mile WNW on 6 until 715 v’s off to the NW on the right side of the road.  Turn right (north) at the T-intersection of 715 and drive ¾ of a mile through Estmont to the first access road on the left (west).  Follow the access road ½ mile (first going E, then turns sharply S) to the top of the hill.  Here you may park or drive the next 60 yds down the SW side of the hill along the access road to the west edge of the quarry.
Follow rt 640 in the SW direction from Andersonville about a mile.  Take a left onto rt 612 and go about a mile.  Turn right onto Cole Road and go approximately a mile and park along the roadside.

Following US Route 15 South, take a right onto Virginia Highway 650 and follow the road for 6 miles.   Make a right onto State Route 628 across from the Cornerstone Church and follow this road for 1 mile.  After 1 mile there is a fork, and you must bear to the right.  About 100 yards on the left side of the road is the site.  Walk about 50 yards into the woods in the North-west direction and you will come to the first two pits.    About 100 yards East of the road, there is another large open pit on the side of a gravel road that runs behind the wooded area.

Follow Virginia State route 605 from US 29 until it joins with Virginia State Route 721 at a fork with Route 721 coming in on the left.  Follow this road about .8 miles, until it connects with route 671.  About .1 mile on the right is a jeep trail.  Follow the trail in the southwest direction for about 1.7 miles.  Turn northeast at this point and walk about .15 mile through brush.  Ascend a small hill.  The pit and trenches are on the right and located about 100 yards away from each other.

Off Route 64, take Route 15 South.  Turn right onto route 612.  After approximately .13 miles, take left onto Route 614.  Follow road approximately 2.1 miles to end of state maintenance.  Turn right on dirt road and continue NW for .1 miles.  Site is approximately 1000 meters WSW and is on edge of hill.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM031307 on 2/27/2017, record by Josh Bundick.

properties.Directions: From the intersection of 721 and 605 on the Stonewall Quad, drive ¼ mile Northwest up 721.  Pull off onto a gated access road on the right side of the road (north) after driving ¼ mile.  Follow the access road straight (the road branches off behind you at some points, but keep follwing the road north up the hill) approximately 0.5miles up to the peak of the hill until you see an old abandoned trailer.  The sites will be to the north and south west of the trailer.  (you will also pass several other sites on your walk up the access road)

From the intersection of 721 and 605 on the Stonewall Quad, drive ¼ mile Northwest up 721.  Pull off onto a gated access road on the right side of the road (north) after driving ¼ mile.  Follow the access road straight (the road branches off behind you at some points, but keep follwing the road north up the hill) approximately 4/10 of a mile where the grade is fairly flat.  The site will be on your left (west).  The area is highly disturbed and you won’t miss it.

intersection of 721 and 605
drive 1/4 mile NW
pull off onto access road on right (north)
walk down access road 1 mile to site 428

intersection of 721 and 605
drive 1/4 mile NW
pull off onto access road on right (north)
walk down access road 1 mile to site 428
Take US 611 then turn on US 721 aprox 1/2 mile look for jeep trail on right sife of road. Take jeep trail aprox 1/2 mile. On south side of jeep trail
Take US 611 to US 721 aprox 1/2 miles look for jeep trail on left.Go aprox 1/4 mile then South east 1/8 mile  of jeep trail

-29 South from Charlottesville
-left onto 655 East
-right onto 661 (after wooden bridge)
-left onto 661
-straight through intersection with 659
-at 'End of State Maintenance" sign, walk ~50 yds through woods to the right of the road (north-east side)
From the junction of 721 and 605, drive 11/20 mile NW .  Pull off and walk 50 yds to the north of the road.
From junction of 721 and 605, drive 1/4 mile NW pull off on access road.  Site 418 is 100ft. up access road on the north side on the left side.
From the junction of 611 and 663, go 1 mile down 611, after crossing the stream is on the right.  25 yds off of road.

Travel south on route 15.  Shortly before reaching the bridge over the James River, turn right onto route 656.  Turn right onto gravel/dirt CSX access road and travel 1.3 mi (this road runs parallel to the river and the rail corridor).  The site will be on the right and across a field, approximately 200 yards north from the road.  There is a steel chain across this road, but the landowner graciously provided access beyond it.

From Andersonville, go south on 638, turn left on 637, and left on 609. A quarter mile (or less) along 609, turn right into driveway for Claude Morris farm. Easiest parking is at house. Follow dirt farm road east through gate, across small stream ford, and up into pasture on a hill. Head for highest ground in pasture and then look for site just 50 meters inside woods.

Take State Route 15 South to the intersection of county route 669.  Go east of 669 until the intersection with county route 668.  Go South on 668 for approximately 0.5 miles.  There will be a gated access road to the west.  Walk about 50-100 feet on that road and there will be a fork.  Take the North fork for approximately 1/8th to 0.25 miles.  At that point, go northwest into the woods for about 200-300 feet.

State Route 15 south to 669 East.  Take 669 to 668 south.  Take 669 to 650 east, which intersects with 628 south.  628 winds off the quad and then returns to the quad approximately 1/8th of a mile from the turnoff to the northwest.  The turnoff is a private driveway that ends at a house.  At the house, the quarry is 200-300 feet southeast of the house in the woods.

Traveling on Rt 29 S, take 655 East.  Turn right on 661 after wooden bridge, and bear left to continue on 661.  Follow the road up through mountainside and turn left on 654.  The site is 3/4 mile down road on SE side, about 200 yds SE of road.

Traveling on Rt 29 S, take 655 East.  Turn right on 661 after wooden bridge, and bare left to continue on 661.  Follow the road up through mountainside and turn left on 654.  Travel 1 mile and park near logging road on left.  Walk N down logging road for about 50 yds - site is directly to left.

At the intersection of State Route 60 South and Route 26, take 26 South.  Drive until the intersection with County Route 611 West.  Take 611 West until you reach County Route 721 North.  Go approximately 2 miles on 721 N until you reach a Jeep Trail to the South.  The trail splits into two trails about 3/8 mile, take the right (westerly) fork of the trail.  Go approximately 1/2 mile to the site.  The site will be on the east side of the trail in a small treed area.

At the intersection of State Route 60 South and Route 26, take 26 South.  Take 26 South until the intersection with County Route 611 and take 611 West.  Take 611 to a road that is not named on the map.  This road is the next road on the map after 721.  Take it to the north until the pavement ends in approximately ½-3/4 mile.  There is a paved road to the west and a dirt entrance to the east.  Take the dirt entrance to the logging area.  About 50 feet from this entrance is the site on the right side of the road.  There is a second trench to the left of the road as well.

From 655E, turn right onto 661 (after the wooden bridge).  Then turn left onto 661.  Pass the intersection with 654 and drive until the end of state maintenance.  The site is 50 yrds south from the cemetery on the left side of the road.
From 655 east, turn right onto 661 after the wooden bridge.  Make another turn left onto 661.  Travel 0.2 mi south of the 661/654 intersection.  Follow the powerlines 50 yards east from side of road.

Off of Route 29 South, turn left on Route 655.  Just after wooden bridge, turn right onto Route 661.  Follow 661, bearing to left to continue when necessary.  Follow 661 past intersection with Route 654 to end of state maintenance.  Site is approximately 30 yards North, with a close proximity to a mobile home.

Follow Virginia State route 605 from US 29 until it joins with Virginia State Route 721 at a fork with Route 721 coming in on the left.  Follow this road about .8 miles, until it connects with route 671.  About .1 mile on the right is a jeep trail.  Follow the trail in the southwest direction for about 1.7 miles.  At the end of the road, walk slightly uphill about .7 miles in the North East direction through extensive burned forest to the site.

At the intersection of State Route 60 South and Route 26, take 26 South.  Take 26 South until the intersection with County Route 611 and take 611 West.  Take 611 to a road that is not named on the map.  This road is the next road on the map after 721.  Take it to the north until the pavement ends in approximately ½-3/4 mile.  There is a paved road to the west and a dirt entrance to the east.  Take the dirt entrance to the logging area.  Take this entrance and go approximately ½ mile to the northeast of the paved road at about a 30 degree angle.  The site is at the top of the ridge in the middle of the clear cut.

-64 east from Charlottesville
-15 south
-right onto Route 612 (0.3 miles)
-left onto Route 614 (continue until end of state maintenance, ~2.1 miles)
-right onto dirt road (~0.1 miles)
-as dirt road forks, walk to the left.  Follow old road, goes down hill & over a small river, up a steep hill (path slightly cut, appears to be property boundary), at top of hill site is to the right.
Take US 611 South. Parking is aprox 1 1/2 mile past the intersection of US 721. Site aprox 1/3 mile North east of parking.
Take US 611 to US 721aprox 1/2 mile look for jeep trail on left . Take jeep trail aprox 3/4 mile then go south east aprox 1/4 miles

At the intersection of State Route 60 South and Route 26, take 26 South.  Take 26 South until the intersection with County Route 611 and take 611 West.  Go until you reach County Route 721 North.   Take this road and stop a ¼ mile past the intersection with County Route 605, you should be at a drainage out of the two steep hills.  The site is up the hill to the northwest of your position.  The site is approximately 50 feet from the road, but up at the top of the northwest hill.

Take 611 to junction with 721 taking a right, then go aprox 1/2 mile and look for parking spot on left then head aprox 1/3 mile south east away from Rt. 721 on foot which curves around putting the site 2/3 mi NE of a house and barn visible from the site.

Take Route 20 south to town of Dillwyn.  Turn left onto Route 15 North.  Turn left onto Route 622 and continue for approximately 3 miles.  Turn into gated logging road on left.  Sites are approximately within 250 meters to South.

Take Route 20 south to town of Dillwyn.  Turn left onto Route 15 North.  Turn right onto Route 617.  After approximately .5 miles, turn right into dirt logging road.  Sites are approximately 1 mile east (down dirt road).

from the intersection of 611 and 683 on the quad, turn left onto 683.  Drive approximately 2.5 miles North until a left bend in the road.  Park the car and walk directly east (right side of the road) approximately 40yds into the woods.

Take 29 South to Route 60 East.  Take left off of Route 60 onto Route 657.  Travel 3.2 miles and turn down dirt road on left just past intersection of Routes 657 and 721.  Sites are approximately 200 yards West.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM031039 on 2/27/2017, record by Lance Clark.

properties.Directions: Take 29 South to Route 60 East.  Take left off of Route 60 onto Route 657.  Travel 3.2 miles and turn down dirt road on left just past intersection of Routes 657 and 721.  Sites are approximately 200 yards West.

from the intersection of 626 and 604 on the Howardsville Quad, drive approximately 1 and 1/3 miles NW on 604 (left from 626) until a stream crosses under the road.  Pull off to the side and park in the small cleared area on the right (NW) and walk across the street to the SE.
RT. 1, IN COLONIAL HEIGHTS TAKE BRANDLES BRIDGE ROAD TO WAKEFIELD AVENUE.  SITE IS BEHIND WAKEFIELD PARK.
properties.OlacNotes: RECLAIMED OLP-07-01, HAZARDS ELIMINATED: WATERFILLED QUARRY ELIMINATED, 400 FEET OF HIGHWALL ELIMINATED, 4 ACRES, >1,000 PEOPLE IMPACTED

properties.Directions:
-29S
-60E
-at intersection of 60 and 603/Rocky Creek Lane (road off to the left)
-house on right side of 60 directly opposite 603
-site is behind house (Jones family), approximately 40 yards south of road

Take Route 29 South to Amherst, and take exit for Route 60 East.  Turn South onto Route 622.  After intersection with Route 823, traves approx. 5 miles and turn left on Friendship lane.  Take immediate right and veer right when road splits.  Whe road splits into 3, take road to the far right (90 degrees).  Travel roughly 50 yards and site is directly to left.

From the intersection of 624 and 604, drive ¾ of a mile northwest on 604.  There will be a gated access road to the right.  Go down this access road about 0.2 of a mile and take that left.  From this right, walk to the end of the road.  The sites will be about 0.2 of a mile to the east-northeast of where the sites are.

-29 South
-60 East
-turn onto Leisure Lane, go about 1/10 mile
-about 250 yards to right of road to site (must cross barbed wire)

-29 South
-60 East

-right onto 624
-after 2nd bridge, pull off road
-follow overgrown road about 150 yds, turn right and head up thru valley
-sites 102-108 lie very close together towards NE direction
-site 106 at bottom of hill, west of a small stream

From rt 460 on the east side of the New River, take rt 635 N.  Take Old Bridge Road (rt 809) to its terminus on the New River.  Follow the railroad tracks north to the site.

From Bedford, take the Dickerson Mill Road (rt 746) Just before its junction with Stewartsville Road (rt 24) turn north on a gravel drive to 12891 Dickerson Mill Road. Take the spur up to a garage.  The road behind the garage leads to site and beyond.
properties.OlacNotes:
The MRV listing for the site gives the commodity as gold.  I could not find any references for the prospect nor is there are no geologic indications that this would have gold.  The site is in the Goose Creek watershed where the Beale Treasure is thought to be buried.   

There is indications that someone has dug here.  Besides the main site, there is a cut along the road (37.26643, -79.70078) and behind it a small prospect (37.26651, -79.70092).

properties.Directions: North of Villamont. Difficult to get to and difficult to see unless directly over prospect.  On the top of a ridge.
Take Villamont Church Road north from rt 460.  Just after you pass the first gate there is an overgrown road east.  Proceed on foot to the site.
