-after 2nd bridge, pull off road
-follow overgrown road about 150 yds, turn right and head up thru valley
-sites 102-108 lie very close together towards NE direction
-site 107 past stream and on side of hill
Turn south into development off Rt 773
hike in from Rt 629

From Charlottesville, take 64 East to 15 South.  Take a right onto 617 and take another right on a road just after you pass by 631 on your left.  Travel down this road for about ½ mile and it will be on the right side.

From Charlottesville, take 64 East to 15 South and then take a right onto 631.  As 631 veers straight to the left, take the access road on the right.  Find site 205 as previously described and then walk NNE along the ridge.  Site 206 will be located along the edge where the ridge ends.
On Rt 601 west of Rt 600

Take 56 East through Red Apple Orchard, and look for new developements of regraded earth and clearings. There is an unnamed access road that is gated and signs that indicate the future development of a summer camp of some kind. The access road follow a straight path generally, untill it comes to the end of the plateau and winds around to dead ends. At the bottom of the small valley there is a creek. Over the far side hill (NW), and again a creek revisits. There is a steep descent to flatland floodplane, and across the valley a bit to the W site 601 can be found, a bit up the gradual slope and hidden by thickets.
Take Route 20 South to town of Dilwyn.  Turn left onto Route 15 N.  After approx. 5 miles, turn right onto dirt logging road.  Sites are approx. 1.25 east down dirt road and through wooded area.

Take 29 South to Route 60 East.  Take left off of Route 60 onto Route 657.  Travel 3.2 miles and turn down dirt road on left just past intersection of Routes 657 and 721.  Sites are approximately 200 yards West.

From the intersection of 626 and 604. Drive 1.3 miles to the northwest on 604 until you cross the creek.  From the creek, walk west-south-west for about 125 yeads and the site can be found on the side of the hill.

from the intersection of 602 and 724 on the Howardsville quad, drive 1.1miles east down 724 (if you reach a stream crossing the road, you've gone 0.1mi too far) and pull off into the driveway on the right (N) into the hunt club.  From the driveway's intersection with 724, walk 0.2mi NE into the woods until the road merges with a nicer, wider access road.  From the merge walk 0.4mi until the road bends sharply to the left.  From the bend walk 0.1mi directly north into the woods to site 208.
From Beckham take US 605 .4 miles north. Take left on jeep trail (currently Driveway) Go to end of driveway. Take a right where jeep trail splits. Go aprox 500 yrds .

from 626 and 655 go north on 655, go right to stay on 655.  100m before bridge get out and walk to the creek, keep walking west and cross Rucker Run.  site 1/4 SW of beginning of access road, 50 yds from creek.
Take US 29 to  US 56. Go east on Us 56 past shipman to 647. Go south on 647 to 626. Go east to norwood. Look for road going up hill go to end. Sites are 500 yrds up hill.
From 29 South, Take 56 west.  Turn right onto a gravel road just past bridge over Tye River. Quarry is just down driveway on left.
properties.OlacNotes: RECLAIMED BY LANDOWNER

properties.Directions:
SOUTH OF BERLIN APPROX. 1 MILE.  FROM ROUTE 460 AT IVOR TAKE ROUTE 616 FOR APPROX. 6 MILES TO 614.  TAKE LEFT, MINE IS APPROX. 3/10 MILE ON RIGHT  ADJACENT TO SWAMP.  
ETREX STATED ELEVATION 37'  ACCURATE WITHIN 24' LOCATION

Take State Route 60 East until you reach a logging road that goes north.  This road is right before Pat’s Place convenience store and gas station. Take the road 0.6 miles.  About 100 feet to the east of the road there is a shaft.  The brush is very dense and so you will not see the shaft until you are right on top of it.

Take 29 S to 60 E at Amherst.  Take 60 E 10+ miles until just before you reach the James River.  They'll be a road with a number in 800's to your right (I think 810).  Turn right here and site 701 is just around the curve in the road as you reach the railroad tracks.  It's on the left side of the road.

Take 29 S to 60 E at Amherst.  Follow 60 E until you get to 626, a left hand turn.  Turn around and go back up 60.  At the top of the hill there will be a gas station with an access road on the right just past the gas station.  The access road should have a gate on it.  The site is about 150 ft up the right fork of this access road and on the right, about 15 feet from the road.

From Charlottesville, take 29 South to 60 East.  Then take a left on 626.  Pass by 721 on the left and a sharp right turn. It will be located on the left about ¼ mile past the cemetery which is on the right.
Park at Hopewell Gap and hike along ridge line
Drive in private road at Rt601 and Rt629 and then hike into site

From 15 South, you travel across the James River and take a right onto Rt. 652.  Follow Rt. 652 until you pass through Bridgeport.  Just on the opposite side of Bridgeport will be Site 102, on the left hand side of the road.  If you reach the rail, you have gone too far, it is 100yds towards Bridgeport.

From 29 South, take a left onto Highway 56 headed East.  After passing through Shipman, take a right onto Rt. 626.  Follow 626 along the river until you reach the town of Norwood.  Take a right onto Rt. 655 and follow it until you reach Old Farm Loop.  Take a right onto Old Farm Loop and park near the house.  Walk along the creek 500yds and the first site will be on the left, 30ft above the creek and it is the first of a long series of pits at the same elevation.

From Charlottesville, take 29 South to 60 East.  Take a left on 626 and travel for about 6 or 7 miles.  Stop along side the road about ¼ mile before Buffalo station, and it will be about ¼ mile South-Southwest of the road.

From Charlottesville, take 29 South to 460 East.  Take a left onto 608 and then another left onto 721.  Take a right onto 621 and follow it for about 1.5 miles.  When the road bends sharp to the right, get out and walk South-Southeast past 2 prospects to get to the shaft.

From Charlottesville, take 29 South to 460 East.  Take a left onto 608 and then another left onto 721.  Take a right onto 605 and follow it all the way along Stonewall Creek and past 3 left bends in the road.  Then you will see a small 1/8 mile long driveway on the left leading to a house.  Park and walk directly south for about ¼ mile to get to the site.
Park @ Bull Run Natural Area at Beverly Mill on north side of Thoroughfare Gap, and hike in on Quarry Trail.
Enter from Rt 29
properties.OlacNotes: DIABASE

properties.Directions: drive in to commercial development from US29
Park in driveway at education center off Rt600 and hike in.
park in driveway and hike in of Rt600

From 29 South, take a left onto Highway 56 headed East.  After passing through Shipman, take a right onto Rt. 626.  Follow 626 along the river until you reach the town of Norwood.  Take a right onto Rt. 655 and follow it until you reach Old Farm Loop.  Take a right onto Old Farm Loop and park near the house.  Walk along the creek 500yds and the first site will be on the left, 30ft above the creek and it is the first of a long series of pits at the same elevation.
EAST OF COVINGTON - LONGDALE FURNACE EXIT 35 OFF OF I64 - RIGHT EXIT RAMP TRAVEL 850 TO SITE ALONG SIDE OF ROAD.
properties.OlacNotes: RECLAIMED - NATIONAL FOREST

properties.Directions: From intersection of 610 and 609, head E passed pumping station on 609 for 1 mi, merge with 608 and head S another 1.5-2 mi. Turn right or W on 613, follow .25-.5 mi until driveway and old building right before bridge.  Park along roadside, walk a few paces passed old building on the left side. Quarry site will be on your right side directly opposite old building.
properties.OlacNotes: Produced dimension stone.

properties.Directions: Park along Rt 615 near Elm Hill State Game Management Area and hike in along abandoned RR tracks.
enter from Rt 602
Site is visible from route 603 near the sharp bend towards the left. it is in the back yard of a log cabin.

From intersection of 670 and 663, follow 663 W for appx. 75 mi., then turnleft (E) on 613. Follow 613 for .5mi, then turn left onto dirt road (there will be two entrances next to each other, forming a "v" shape).  Site is .25 mi E of where the road splits into two.
From Rt. 87 west, go left on 637 East.  Park at the cemetery about 1 mile down the road and walk about .4 miles southeast to the site.
From intersection of 460 and 726, follow 726 E until major bend in road. at that location, enter woods heading NE and follow ridge appx 1 mi up Chestnut Mtn.  Site appx 200 ft.  NE of peak.
ON ROUTE 10 EAST OF 95 INTERCHANGE GO UP TO RIVERBEND GOLF COURS AND HOUSING DEVELOPEMENT.  SITE IS NOW PART OF GOLF COURSE.

Andersonville directions:
MRV104A302
DMM04929

From the intersection of State Route 20 and US Route 15, go South on US 15.   Then go west on 714 for about half a mile (to the entrance of the Pembalton Estate House).  Park and walk South for half a mile to 302.

Right onto 15S off of 20S, coming from Charlottesville.  Take the 1st right past 714, which will be an unmarked access road.  Continue down this road approximately a half mile and there will be 2 smaller side roads, take the 2nd.  Site 107 is approximately 200 meters down the road on the right.
Turn right (west) onto County Road 756 from State Road 15.  Walk through pasture on right to tree line.  Pit is approximately 300 feet from tree line.

From Stony Point Mills in Cumberland Co., take 620 south across Appomattox River into Amelia Co.  Continue south on 620 to start of red line drawn on the enclosed map. Park at house. Unimproved road shown on USGS map is a faint old dirt road passing north of house, through backyard. A more visible dirt road passing about 200 feet south of the house (not shown on map) merges with this same route. Follow said unimproved road past the horse pasture and eastward up the hill, which is being laid out as a golf course. Road comes to a Y-intersection. Take the right branch, which leads down the hill to a creek. Leave the road and walk northward along the creek about 1/4 mile. Site is 30 feet up on west bank, about 200 feet north of the mouth of a tributary creek coming in from the right.

Going east on State Road Old 57, turn left (north) onto Bethel Lane.  Drive down until road curves to the left and stop at a locked gate.  Walk 150 feet from gate down a gravel road cut to the impoundment.
Intersection of Rt 138 and Meherrin River
Drive north from Mt Calvary Ch on Rt607
From Cole Road head onto 636 then bear east on Forestry Road on 636.  As soon as crossing the bridge along the forestry road the site will be on your right as you head into the woods.

From 609 follow along until reaching the quarry on your right (Still active) once reaching the quarry head along the road to the left until reaching the end of the street.  The site is on the right of the house at the end of the street  in the forested area.

From Rockfish take 639 south to Elma and then follow 641 along until passing over a creek with a ravine on your right and a recreation area before the fork. There will also be a old barn at the fork. Follow the stream upstream until reaching the site.
Take 6 southeast until reaching 890 follow south until reaching 808 bear onto Gold Mine Lane.  Once on Gold Mine Lane follow old Rail Road grade the quarry will be on your right.

Follow 722 south the site, turn right along the third gravel path.  Power lines will be visible from the road across the gravel path.  Follow the gravel path to the bend in the gravel road, head northwest into the field the site will be right in front of you.

From the intersection of state route 612 and Cole Road, travel southwest on Cole Road until the road ends at a T-intersection.  Turn left and continue until you reach the point where the stream intersects the road.  Follow the creek toward the east .  The site is located on the ridge just south of where the stream turns northeast.
Going north on State Road 797 (Murphy Road), make a right (west) onto Road 1101, and follow to the end where the quarry is visible from behind a fence.
properties.OlacNotes: Biotite Gneiss

properties.Directions: Turn north on route 626 from 29N at Five Forks. Follow 626 approximately 3 miles, past several houses and a church on the left, until an intersection with a dirt road. The site is approximately right next to 626, 70 ft. NE of intersection.

from the intersection of 659 and 609 on the quad, turn right (south) onto 659.  Drive approximately 1/10 of a mile south and pull over on the side of the road (is a peak in the road).  The road has recently been straightened.  There is a gated access road on the north side of 659.  Follow this road approximately 1/10 of a mile, then walk 10 yards north into the woods
From 29 South, take a left on 677 East, then left on 622 East, then left on 648 North.  Follow second drainage into Beck Creek you cross while driving.

At the intersection of state routes 640 and 612 heaad south on 612.  After approximately 2 miles turn right onto Cole Road.  Stay on cole road approximately 2 more miles.  Park at the first bridge and head due south.   The site will be located on the ridge after you cross the stream.

From the intersection of state route 20 and US route 15, go south on US route 15.  Take 714 West until you reach the end of the road, where the Pembleton estate is located.  Park and walk ~0.5 miles Southeast.

From Danville, go west on route 58.  then turn right onto route 647 going north.  Go for nearly 3 miles.  Turn left onto dirt road, and park.  Walk west nearly 1/2 mile until you reach a series of houses and old structures

Directions for 109:

From intersection of Rt. 687 and Rt. 220, drive north on Rt. 220 for ½ of a mile.  109 is on the right side of Rt.220 , 10 yards off of the road.
Going east on State Road 57, take the first right (southeast) past the intersection with State Road 777.  At the end of the paved road walk about 200 hundred feet down an unpaved road to the site.
Park on Rt. 87 at the intersection of Rt. 87 and Rt. 220.  Facing west, walk across Rt. 87 .15 miles to the site.

Take the bridge across the river across from the intersection of route 608 and 710. fFollow the stream channel about 20 yards upstream of the bridge till you reach signs for the national forest. The site is 20 yards to the left.

Go southeast on State Road 642, and proceed approximately 1 mile past a trailer park to the south.  Pull into an indentation along the side of the road leading to an overgrown trail and walk south up a hillside about 200 feet to the site.
Hike in along forest road from Rt623

enter from Rt 602

Redbank Gold OLP:
Rt. 58, 3.9 miles on Rt. 601 to Rt. 734, 4/10 mile from Rt. 745 at Redbank. Take a left on Rt. 602, 3.5 miles on Rt. 734. Located behind white house.
properties.OlacNotes:
Merged with DMM8737 on 2/27/2017, record by Allen Bishop, inspected on 11/01/1987. The coordinates for the photos taken by Bishop, those without foliage, are listed as 36.60003, -78.74640.

 Reclamation not recommeded at this time, further research is needed on the mineral owners, shaft reclamation, and extent of the shafts.

properties.Directions: park along Rt606 and walk in
off Rt 604
offRt 734
Rt733

From Charlottesville, take 64 W to 81 S, and soon after getting onto 81S, turn off onto 11S and follow until you reach rt 710.  Take a left onto rt 710 all the way until you reach the river (about 2 miles), and park along the side of the road.

Take 60 E off of 81S, coming from Charlottesville, and continue on 60 E until you see the Buena Vista visitor center on you left.  Take a left just past the visiter center and park in parking lot at the top of the hill.
From Charlottesville, take 64 W to 81 S, and soon after getting onto 81S, turn off onto 11S and follow until you reach rt 711.  Take a left onto rt 711 and follow for about a mile and park the car.

This site is right off of Rt. 29, 0.5 mile north of the turn off onto Rt. 56 in Lovingston (coming from the north, pass Rt. 778 and site is on left side of road behind white house).  The site sits right behind the house, a cut into the hillside.

Take Route 260 and park on an access road 70m South of the older one shown on the map. Follow road East, past a pasture upslope. At the Y-intersection take the right branch.  Approximately 50 m down this road there are indentions from an old logging road on the right.  Take this path approximately 20 m to the site.
properties.OlacNotes: 5B 1C

properties.Directions: On Route 635 park on a access road on the left of the road just after the turn to Court Farm and the right turn onto Route 608.  Follow this road down to the creek.  Then head upslope for about 200 m.  Bear North along the small ridge for approximately 50 m.

On Route 635 park on a access road on the left of the road just after the turn to Court farm and the right turn onto Route 608.  Follow this road down to the creek.  Then head upslope for about 200 m until an evergreen farm.  Head East around the side of the farm for about 100 m.

Off Route 635 park on the left by the sign to Court Farm.  Follow this road down until the peak of the first hill.  Walk to the East about 100 yards into the woods.  The shaft is right beside the fence.

Off Rt. 29, take Rt. 6 east and go about 5-6 miles.  Turn right onto Rt. 800 towards Schuyler.  Site 507 is about 0.75 mile past the turnoff for Rt. 602.  It is a large water-filled soapstone quarry that sits just off the left side of the road. (very accessible from the highway).

From Massies Mill, take 56 along the tye River.  Continue on 56 east and park at the large farm on the right, about 1/2 mile from the intersection with route 151.  From there follow the trail up the hill and the site is a hole in the ground off the trail.

Take U.S. Route 60 through Buena Vista.  Take a left at the Fitzgerald Lumber and Log Company and park. Cross the stream directly adjacent to the Northwest of the camp.  The site is 20 m up the adjacent slope.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: Off Rt. 29, take Rt. 6 east.  Go about between 8 and 10 miles and turn left at the second turnoff for Rt. 717.  About 0.5 mile up 717, take a right into a driveway that curves around to a house.  The site is a fairly large pit right off the right side of the dirt road that runs behind the house.

Off Rt. 29, take Rt. 6 east.  Go about between 8 and 10 miles and turn left at the second turnoff for Rt. 717.  About 0.5 mile up 717, take a right into a driveway that curves around to a house.  A dirt road runs east behind the house.  Take this road up just a little ways and veer into the intermittent stream.  Follow this stream up for about 0.75 miles.  This site is a shallow prospect on east side of stream, about 70 ft. uphill of the stream.
Rt 608 off US360
rt 633 off Rt608

Take state route 607 south through Beverlytown.  Approximately 1.75 miles after Beverly Town and a half a mile after crossing Brown’s Creek, take the light-duty road to the left.  Travel north on this road.  When you reach the Lynchburg Reservoir, take your first left, heading west.  Approximately 0.5 miles down the road there will be a road that branches off to the right.  Take that road to the point where it diverges.  The site is located downhill, ~50 ft due east of the intersection.

Take Route 638 south to Route 636 West.  Turn right onto the first dirt road (about 1/2 mile) after you pass route 614.  Travel approximately 1,000 feet up the road and then head approximately 1,000 feet east to the site.

From the intersection of US Route 60 and 501, go east on 60.  Approximately 0.65 miles east on 60 there will be a left turn into a lumber mill.  Take that left and park at the bridge over the creek.  The site is located between the road and the stream ~ 50 ft past the bridge.

From the intersection of US Route 60 and 501, go east on 60.  Approximately 0.65 miles east on 60 there will be a left turn into a lumber mill.  Take that left and continue down the road until you reach the mill and park.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: Site is precisely at the intersection of 460 and 726.  Site appx. 200 ft. directly behind the restaurant at that intersection.  Quarry lies appx. 40 ft. E of creek, up on hillside.

From the intersection of state roads 648 and 613. Drive southwest 1500 feet and turn left on a private cut road that goes north-northeast.  This road will continue for about 4000 feet.  From the end of the cut road.  Walk north northeast another 1000 feet until the site is reached.

Take 29 S for about about 40 miles, then make a left on 677 for 5 miles and then take a left on 669 for 5 more miles. Then take a right on 663 for about 2.5 miles. Then take a left onto 648 for about 3.5 miles. Park on this road. The site will be on your left.

From US Route 29 South take US Route 460 East.  At the intersection with State Route 626, take 626 north.  As soon as the road crosses underneath an abandoned railroad bridge, there is a residence to the east.  To the northeast of the residence is an old mill.  A creek flows along the north side of the mill.  On the bank opposite the old mill about 500 feet east of 626 is the site.  It is on the hillslope about 10 feet away from the creek.  There is what looks to be an old access road to the site.
FROM INTERSECTION OF INTERSTATE 95 WITH ROUTE 10 TRAVEL EAST ON RT. 10 TO RT. 732.  TRAVEL NORTH ON RT. 732 FOR APPROX. 1 MILE TO INDUSTRIAL SITE ON LEFT.

From Buena Vista city, head east on Route 60. Approximately at city limit, turn left on gravel road leading to lumber yard. Park at lumber yard office and ask permission to cross lumber yard. BE VERY CONSCIOUS OF SAFETY! Make sure lumber yard operators see you. Go to easternmost corner of lumberyard. Climb up the berm and drop down the other side to find a rutted dirt road. Look for where a washout comes down from the northeast. Follow the washout up about 100 feet. Walk beside the washout--NOT in it! The clay/shale slopes are extremely unstable and dangerous. Head of washout is a 20' deep excavation with vertical sides.

park on route 60 near the bend in the road and take the forest road going south west. there is a gate and many no tresspassing signs. follow the road on foot for 200 yards. then find a trail going straigh up the mountain and follow it to the top for about 100 yards.
along Rt 606 at Correctional Facility

From 636 take 609 south bear onto the third dirt road on your right.  A farm will be visible down the road.  Take the right fork along the dirt path until reaching the top of the hill.  Once at the top follow the path to the right to the site.

Following 60 east into Buena Vista, as soon as reaching the outskirts of the “downtown” area two dirt roads will be present on the right before reaching the Visitors Center.  Follow the dirt roads into the clearing, the site will be visible on the hillside to your south (the right).

From 757 follow until reaching dirt path.  Continue straight along the dirt path (posted with a no trespassing sign).  Follow the road until reaching a blue house.  Once reaching the blue house.  Follow the path along then head into the forest until reaching the stream.  Once reaching the stream the site is directly on the other side on the plateau of the hill.

Head East on 6 until reaching 630.  Turn left onto 630 and follow along until passing the first road on your left. Stop at the driveway blocked by a blue fence on your left.  Cross the fence into the field and the site will be to your left around trees.  The site is visible from the road.

From Danville, take route 58 west.  Turn right onto route 855 and go north.  Follow this up for about 1.5 miles, then turn right on dirt road.  go past a cemetary and park.  Walk due south about 1/4 mile to the site.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: northwest side of filtration plant on Rt 637
offUS15
Hike in on dirt road from Rt623

From the intersection of US. Rt 60 and the Blue Ridge Parkway, drive west on Rt. 60 for about 2.5 miles until you get to the Dana factory on your right.  Take a right into the Dana factory drivway and park in the parking lot.  From there, walk about 400 yards N-NE into the woods.

Going south on U.S. Route 220, the site will be only a few feet from the road about a mile and a half past the Drewry Mason High School on the left.  The site is on the right (west) of the road about 200 feet from the 3-way intersection between State Road 687 and the U.S. Route 220 bypass.   The site is immediately past the tree line.
in field of Rt 735
park at Rts 776/734

On Rt. 11, go about 5 miles north of New Market and turn left onto Rt. 730.  Go about 2.5 miles on this road, you will pass a visible quarry on the side of the road.  Past this will be a long dirt road/driveway off to the left with a house on left side of it, up on the hill.  Park here.  Site 103 is on the right side of Rt. 730, directly opposite this drive.  Walk into the woods, cross stream and site is just on other side of stream, in the hillside.

Off Rt. 15, take Rt. 6 east at Dixie.  Follow Rt. 6 through Columbia, go about 0.5 mile past Rt. 690.  Gate on left to old access road beside a creek/flat area.  The first trench/cut of this site is on west side of this access road, about 100 ft in from the paved road, on hillside.  The whole site extends along this hillside, with many long cuts into the hillside.

Take Rt. 60 going out of the northeast end of Buena Vista.  Across from the turnoff onto Maple Ave. (which will be on the right) there is an entrance into a warehouse/distribution center parking lot on the left of Rt. 60.  Park in their parking lot, closest to the woods.  Walk through the woods, slightly west, until you reach Chalk Mine Run.  Go up this stream drainage until you see the red blazes marking the National Forest Boundary line (about 1 mile from parking lot).  Near here is a stream coming into the Chalk Mine Run from the right side.  Follow this stream up until you reach a well-worn path running parallel to Chalk Mine Run.  Go up this path about 200 yards going south (downstream) and then head off to the left up the hillslope.  You should come upon a huge clay pit (site 803).  Continue up the ridge past this pit.  Site should be very near the peak of the ridge, about 0.25 mile past clay pit.

Take route 800 to village of Schuyler. Park at Schuyler Baptist Church at 6395 Rockfish River Road. From the picnic shelter, walk south into the woods and follow the contour of the land around the quarry's northwest highwall to the southwest end of the quarry, where walking in is easiest.

From Charlottesville, go south on Rt. 29 until 2 miles past the Nelson County line, then turn left (east) on Rt. 6. Follow Rt. 6 approximately 4 miles. About 1 mile after Rt. 6 enters Albemarle County, turn left on 630. Go north on 630 about 2 miles. At mailbox 4737, turn into gravel driveway. Follow driveway until it reaches power lines (clearcut). Follow power lines north until they bend sharply to the left. From that point, walk into the woods due east. Look for impounded quarry. If you reach the creek, go no further and turn around to see quarry.

From Staunton bypass (275), go north on 613 about 10 miles. After 753 comes in from the left and then goes off to the right, go about another 1/2 mile on 613. Go up hill, and then down into shallow saddle. At bottom of saddle, turn right onto dirt road. Follow dirt road as it winds around the north end of the quarry, to the gate on the southeast side.
Take Route 6 West until it intersects with Route 639 on the left.  Park just before the intersection and walk upslope 100 m on the North side of the road.
Rt608 off US360

Come north from Staunton bypass (275) on Rt. 613. At the last ridgetop before 613 intersects with Rt. 42 (i.e. if you reach 42, turn around and come back to the last ridgetop), park in front of white farmhouse, numbered 6845. Ask owner (Arey) for permission to visit site.

Off Rt. 29, take Rt. 6 east.  Go about 3 miles (just past county line) on Rt. 6 and park on gravel turnoff on left side of road where gate blocks a long dirt road.  Take access road on northwest side of Rt. 6 and walk for just less than 0.25 miles where the dirt road takes a big bend.  Site 406 is a set of two small prospects and one tailings pile up the south-facing slope of the left side of the access road.
Take Route 630 East.  Take a right on Route 721.  Park just after passing a cemetery and church on the right side of the road.  Hike in on the old road shown  approximately 200 m.
Turn south onto local road from Rt632 and follow to gate. Park and hike to site.
Hike to site from Rt 738

Take 29 south to 6 east.  Pass 632 and at the next road on the right here will be an access road on your left just into the next county that is blocked by a gate.  Park on the gravel turnoff on the left and follow the road about 1.2 miles.  Sites are on the left side of the road and up about 100 yards.

Take 29 south to 60 west through Amherst and toward Buena Vista.  Turn left onto the Blue Ridge Parkway and head south.  Just after the sign for Robinson Gap there will be a road crossing under the parkway.  Park, climb down to the road, and cross under the parkway and take the left fork in this dirt road.  The area to your left along this road is the circled area on the topographic map.

Take 29 south and near Madison Heights take a left on 667, a left onto 662 and then at the fork at Oak Dale Church go left onto 663 and then right onto 648.  Stop after you cross over the third stream and follow that stream to the left side of the road around a major curve to the left 100-150 yards down the stream.  When it curves back around to the right, the site is on the corner on the eastern shore of the stream.

to Jenkins Farm Prospect
Mine site in Reston development on south side of Rt 7, halfway between Dranesville and Browns Chapel. Depression at shaft is enlarging.
properties.OlacNotes:
Copper is in the form of Malacite

RIM AREA OF SHAFT ENLARGING SINCE PREVIOUS INSPECTIONS.

properties.Directions:
to Garland Road Quarry
beside Route 53 at intersection of Garland Rd.

To Old Rivanna Schist Quarry
off Route 161 on Rivanna River

Waller Mine:
Located 0.2 miles off NE side of state road 603, and about 0.5 miles by road SE of junction with state road 605.

Hazards Eliminated = 2 acres, 37 pits ,  3 shafts capped

Farris Mine #2:
From Allisonia, VA., travel Rt. 693 South for 2.5 Miles to Farris Mine Church. Take next left up gravel road to 2nd right, mine is in hollow behind house
properties.OlacNotes:
Reclamation is recommended to alleviate the non-point source pollution resulting from the 5 acres of unvegetated slopes.

The site consists of an open cut with 70'-100' unconsolidated highwalls at the angle of repose. The majority of the walls remain unvegetated with some scrub present. Erosion from the site is limited to what occurs during storm events. Off site damage could not be confirmed but non-point source pollution from the site occurs. The public health and safety hazard is slight to moderate due to the steep highwalls and remoteness of the area. 


The site as it exists is unproductive and is not suitable for any use.  Reclamation would make the area suitable for forestry.

Reclaimed: OLP-91-03

THE MANGANESE MINE POSES AN ENVIRONMENTAL  AND A PUBLIC HEALTH SAFETY HAZARD.  THE DENUDE 30 ACRES CONTINUES TO ERODE AND THE CLAY BANKS ARE BEING UTILIZED AS AN OFF ROAD VEHICLE PLAYGROUND.  TRASH IS BEING DEPOSITED ON THE SITE POSING A HEALTH HAZARD TO THE PUBLIC.  INJURIES TO PERSONS RIDING OFF ROAD VEHICLES ONT HE PROPERTY HAVE BEEN REPORTED.

RECLAMATION IS RECOMMENDED BY, REGRADING, TERRACING, AND REVEGETATING THE AREA WITH A HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL SEED MIX UTILIZED IN THE PAST FOR MANGANESE MINE SITES.  THE TRASH WILL BE REMOVED TO A LEGAL LANDFILL. - 1990 OLAC

properties.OlacNotes:
RECLAIMED OLP-92-03

THE ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS ARE NEGLIGIBLE.  FALL HAZARDS EXIST DUE TO THE AREA BECOMING DEVELOPED AND BEING AN ATTRACTIVE NUISANCE.  15' TO 20' HIGHWALLS EXIST AND WATER DEPTH UP TO 40' ARE FOUND IN THE 150' X 70' QUARRY.  EVIDENCE THAT THE QUARRY IS UTILIZED FOR FISHING EXISTS.

DUE TO THE SAFETY HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE MINE SITE AND THE FACT THAT THE AREA IS BEING DEVELOPED, IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THE SITE BE FENCED.  ELIMINATION OF THE QUARRY IS NOT FEASIBLE.

properties.Directions:
Covington Shale:
Located 0.8 miles SE of Main Street in Alleghany Ave. in the City of Covington.  Alleghany Ave. is also Rt. 220.
properties.OlacNotes:
THE SHALE MINE POSES AN ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC SAFETY HAZARD TO THE CITIZENS OF CONVINGTON. ACIDIC SOIL AND WATER CONDITIONS EXIST AND DRAINAGE ENTERS THE CITY'S STORMWATER SYSTEM.  FALL HAZARDS ARE PRESENT DUE TO THE SITE BEING LOCATED IN THE MIDDLE OF TOWN AND APPROXIMATELY 300' OF 30' HIGHWALLS WHICH EXIST. 

RECLAMATION OF THE SITE IS RECOMMENDED TO ELIMINATE THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC SAFETY HAZARDS WHICH EXIST. WILL INCLUDE REGRADING TO A 2:1 SLOPE, COVERING WITH 4 FEET OF BORROW MATERIAL, AND VEGETATING THE MINESITE.

properties.Directions:
Cofer Prospect:
Located 1/10 mile NW of Rt. 720, then 6/10 mile NE of junction with US 522.
properties.OlacNotes:
RECLAIMED OLP-09-01

HAZARDS ELIMINATED: 7 ACRES REVEGETATED, 1 SHAFT, 800 FEET OF STREAM RESTORATION 50 PERSONS IMPACTED. 

FIRST WAS DESIGNATED 'A'- THE MINE SITE POSES A HAZARD TO THE ENVIRONMENT AND THE PUBLIC SAFETY.  ONE VERTICAL SHAFT IS NOT ADEQUATELY FENCED, OPEN IMPOUNDMENTS ARE PRESENT AND POTENTIALLY ELECTRIC SHOCK HAZARDS EXIST FROM POWER SOURCES ON SITE.  THE SITE IS RURAL, THEREBY MINIMIZING THESE HAZARDS.  ENVIRONMENTAL HARM EXISTS FROM ACIDIC DRAINAGE, SEDIMENT LEAVING THE SITE, AND 5 ACRE SPOIL DUMP CONTINUING TO OXIDIZE AND FORM MORE ACIDIC CONDITIONS.   IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT RECLAMATION TAKE PLACE TO ELIMINATE THE DANGERS TO THE PUBLIC AND THE ENVIRONMENT. ADEQUATE FENCING OF THE SHAFT AND RECLAMATION ELIMINATION OF THE WATER BODIES AND SPOIL DUMP WOULD BE REQUIRED TO TAKE PLACE

NEW CLASSIFICATION 'A(X)'
A REQUEST FOR NEW CLASSIFICATION WAS MADE DUE TO THE FACT THAT EXTREMELY ACIDIC DRAINAGE IS PRESENT AND UNTIL EPA REGULATIONS ARE FINALIZED AND LIABILITY FOR THESE SITES IS CLARIFIED.  IT WOULD NOT BE PRUDENT FOR THE STATE TO RECLAIM THEM.  THE NEW PRIORITIZATION WOULD BE 'A(X)' WHICH MEANS STATE LIABILITY IF RECLAMATION WERE TO PROCEED IN QUESTION.

properties.Directions:
Graham and Robinson Mine:
Located 400' SSE of fork in dirt road.  0.7 miles by road SE from junction with S.R. 693, 1.5 miles by road SW of junction with S.R. 777, S of Hiwassee
properties.OlacNotes: RECLAMATION IS RECOMMENDED TO ALLOW THE AREA TO SUPPORT VEGETATION AND TO ELIMINATE THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY HAZARDS.

properties.Directions:
Farris Mine #1:
From Allisonia, VA., travel Rt. 693 south for approximately 3 miles to farm on left. Travel through farm, past house, to mine site in field at woods line.

Farris Mine #2:
From Allisonia, VA., travel Rt. 693 South for 2.5 Miles to Farris Mine Church. Take next left up gravel road to 2nd right, mine is in hollow behind house.

 Turman Mine:
From Allisonia, VA travel Rt. 693 S for approximately 2.5 miles to Farris Mines Church.  Take next left up gravel drive to field, mine is approximately 1000' NE through woods.

 RECLAIMED OLP-03-02
properties.OlacNotes:
Reclamation is recommended to allow the area to support vegetation and to eliminate the environmental and safety hazards.

RECLAMATION DEFERRED.

*OWNER DOES NOT WANT POND REMOVED- NO RECLAMATION*

THE ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SITE ARE MINOR DUE TO A POND PROVIDING DETENTION TIME FOR STORM EVENTS.  GULLY EROSION FROM THE STEEP UNVEGETATED SLOPES CONTINUES TO OCCUR.  THE LANDOWNER DOES NOT WANT THE POND REMOVED, THEREFOR RECLAMATION OF THE SLOPES IS NOT FEASIBLE.  THE HEALTH AND SAFETY HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SITE ARE DEEMED SLIGHT DUE TO THE REMOTENESS OF THE AREA.

properties.Directions:
Turman Mine:
From Allisonia, VA travel Rt. 693 S for approximately 2.5 miles to Farris Mines Church.  Take next left up gravel drive to field, mine is approximately 1000' NE through woods.
properties.OlacNotes:
RECLAIMED 

14 ACRES OF LAND REVEGETATED, 650 FT OF HIGHWALL AND DANGEROUS IMPOUNDMENT FENCED

PRIOR TO RECLAMATION: THE ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SITE INVOLVE OFFSITE STREAM SEDIMENTATION DURING HEAVY STORM EVENTS.  GULLY EROSION FROM THE STEEP UNVEGETATED SLOPES CONTINUES TO OCCUR, ALSO.  THE HEALTH AND SAFETY HAZARDS ARE DEEMED SLIGHT DUE TO THE UNCONSOLIDATED WALLS BEING AT THE ANGLE OF REPOSE AND THE FACT THAT THE AREA IS REMOTE.

properties.Directions:
Fries Quarry:
Located W of Fries, VA on Rt. 1001.  Directly out of town where dumpsters are located for county.
properties.OlacNotes:
ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SITE ARE NOT PRESENT.  THE SITE DOES POSE A SLIGHT HAZARD TO THE PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY DUE TO THE VERTICAL ROCK HIGHWALL SURROUNDING THE PIT WHERE THE DUMPSTERS ARE LOCATED.  THE HAZARD IS DEEMED SLIGHT DUE TO THE STEEP TERRAIN IN THE AREA MAKING ACCESS TO THE TOP OF THE WALLS DIFFICULT AND THE FACT THAT LOOSE ROCK FROM THE HIGHWALL WAS NOT NOTED.  RECLAMATION WOULD INVOLVE FENCING OF THE HIGHWALL AREA.

RECLAMATION IS NOT RECOMMENDED DUE TO THE AREA BEING NATURALLY RECLAIMED AND POSING NO THREAT TO THE ENVIRONMENT.  FENCING OF THE QUARRY WALLS AT SOME POINT IS RECOMMENDED.

properties.Directions:
The Boyd Prospect:
Located .05 mile SE of State Rt. 659. 1/10 Mile end of junction with State Rt. 151. 1/10 Mile NE of junction with State Rt. 672 in Bryant, south of Zion Hill Church by 75 yards. Park beside church, walk past cemetery into woods about 15 feet.
properties.OlacNotes:
Reclamation is recommended in the form of closing and marking the shaft and removal of the trash and debris in the trench cut. Approximately one acre of disturbance would be involved in the reclamation of the area.

ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEMS DEEMED SLIGHT DUE TO NO SURFACE WATER BEING PRESENT, AREA NATURALLY REVEGETATED INTO HARDWOOD FOREST, AND NO GROUNDWATER CONTAMINATION FROM THE WELL BELOW THE SITE IDENTIFIED.  

Revisited 4/10/2004 by L. Woodworth (UVA) and 10/29/2004 by Davis (UVA)

properties.Directions:
Natinal Park Stone:
Located in Prince William Forest Park on Quantica Creek.
properties.OlacNotes: THE SITE WAS INVESTIGATED WITH NATIONAL PARK PERSONNEL TO DETERMINE IF ENVIRONMENTAL OR SAFETY HAZARDS EXISTED.  NO ADVERSE ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEMS WERE NOTED. THE AREA IS TOTALLY VEGETATED WITH THE SMALL, DISTURBED AREA RESEMBLING A NATURAL OUTCROP.  APPROXIMATELY 40' OF 10' HIGHWALL EXIST BUT DUE TO THE REMOTENESS AND THE FACT THAT NATURAL AREAS EXIST IN THIS AREA WHICH ARE MORE HAZARDOUS, THE DANGER TO PUBLIC SAFETY IS DEEMED REMOTE.  RECLAMATION IS NOT RECOMMENDED.

properties.Directions:
Gossan Mine:
Located .1 miles along service road SSW of junction with S.R. 607, 1.7 miles by road NE of junction with S.R. 721 N of Hickory Flat.  NE adit located at UTM coordinates: N4063700, E507220
properties.OlacNotes:
PORTIONS OF THE SITE HAVE BEEN RECLAIMED.

PRIOR TO RECLAMATION:
POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE ENVIRONMENTAL HARM EXIST IF A BLOWOUT SHOULD OCCUR FROM THE UNDERGROUND WORKING.  RECOMMEND THAT RESEARCH BE CONDUCTED ON THE SITE UTILIZING VARIOUS TECHNOLOGIES CONSTRUCTED UNDER THE ORPHANED LAND PROGRAM IN CONJUNCTION WITH VARIOUS RESEARCH INSTITUTIONS. PUBLIC HEALTH/ SAFETY HAZARDS EXIST DUE TO SHAFT, TUNNELS, AND HIGHWALLS IN PIT.  HAZARDS DEEMED SLIGHT DUE TO THE REMOTENESS OF THE AREA AND THE ACCESS ROADS BEING BLOCKED.

properties.Directions:
Chapel Sand:
Located at the intersectin of Rt. 354 and R. 201 in Lancaster, VA.
properties.OlacNotes:
OFF SITE SEDIMENTATION HAS CREATED ENVIRONMENTAL AS WELL AS PUBLIC SAFETY HAZARDS. COUNTY OFFICIALS AND VDOT PERSONNEL HAVE EXPRESSED CONCERNS OVER THE SITE AND REQUESTED ASSISTANCE VIA THE PROGRAM.  THE SEDIMENT WASHES ONTO STATE ROUTE 354 DURING HEAVY STORM EVENTS CAUSING A VEHICLE HAZARD.  RECLAMATION IS RECOMMENDED. 

CONCERNS WERE RAISED OVER WHO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE RECLAMATION.

properties.Directions:
Tuck Mine:
Intersection of Rt. 768 S and Rt. 672 W. One shaft caved from road, two shafts open. Numerous others on south side of Rt. 672 & west of Rt. 768S. Numerous caved shafts at location 38-59-04 N, 79-28-19W. Both sites are considered the Tuck Mine due to proximity.
About .2 miles west on State Rd. 672 from its intersection with State rd. 678, turn north on dirt road for 525'. Mine is 230' east of road. Mine is also about 230' west of a dirt road to the east of the first road.
properties.OlacNotes: NO ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS EXIST ON SITE.  THE AREA WAS NATURALLY REFORESTED AND HAS BEEN RECENTLY CLEARCUT.  FALL HAZARDS EXIST DUE TO THE OPEN PIT'S 30' UNCONSOLIDATED WALLSBUT THE HAZARDS ARE DEEMED SLIGHT DUE TO THE REMOTENESS OF THE AREA AND THE SLOPING OF THE WALLS AND REVEGETATING THE AREA.  RECLAMATION IS NOT RECOMMENDED DUE TO THE AREA BEING NATURALLY RECLAIMED.

properties.Directions:
Delps Orchard Quarry:
From Wythville, VA, take 21 S for 20 miles to Elk Creek, VA.  At Elk Creek, take Rt. 658 W for 7 miles to Rt. 839.  Quarry is at his intersection to the right.
properties.OlacNotes:
THE ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SITE ARE RELATED TO THE ORCHARD OPERATION AND NOT THE MINE.  THE MAIN CONCERN THERE WOULD BE DRUMS OF UNKNOWN SUBSTANCES STORED NEATLY ON THE SITE.  THE QUARRY IS BEING OPERATED INTERMITTENTLY FOR SHALE TO SURFACE THE ORCHARD ROADS AND THEREFORE IS NOT PERMITTED BY DMM.  THE ORPHANED PORTION OF THE SITE CONSISTS OF A 20' WALL WHICH IS PARTIALLY FENCED.  THE HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE WALL ARE DEEMED SLIGHT DUE TO THE HEIGHT AND THE FACT THAT THE WALL IS SOMEWHAT INACCESSIBLE ON THE STEEP SIDE.

FENCING NOT RECOMMENDED.

RECLAMATION IS NOT RECOMMENDED DUE TOT HE FACT THAT A PORTION OF THE WALLS THAT EXIST ARE SMALL AND NOT ATTRACTIVE TO VISITATION.

properties.Directions:
Tellurium Mine:
Loacted on the NE and SW sides of Forest Road 296, about .55 miles by road NW of its juntion with S.R. 605
properties.OlacNotes:
Public safety hazards are moderate due to 75 plus mine shafts on the site.  Largest is a caved 30' x 30' x 50' shaft.  The area is remote with thick undergrowth from recent logging.  The mine area has been cleared somewhat by a recent exploration crew.

MYRDS No. W030588

properties.Directions:
The Moss Mine:
.2 mile off SE side of State Road 605. .85 mile by road SW of junction with State Road 681.
properties.OlacNotes:
ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEMS INCLUDE ACIDIC DRAINAGE (4.5 PH) FROM THE SHAFTS, GROUND WATER CONTAMINATION FROM THE PROCESSING WHICH TOOK PLACE ON SITE.  SEVENTEEN SHAFTS WITH RIM DUMPS ARE ON SITE AND POSE A SLIGHT HAZARD DUE TO THEIR REMOTENESS. AND THE ROAD LEADING TO THE SITE BEING BLOCKED. 

GIVEN AN 'A(X)' RATI

properties.Directions:
Chalk Mine Run:
From Buena Vista, take Rt. 631 north for one mile.  Take right on Rt. 753 to mine on left approximately one mile.
properties.OlacNotes:
RECLAIMED OLP-91-01

IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT RECLAMATION TAKE PLACE WITH THE FUNDS PROVIDED THE GEORGE WASHINGTON NATIONAL FOREST.

properties.Directions:
Allen Creek Mine:
Located of Rt. 676.  From Shady Lane, travel Rt. 56/151 N of Rt. 678.  Take Rt. 678 until it intersects with Rt. 676, take left on 676 for approximately 1 mile.  Mine site concrete footings on left.
properties.OlacNotes:
A LOW PRIORITY IS RECOMMENDED DUE TO THE NEGLIGIBLE ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC SAFETY HAZARDS WHICH EXIST.

RECLAMATION IS NOT RECOMMENDED.

properties.Directions:
Rivervile 1, 2, and 3:
From Rt. 60 to Rt. 600 for 5.5 miles on left.  1 and 2 mines located at Riverville approximately 400 yards of railroad tracks on left.
properties.OlacNotes: THE ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE MINES APPEAR TO BE MINIMAL.  PH IS 6.5 AND NO EROSION IS EVIDENT.  THE AREA AROUND THE MINES IS HEAVILY VEGETATED.  PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY HAZARDS EXIST DUE TO POSSIBLE CAVE-INS BUT POSE A MINIMAL-MODERATE HAZARD TO REASONABLE PERSONS.

properties.Directions:
Otter River Feldspar-Sims Feldspar:
Take 460 W to Rt. 708, turn right on Rt. 818 to end of private road
properties.OlacNotes: RECLAIMED OLP-91-02

properties.Directions:
Vancluse Mine: 
Located .15 miles along a woods road, off west side of Rt. 67 extended, 1.7 miles by Rt. 667 NNE of junction of Rt. 3, at Wilderness.
properties.OlacNotes:
FIRST GIVEN 'A' PRIORITY RATING (11/30/1988)- RECLAMATION IS NOT RECOMMENDED DUE TO POSSIBLE REMINING.  SAFETY HAZARDS EXIST DUE TOT HE EXISTENCE OF VERTICAL SHAFTS AND PITS.  ENVIRONMENTAL HARM SEVERE DUE TO MERCURY CONTAMINATION OF THE STREAM SEDIMENTS. 
- INVESTIGATE INCLUSION IN THE SUPERFUND CLEANUP

CHANGED CLASSIFICATION- A REQUEST FOR NEW CLASSIFICATION IS MADE DUE TO THE FACT THAT EXTREMELY ACIDIC DRAINAGE IS PRESENT AND UNTIL EPA STORMWATER REGULATIONS ARE FINALIZED AND LIABILITY FOR THESE SITES IS CLARIFIED.  IT WOULD NOT BE PRUDENT FOR THE STATE TO RECLAIM THEM.  THE NEW PRIORITIZATION WOULD BE 'A(X)' WHICH MEANS STATE LIABILITY IF RECLAMATION WERE TO PROCEED IN QUESTION.

properties.Directions:
GO TO STRAUSBURG

 off Rt637
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM04611 on 3/7/2017, record by R. Sobeck (DMME)

properties.Directions: RICHLANDS AIRPORT ACROSS FROM
From Road 808 cross concrete bridge.  Follow path on left side of road (wooden structure on right near path entrance).  At fork in path bear left.
FROM AMELIA COURTHOUSE ON BUISNESS ROUTE 360 TRAVEL EAST TO JUST BEFORE 360 ENTRANCE.  MINE WAS ON RIGHT JUST BEFORE LITTLE WHITE BUILIDNG BEFORE YOU CUT BACK ON GOLF COURSE ROAD.
from Road 220S, make a left on Road 734.  Park at road ben, walk down to path past house on right.  Site is located on the right hand side of the path.
From Road 220S, make a left on Road 734.  Park at road bend and walk down trail past house on right.  Site is located on the right hand side of the path beside the stream.
ON GRAVEL PIT ROAD. FROM WARSAW TRAVEL SOUTH RT. 3 FOR ..5 MILE FROM INTERSECTION OF ROUTE 360 AND RT. 3 ,TO SLINGTON ROAD ON RIGHT. .98 MILES TURN LEFT ONTO GRAVEL PIT ROAD. GO TO END OF ROAD.
FROM INTERSECTION OF ROUTE 3 AND ROUTE 360 AT WARSAW TRAVEL SOUTH FOR .5 MILES TO SLINGTON ROAD.  TRAVEL 1.1 MILES TO ENTRANCE ROAD ON LEFT.
.4 MILES FROM ROUTE 360 DOWN SELFTOWN ROAD IN WARSAW.  ACROSS FROM ASPHALT PLANT.
FROM GRETNA TRAVEL WEST TO JUST BEFORE ROUTE 605.  MINES ARE IN THE WOODS ON LEFT.  401 AND 402.
From Road 220S, make a left onto Road 902.  Park in front of Briggs Auto Service.  Walk into ravine behind building .  Site is located on left in ravine.

From Road 220S, bear left onto 220 bypass.  Make a right onto Road 639, a right onto Road 638, left onto Road 640, park near field on left immediately after snake in road.  Walk through field and enter woods.  Go down and around ravine.  Climb up ravine and site is located through the woods on the right.
From Road 613, make a left onto Round Top Trail, park at the top.  Before parking area, there is a trail on the left.  Follow trail down elevation to site.
From Road 613, make a left onto Round Top Trail.  Site is located off trail on left.

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, make a left onto Road 603.  When the road dead ends, make a right.  Continue west for approximately 1 mile.  Make a left onto a small, unnamed road.  Park, hike up and to the left about 1/4 mile.
From Jonesboro follow 151 South until it intersects 56.  Take 56w until it reaches Saunders' Suvey, Inc.  The site is in the backyard of the business on the hill.

Following 603 east until the road has a sharp bend and turns northeast, there will be a trail that heads north on your left.  Follow the path trail north along the ridgeline the site is right off the trail.

Schwerin Mine:
Located in the Brookstone subdivision.  It is on the S side of a smll creek 1.3 miles S.  60 degrees W of Forest Station.  From Rt. 221 S at Forest take right on Rt. 811 for 2 miles to right on Rt. 622 and 2 more miles to Brookstone Subdivision.  Mine is at the back end of subdivision on tributary of Elk Creek.  Approximately  1/2 mile E of Walton mine.
properties.OlacNotes:
RECLAMATION IS RECOMMENDED DUE TO THE HAZARDS INVOLVED.  UNCONSOLIDATED MATERIAL IS AVAILABLE TO ELIMINATE THE PIT, AS AS MUCH TRASH AND DEBRIS AS IS PRACTICAL IS REMOVED AND LEGALLY DISPOSED OF. 

CONTINGENT ON CONSULTATION WITH DEQ- WASTE MANAGEMENT.

properties.Directions:
Oyster Sand Mine:
Located in Oyster, VA.  Travel 1,750' E of intersection of Rt. 600 and Rt. 639.  Take a left on Rt. 639 and travel 1,000' to the minesite on the left at curve in the road.
properties.OlacNotes:
RESEARCH SITE RECLAIMED BY UVA.

PRIOR TO RECLAMATION: 
RECLAMATION TO ELIMINATE THE PUBLIC SAFETY HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SITE IS RECOMMENDED.  RECLAMATION WOULD INVOLVE THE REGRADING OF THE VERTICAL WALLS TO A 3 TO 1 SLOPE AND REVEGETATING THE AREA.

properties.Directions:
National Gypsum Mine:
Located at Saltville from Rt. 107 travel Rt. 91 N for 3.7 miles to Brick home on right.  Mine is behind home at rivers edge
properties.OlacNotes:
GIVEN AN OLAC RATING OF 'N/A'- RECLAMATION IS NOT RECOMMENDED DUE TO THE FACT THAT THE HAZARDS PRESENT ARE SIMILAR TO THE RIVER BANK HAZARDS AND RECLAMATION IS NOT DEEMED FEASIBLE. 

RECLAMATION ON THIS SITE HAS OCCURRED IN NATURE.

properties.Directions:
Toncrae Mine:
.3 miles off south side of Rt. 605 about 1.6 miles by road south of junction with Rt. 726.
properties.OlacNotes:
RECLAIMED OLP-94-01     

Reclamation is recommended to minimize the environmental and public health and safety hazards associated with the site. A grant has been submitted to the NPS program to assist with reclamation cost and is expected to be funded. Reclamation would involve shaft closure, wetland construction, stream diversion, and mine tailing reclamation.

properties.Directions: Rt. 460 W to Rt. 708, turn righton Rt. 818 to end of state maintenance, take left up private dirt road for approx. 300 yds. to the mine site.
properties.OlacNotes:
OLP 92-04, RECLAIMED

 THE SITE CONSISTS OF A FELDSPAR PIT USED AS A DOMESTIC TRASH DUMP.  APPROXIMATELY 10 TANDEM TRUCKLOADS EXIST IN THE PIT.  GROUNDWATER CONTAMINATION AND THE HEALTH ASPECTS RELATED TO AN OPEN AIR DUMP ARE THE CONCERNS ON THIS SITE.

properties.Directions:
Stephens City Limestone:
Located W of Stephens City, Rt. 631 and Baltimore and Ohio Railroad.
properties.OlacNotes: MINIMAL ENVIRONMENTAL HARM, POTENTIAL FOR GROUNDWATER AQUIFER CONTAMINATION.  NUMEROUS FALL HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH HIGHWALLS AND QUARRY FACES.

properties.Directions:
Mitchell Mine:
Located alond Knights Branch off south side of road, about 1.1 miles SW of intersection with Rt. 606 at Mastins Corner, approximately 1.4 miles SE of Porters
properties.OlacNotes: MITCHELL MINE - CONSENT OF ENTRY ISSUES

properties.Directions:
McDonald Wilson Mine:
Ivanhoe, VA - Rt. 639 1/10 mile. Take right and follow old track road 2/10 mi. Site is located on right at bottom of hill on river cut bank.
properties.OlacNotes:
NO ENVIRONMENTAL HARM OR PUBLIC SAFETY HAZARDS EXIST.  OLD EQUIPMENT IS ALL THAT REMAINS ON THE SITE WITH THE AREA TOTALLY REVEGETATED NATURALLY.

RECLAMATION IS NOT RECOMMENDED DUE TO BEING NATURALLY REVEGETATED

properties.Directions: From Road 808 cross concrete bridge.  Follow path on left side of road (wooden structure on right near path entrance).  At fork bear left.

Following 603 east until the road has a sharp bend and turns northeast, there will be a trail that heads north on your left.  Follow the path trail north along the ridgeline the site is right off the trail.

Follow 603 east past the church until a stream appears on the left side of the road, that cuts to the east.  There will b a gated forestry road right next to the stream also.  The site is right next ot the forestry road.

Follow along 603 east until the road returns back to a paved road, once reaching a clearing on your right with a blocked off forrestry road.  Hike along the ridge line, and the site is right to your right.

From the blue ridge parkway heading south past 603.  The first private road sign on your right will be the path.  Go down the path an take the right fork continue down the road pass the house, and take the second path on your right.  The site will be directly to your northeast.

Follow 603 west, along the gravel part there is a hunting lodge on your left on the other side of the river.  Follow the path behind the house after crossing the river twice follow along the path for approximately one mile the site will be on your right.

From Rt. 29 South, take Rt. 622 to Rt. 663. Make a right onto Rt. 648 and a left onto Rt. 613. Continue approx. one mile and at the sharp left, make a right onto Round Mountain Loop. Continue up to the airway beacon on Round Mountain Trail until the trail takes a sharp and steep right. Follow trail on left approx ¼ mile. Site will be just off the trail on the right.
From Blue Ridge Parkway, make a left onto Road 130.  Make a right onto Road 650.  After crossing river, park near house on right.  Site is located directly behind house.
From Route 29S, turn onto Road 130W.  Make a right onto Road 727.  Make a right onto Road 610.  Site is located next to the river.

From Blue Ridge Parkway, make a right onto Road 686 (after Stillhouse Hollow Parking Area).  Park before blue gate.  Hike about 1 mile on trail until trail splits (straight and left).   Site is located in the woods in between the two divergent trails.

From Rt. 29 South, take Rt. 622 to Rt. 663. Make a right onto Rt. 648 and a left onto Rt. 613. Continue approx. one mile and at the sharp left, make a right onto Round Mountain Loop. Continue on Round Mountain Loop to the top of the ridge. Hike to the top of the ridge, site is just east.

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, take Rt. 603 west past the second road on left. Approx. one mile after getting on 603, and 30ft after creek on left comes together from a split a gated road (driveway in appearance) leading to an abandoned house will be on left. Hike up road approx. 1000ft, past house, crossing creek three times. Continue up the ridge approx ¾ mile. Site will be on left.

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, take Rt. 603 west. Before first road on left, there is a gated road through the field on the right. Hike approx. ½ mile on road up to the ridge. Site is on left as the road splits just before a hairpin bend.

Take 29 South to 130 West, Take a right onto 651,  Cross 5 streams, after 5th crossing when stream is close to the road (on the right) the site will be on your left.  There is also a unmarked dirt road above the site, but unsure how to access it.

Take 29 South to 460 East Business to 460 East.  When you see the Oxford Hills Furnace sign on the opposite side of the road, make a U-turn as soon as possible and park next to the sign.  Walk up the hill and towards the house (slightly to your right).  Site 310 is to the left of the house (if you are facing the back of it) and just past the fringe of the woods.
properties.OlacNotes: Listed by MRV as MRV106A_902

properties.Directions: From Interstate 81, take Rt.11 North from Lexington. Right on Rt. 714, left on Rt. 706 when 714 ends. Right on Rt. 714 at Donaldsburg sign. Left at the fork, cross railroad tracks and turn right onto Rt.608/South River Rd. Take 603 into the George Washington National Forest, cross river and continue to path on left. Hike approx. 1 mile up path to the top of the ridge.

From Rt. 60, turn right on Rt. 501 in Buena Vista. Make a left onto 17th St. and a right on Hawthorn Ave. When Hawthorn ends, make a right. One block to your left will be a ravine. Follow drainage ravine up to the top of the ridge to the path. Go left on the path, up the top of the ridge. After just passing site 105, go left on to a small path as the trail descends and goes right. Continue on trail ¼ mile. Site will be straight ahead and slightly to the left.

From Blue Ridge Parkway, take first left after Upper Otter Creek Overlook. Right at the first fork (don’t cross creek on left). Left at second fork, and left at fork to cross creek. First pit 30ft on left, second pit 20ft from the first, and pool (3rd) 30ft from the second.

From Rt. 29 south, take Rt. 460 east to Rt. 726, to Rt. 609. Take a left on Rt. 611, left at split onto Rt. 750. Continue approx. ½ mile. House on left before T in road. Hike over ridge on right to road cut. Site is in the second valley on the left approx. 30ft up the ridge on the left. Property owned by Stone Ridge Enterprises.

From Rt. 29 south, take Rt. 460 east to Rt. 726, to Rt. 609. Take a left on Rt. 611, left at split onto Rt. 750. Continue approx. ½ mile. House on left before T in road. Site is approx. 4ft off road on the right down the ridge.
From Rt. 29 south, take Rt. 130 west approx. 2 miles. Site is approx. 1000ft on the right after Rt. 650 on left.

Route 29 South, make a right onto 460 East (501 South) towards Appomattox - 460 East turns into Richmond Hwy.  From 460 East turn right onto 726.  Make a right onto 609, left onto Napier drive then a right onto Mockingbird lane, drive up to the gate.  Past the gate walk the path less the 50ft feet away on the gravel path, two your left side you will see a collapsed tunnel or possible gully.

Blue Ridge Parkway South, turn right onto 603, on the very first right turn off of 201, near where it says (Irish Creek on map) there is a gravel path.   Walk up to the slope to the ridge line perpendicular to the path, near the opening of the path.  Site is located on the slope.

Blue Ridge Parkway South, turn right onto 603, a little past the second right turn there is an old white house located on your left side and a gate not to far from it.  Travel parallel to the creek, perpendicular to the creek there is a path to the top of the ridge, the site is located on the slope of the hill.

Blue Ridge Parkway South, turn right onto 603, pass the second right turn, on your left side there is a gate not to far from it.  Walk up the path past the gate. This site is located about half a mile along this path, where there will be a fork in the path, take a left.  This left will lead you to a clearing. Pass through the clearing, after approx 200ft, go up the slope and bear east along the top of the ridge. The entire side of this slope had numerous pits.

Blue Ridge Parkway South, turn right onto 603.  From 603, before the first right turn there is a gated gravel path.  Travel the path, when you get to the fork in the path bear to the left, this site is located right off the gravel path.

Route 220 South. Left on 782. Right on 639. Right after the sign for 638, there is a bend in the road, stop around where it curves back in.  The site is located in the woods, down the valley, and across the stream, behind the residential area.

Route 220 south, left onto 1501 in Rockingham Co., drive back to Henry, this site is located right off the road in a residential area make immediate left on the road bend back into Virginia, the site is located on the right side of the street in the wooded area.
Route 220 South, left onto 734.  Park at road bend. Pass house on the right, follow the forest service road.  This site is located to the right close to the end of the gravel path.

Route 29 South, make a right onto 460 East (501 South) towards Appomattox - 460 East turns into Richmond Hwy.  From 460 East turn right onto 726.  Make a right onto 609,  across from 611 make a left onto the gravel path that leads to a brand new house.  Travel behind the house pass the creek, cut across 3 valleys. Site is located in this vicinity.

Route 29 South, make a right onto 460 East (501 South) – 460 East Appomattox.  From 460 turn onto 726 East, then take a right onto 609 and a left onto 611.  Turn left on Chestnut Mountain Rd and right on Mt Athos.  Located on the left side of the road before the residential area.  Walked through the woods to the left, in the valley behind the homes.  The valley leads to a gravel road, the site is located where the valley meets the path.

Route 29 South, make a right onto 460 East (501 South) – 460 East Appomattox.  From 460 turn onto 726 East, then take a right onto 609 and a left onto 611.  Turn left on Chestnut Mountain Rd and right on Mt Athos.  Located on the left side of the road before the residential area.  Walked through the woods to the left, in the valley behind the homes.  The valley leads to a gravel road, on the other side lie a cluster of trees. Pass the cluster of trees where the no trespassing sign is, walk up the right side of the valley and then along the ridge line.  The site is located on the slope facing east.

Contrary Creek Mine:
Rt. 522, north of Mineral for 3 miles. Sites located on Contraty Creek off bridge on Rt. 522.
2 sites: 1.) Armimius Site and 2.) Sulphur Site
properties.OlacNotes: CONTRARY CREEK MINES

properties.Directions:
Dolomite Quarry:
Take Rt. 613 from Rt. 33.  Turn right on Rt. 732.  The site is located approximately 1 miles down on the right, at an intersection of Rt. 732.

Roadside Shale Highwall:
Along Rt. 250 west, right after Camp Yellowjacket turnoff and right before Wildcat School road turnoff.
Go passed Mount Olive Church on the left, and go another 1/2 mile.  Shale pit is located on right.
From Rt. 42 S, make a right onto Rt. 613.  Follow 613 S for approximately 2.5 miles.  The sites are on the left, about 0.3 miles from the road.
Take 250 W past Moterey, take a right on 640, quarry is highly noticeable from road 2 miles up 640 on the right.
From Williamsville, take 678 S about 2 miles.  Mine is located directly on side of road to the right.
On Rt. 250 W, just after curve after straightaway after Bath County/Rockbridge County line.  Go through the woods and clamber around until you find fallen stones and the main pit.
Take Rt. 250 W towards Monterey; turn left on Rt. 631and site is facing road at the bottom of hill ~800 ft from 250 turn..  Site is clearly visible from the road.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM02289 on 2/27/2017, record by R. Sobeck (DMME).

properties.Directions:
PA. Sand & Glass Co.:
At Weber City take 23 A, take left on Rt. 614-10 miles on left Rt 614 at railroad tunnel through Clinch Mt., 11 miles from US 23.
properties.OlacNotes:
RECLAIMED SPRING OF 1988 FOR $9,800, COMMITTEE APPROVED OF RECLAMATION.

OLP-88-04

properties.Directions: From 624 follow along till the bend in the road making a right onto forestry road before the cemetary
properties.OlacNotes: Double checked by Epp 03/10/2010.  Photos uploaded and observations annotated into record.

properties.Directions: From Route 808 near Midvale head south then cross the woodenbridge across the river.  Following along the path until a path appears to your left in the woods.  Follow the path until the fork in the path and head left the buildings and foundations will be around you and to the left.
From Road 220S, make a left on Road 734.  Park at the bend in the road and walk town path past house on right.  Site is located in woods on left side of path.
properties.OlacNotes: EMERY

properties.Directions: IN TAPPAHANOCK , THE ROAD ACROSS FORM THE VDOT SHOP IS ROUTE 617.  CROSS THE FIRST LITTLE WETLAND ACROSS FROM COLEMAN ISLAND.  PIT IS IN THE LITTLE PATCH OF WOODS BETWEEN THE SWAMP AND THE FARM FIELD.

From 87S, make a left on Road 1501.  When road makes a 90 degree turn, make a right onto Bear Creek Lane.  Past a small bridge, make a left at the intersection.  Bear right at the fork in the road and park.  Hike through woods on right.
On road 151, after a road on the left, pull over by 2 red metal fences and park.  Walk up path past a small wooden structure, site is on left.
From Stapleton travel west down 624 until the second valley on your left.  Treck up the ridge along the ridge line to the site.
From Blude Ridge Parkway take a left on to Route 130, make a right onto route 650, make a left onto Pedlar Ridge Drive.  At the power lines park and walk into lot 20 to site
From Blue Ridge Parkway, make a left onto route 650, site is right next to the road

From Blue Ridge Parkway, make a left onto Road 130.  Make a right onto Road 650.  After about 1.5 miles, park in front of house with Budweiser sign.  Site is across the street, downslope and in front of lake.

Take 64W to 81S, get off at the Buena Vista exit.  Follow signs to route 501, take a right onto it.  After going through town, you will see a large industrial complex on your right.  After crossing next stream take your second left onto gravel road.  Once road takes a sharp right (but there is a dirt road in front of you), get out of the car and walk up dirt road.  You will see a house structure on your right.  Go towards the stream (to your left) at this point.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM041525 on 2/27/2017, record by Varun Soni (UVA)

properties.Directions: Take 29 South to route 725 West, take a right onto 609, follow until there is a house directly across from turn to route 611.  Walk to the back of the property across from 611 in an SW direction.  Once you find the farm pond, follow the stream until you find the site (right hand side of stream, directly after a confluence).

From Interstate 81, take Rt.11 North from Lexington. Right on Rt. 714, left on Rt. 706 when 714 ends. Right on Rt. 714 at Donaldsburg sign. Left at the fork, cross railroad tracks and turn right onto Rt.608/South River Rd. Take 603 into the George Washington National Forest, cross river and continue to path on left. Hike approx. 1 mile up path to the top of the ridge.

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, take a right onto Rt. 605 at Irish Gap. Approx. ¾ mile on your right will be a gated forestry road. Continue on road, crossing the creek 20ft past gate, approx. one mile. Creek will now be on right. Continue on path until the creek splits. Cross creek and hike up the ridge. Site is at the top of the ridge to the right.

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, take Rt. 603 west past Irish Creek and church on right. When the creek on right is crossed and is now on left, there is a gated road on left. Hike approx. 1¼ mile around bend of path, site is up 60ft from path as it turns E.
64 West, turn left onto 151.  This site is located right off of 151, behind Zion Hill Church.  It is (while facing the church) on the far left side of the wooded area in the backyard.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM04963 by Laurel Woodworth (UVA)

properties.Directions: Route 29 South, make a right onto 460 East (501 South) towards Appomattox - 460 East turns into Richmond Hwy. Turn back on Richmond Hwy and stop near the Oxford Furnace (historical sign).  Walk up the ridge line to the right side of the valley.  At the top is where the site is located, less than 30ft from a house.

Blue Ridge Parkway South, turn right onto 603.  From 603, before the first right turn on 603 there is a white house located near a gate.  Gate is entrance to mine area.  This site is located up the path parallel to the creek, in the clearing to the right, less than ½ a mile away from the road.

Route 29 South, make a right onto 460 East (501 South) – 460 East Appomattox.  From 460 turn onto 726 East, then take a right onto 609 and a left onto Pettigrew.  Then left onto Doewood pl. drive up to then of the cul de sac.  This site is located in the field in this residential neighborhood.

From Charlottesville, take 29S.  From 29S, make a left onto Road 624.  Park in the turnaround area (on right).  The road is gated with a chain.  Walk through the woods on left, until reaching a clearcut area.  In the clear cut, follow the path on the left.  Pits are located on the right.
909 is pit on side of the road closest to the woods.  It is opposite of 910.
properties.OlacNotes:
Merged with DMM041598 on 2/27/2017, record by Sutphen. 

Double checked by Epp 03/10/2010.  Photos uploaded and observations annotated into record.

properties.Directions: From Road 614, make a left on Round Top Trail.  Park at the top of the hill.  Follow trail located before parking area downslope to site.

From Road 613 make a right on Round Mountain Loop (sign for Amherst Plantation on right).  Make another right onto Round Mountain Loop.  Make a left onto Round Top trail.  Take the road up towards the beacon (Kelly Quad), right before this road ends there is a path on the left.  Take this path down the hill to it intersects with the next path.  Site 316 will be across and to the left of the intersecting path.

From the North, Route 602 to Mt. Alto, left onto Route 735 to Mt. Alto Baptist Church.  Left onto narrow woods road to gate at abandoned house.  Walk along power line past 2.5 towers.  Site is aprrox 300 ft downslope from power line and approx 100 ft upslope from Hog Creek.

1. Go on US-29 S. 34.1 miles 
2. Turn RIGHT onto VA-56/VA-158/TYE BROOK HWY. 4.8 miles 
 3 Turn LEFT onto VA 151Y/VA-56. Continue to follow VA 151Y. 0.2 miles 
4.Turn SLIGHT LEFT onto VA-151/PATRICK HENRY HWY. 1.2 miles 
5.  Turn left on State Rt. 778. Proceed approx. 7 miles.
6. Turn left on Rt. 60. Proceed approx. 1.5 miles.  
7. Turn left on Burley Hollow Road.  The site is approx. .5 miles southwest of the road entrance on the top and east side of the hill.

FROM INTERSECTION OF 360 & 501 IN HALIFAX, TAKE 501 SOUTH APPROX 2,000 FT.  DRIVE OR WALK WEST ACROSS FIELD JUST NORTH OF SELF STORAGE UNITS.  WALK  TOWARD HALIFAX ALONG NORFOLK SOUTHERN RR TRACKS UNTIL YOU SEE TOOTS CREEK BELOW YOU ON THE LEFT.  DROP DOWN TO CREEK.  OLD TRACE THAT WAS ACCESS ROAD TO QUARRY IS ALONG TOOTS CREEK.  FOLLOW TRACE WEST APPROX 1,000 FT TO ABANDONED QUARRY (MUST FORD CREEK ONCE).

FROM ROUTE 40 & 640 INTERSECTION AT MT. AIRY, TAKE ROUTE 40 WEST APPROX 2,000 FT THEN LEFT ONTO ROUTE 683.  GO APPROX .5 MILE TO WHERE 683 CROSSES STINKING CREEK.  SITE IS ON THE SOUTH BANK OF STINKING CREEK ON THE EAST SIDE OF ROUTE 683.
GO NORTH FROM GRETNA ON BUS RTE 29, RIGHT ON 634, RIGHT ON 670, LEFT ON 671, THEN GO APPROX 0.8MILE.  SITE IS ON RIGHT (EAST) SIDE OF 671
bUSINESS RET 29 SOUTH FROM GRETNA, LEFT ON 676, LEFT ON 689, LEFT ON 685, RIGHT ON 690.  SITE IS TO THE EAST OF 690 NORTH OF THE COLES HILL MANSION.

Take Rt. 257 west past town of Ottobine. make a left onto Rt. 613. Follow 613 south for 5 miles. Site 901 is on right. From site 901 go north on 613 (the direction from which you came) and make a right onto Rt. 727. Follow 727 for approximately 1 mile; make right onto 747. Site 902 is .25 miles on the left.

Dora Coal Mine:
Take 728 to 730 W.  At the fork in the road, near Stokesville, take 718 towards the right.  The mine is 25 miles ahead on the right.
From Warsaw, Rt. 360 E to village, take left on Rt. 600, go one block on 607, 3 miles. take left on 619. 100 yards of left is site.
properties.OlacNotes: NOT A MINE, THEREFORE NO OLAC RANKING GIVEN, NO RECLAMATION NEEDED.

properties.Directions: From 630 take the road at the top of the hill west past gate.  Continue along the road alongside and over stream until reaching houses and clearing.  Continue up the mountain and alongside stream approximately 0.5 mile then up the hill to site.

From Road 613 make a right on Round Mountain Loop (sign for Amherst Plantation on right).  Make another right onto Round Mountain Loop.  Make a left onto Round Top trail.  Take the road up towards the beacon (Kelly Quad), right before this road ends there is a path on the left.  Take this path down the hill to the next path where you take a left and follow it until you get to a turn around in the path and will go into the woods in the direction of the ridge where you will find sites 110-113.
From Saltville, Route 91 toward Broadford.  See owner's address.
properties.OlacNotes: RECLAIMED - OLP-06-04

properties.Directions: Leave Charlottesville on US 29 South. Travel about 30 miles. Turn right onto State Road 56 (west). Travel about 6-8 miles. Turn left onto State Road 151 (south). Travel about 1 mile. Turn right onto State Road 778. Travel about 12 miles. Turn left on US 60 East. Travel about one mile. Site is across the road (715) from the small dump.
FROM GRETNA GO SOUTH ON BUSINESS RTE 29, LEFT ON 676, LEFT ON 689, LEFT ON 685, RIGHT ON 690.  SITE IS ON THE WEST SIDE OF 690 APPROX 1,000 FT SOUTH OF DRIVEWAY TO COLES HILL MANSION

FROM RTE 29 BYPASS AT CHATHAM TAKE RTE 685 EXIT.  GO EAST ON 685 FOR 0.7 MILE TO ABANDONED ROAD (FADED NO TRESSPASS SIGN AT GATED ROADWAY).  PARK CAR HERE OR AT ABANDONED HOUSE IMMEDIATELY TO THE EAST.  FOLLOW ABANDONED ROAD TO POWER LINE, BEAR LEFT ON POWER LINE TO ABANDONED FARM BUILDING.  SITE IS APPROX 1,000 LINEAR FEET 30 DEGREES WNW OF FARM BUILDING NEAR CONFLUENCE OF TWO TRIBS TO LITTLE CHERRYSTONE CREEK.  SITE IS VERY OVERGROWN WITH THORNY BRUSH.
FROM BUSINESS ROUTE 29 IN CHATHAM, TAKE ROUTE 57 WEST, LEFT (SOUTH) ON ROUTE 823 FOR APPROX 0.5 MILE TO GATED ACCESS ROAD ON RIGHT.  PARK AT GATE AND FOLLOW OLD ACCESS ROAD TO QUARRY.
ROADSIDE QUARRY LOCATED AT SOUTHEAST INTERSECTION OF ROUTES 924 AND 668 IN HURT, VA.   NOTE:  QUAD SHOWS THIS AS INTERSECTION OF 634 AND 668.  634 HAS APPARENTLY BEEN RENUMBERED TO 924.

These directions were written as we left the site.
29 South to 56 West. Turn right onto 151 (Patrick Henry Hwy).  Turn left onto 666 (Jonesboro Road).  Turn Left onto Crabtree Highway.  Turn Right to stay on 666 (Dickie's Road).  The gravel road will take you by an apple orchard.  Turn Left onto 827. On the right will be a house with green trim, and what looks like a tony "river" cutting through the yard.  There is a small pull off just after the house with a visible gate and dead end signs.  Follow the trail up.
properties.OlacNotes: ALLANITE

properties.Directions:
From Charlottesville:
-Take 29 South to 56 West
-Right onto 151(Patrick Henry Hwy)
-Left onto 666 (Jonesboro Road)
-Left onto Crabtree Highway
-Right to stay on 666 (Dickies Rd)
-The gravel road will take you by an apple orchard.
-Left onto 827
-On the right will be a house with green/white trim, and what looks like a tiny “river” cutting through the yard.  
-There is a small dirt trail going up the ridge to the east of the house with a visible gate and dead end signs.
properties.OlacNotes: Allanite mined

properties.Directions: FROM ZION CROSSROADS TAKE ROUTE 15 SOUTH TO GOLD HILL THEN LEFT (EAST) ON 622 PAST TRENTS MILL. TURN LEFT (NORTH) ON ROUTE 623 FOR 1.2 MILES TO FOREST ROAD ON LEFT.  TAKE FOREST ROAD 0.4 MILE TO GATE ON LEFT.  PARK AT GATE AND WALK OLD ACCESS ROAD UNTIL IT GOES FROM VEHICLE WIDTH TO FOOTPATH WIDTH WHEN THE QUARRY WILL BE IMMEDIATELY TO THE LEFT.

FROM ZION CROSSROADS TAKE ROUTE 15 SOUTH TO GOLD HILL THEN LEFT (EAST) ON ROUTE 617 TO GRAVEL HILL THEN RIGHT (SOUTH) ON 668.  SITE IS ON THE EAST SIDE OF 668 APPROX 300 FEET PAST THE ROUTE 760 INTERECTION.

FROM ZION CROSSROADS TAKE ROUTE 15 SOUTH TO BELOW GOLD HILL THEN LEFT (EAST) ON 617 TO GRAVEL HILL THEN RIGHT (SOUTH) ON 668.  CROSS OVER HATCHER CREEK AND PARK IN DRIVEWAY OF FIRST RESIDENCE ON LEFT AFTER CROSSING CREEK.  (FENCES MUST BE CROSSED AND ASKING PERMISSION AT RESIDENCE IS RECOMMENDED). FROM THE 668 BRIDGE OVER HATCHER CREEK, THE SITE IS APPROX 1,000 FEET DOWNSTREAM AND APPROX 500 FEET SOUTHWEST AND UPSLOPE FROM THE STREAM.  THE SITE IS LOCATED NEAR THE TOP OF THE HOLLOW AND IS PLANTED TO PINES.
FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 WEST TO ELAM THEN LEFT ON ROUTE 657.  SITE IS IMMEDIATLEY ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF ROUTE 657 APPROX 5OO FEET BEFORE 657 CROSSES FALLING CREEK.
FROM FARMVILLE GO WEST ON ROUTE 460 TO ELAM THEN LEFT ON ROUTE 657.  TAKE ROUTE 657 0.8 MILES PAST CALVARY CHURCH.  PARK.  SITE IS APPROX 100 FEET DUE WEST IN WOODS.
FROM FARMVILLE GO WEST ON ROUTE 460 TO ELAM THEM LEFT ON ROUTE 657.  TAKE ROUTE 657 0.8 MILES PAST CALVARY CHURCH AND PARK.  SITE IS APPROX 100 FEET DUE WEST INTO THE WOODS.

FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 WEST TO PROSPECT THEN RIGHT (NORTH) ON ROUTE 626.  THEN GO RIGHT (EAST) ON ROUTE 625 AND GO EXACTLY 1.4 MILES.  SITE IS IMMEDIATELY TO THE RIGHT IN PASTURE AT HIGH POINT IN ROADSIDE.  SITE IS SURROUNDED BY A CLUMP OF TREES.

FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 WEST TO PROSPECT THEN RIGHT (NORTH) ON ROUTE 626 THEN RIGHT ON ROUTE 652.  GO EXACTLY 1.4 MILES ON 652 TO GATE AT BARRICADED TRACE ON THE LEFT.  PARK.  SITE IS APPROX 1,000 FEET TO THE NORTH WALKING ALONG THE TOP OF THE LOW CREST THROUGH THE WOODS.
properties.OlacNotes:
THIS SITE IS RELATED TO DMM05967 (PROSPECT), DMM05968 (SHAFT) AND DMM05985 (SHAFT)

CONSENT FOR RECLAMATION NOT GRANTED (1/17/1995)

properties.Directions: FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 WEST TO PROSPECT THEN RIGHT (NORTH) ON ROUTE 626 THEN RIGHT ON ROUTE 652.  GO EXACTLY 1.4 MILES ON 652 TO GATE AT BARRICADED TRACE ON THE LEFT.  PARK.  SITE IS APPROX 1,000 FEET TO THE NORTH WALKING ALONG THE TOP OF THE LOW CREST THROUGH THE WOODS.

CONSENT FOR RECLAMATION NOT GRANTED (1/17/1995)

properties.Directions: FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 WEST TO PROSPECT THEN RIGHT (NORTH) ON ROUTE 626 THEN RIGHT ON ROUTE 652.  GO EXACTLY 1.4 MILES ON 652 TO GATE AT BARRICADED TRACE ON THE LEFT.  PARK.  SITE IS APPROX 1,000 FEET TO THE NORTH WALKING ALONG THE TOP OF THE LOW CREST THROUGH THE WOODS.
properties.OlacNotes:
CONSENT FOR RECLAMATION NOT GRANTED (1/17/1995)

THIS SITE IS IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO DMM05966 (PROSPECT), DMM05967 (PROSPECT) AND DMM05985 (SHAFT)

properties.Directions: FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 WEST TO PROSPECT THEN RIGHT (NORTH) ON ROUTE 626 THEN RIGHT ON ROUTE 652.  GO EXACTLY 1.4 MILES ON 652 TO GATE AT BARRICADED TRACE ON THE LEFT.  PARK.  SITE IS APPROX 1,000 FEET TO THE NORTH WALKING ALONG THE TOP OF THE LOW CREST THROUGH THE WOODS.
