THIS SITE IS IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO DMM05966 (PROSPECT), DMM05967 (PROSPECT) AND DMM05968 (SHAFT)

properties.Directions:
I-64 W from Charlottesville.
I-81 S from Staunton
Rt. 60 E to Buena Vista
L on Long Hollow Rd. (Rt. 631) for 4.5 miles
R on Jordan Rd. (Rt. 733)
site is 1.2 miles on left off gravel road

US Route 29S to 56W.  Head South on Route 151.  Turn right onto county road 778.  Then turn right onto county road 666.  The Campbell's house is located on the left, a cemetary is visible on the small hill from the road, fenced in with goats.  The house number is 1138.  The site is located directly behind the house in the woods.  The top of the trench is west, downhill from the shed.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 North.  Take exit 205 (Raphine).  Turn right off the exit ramp on county road 606.  Turn right on county road 604 Gibbs Run.  Bear right to stay on Gibbs Run.  Turn right on county road 620 (Newport Rd) and then left to continue on 620, now Old Providence Rd.  Next, turn right to stay on 620, now Spottswood Rd.  Crossover Interstate 81 and make an immediate left onto unimproved road F213.  Follow the road to the end.

Go south on US29.  Take a right on 158 and continue until you reach 151.  Go left or South and continue until you reach the old Railroad which has been converted into a recreational park.  This is on your left hand side.  Park here and walk down the path until you reach a fence that says not to enter on your left.  Enter it.  Walk a little ways and bear left or West and continue until you see a small stream and some wooded areas and the little rock path disappears.

Take US29S and continue until you see 158W.  Make a right off of 29 to 158 and continue until you reach 151S.  Make a left on 151S and continue over one bridge passing the town of Piney River and some small business.  Right over the bridge, turn left on a small farm access road.  Continue up the road beyond the fence.
FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 EAST THEN NORTH ON 601. GO SEVERAL HUNDRED FEET.  SITE IS CONTIGUOUS TO THE WEST SIDE OF ROUTE 601.

FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 15 SOUTH TO BELOW WORSHAM  TO ROUTE 790.  RIGHT ON 790 INTO BRIERY CREEK WILDLIFE MGMT AREA.  TAKED PAVED ROAD TO END.  THE SITE IS TO THE WEST AND IS PARTIALLY UNDER THE LAKE OR HAS BEEN RECLAIMED AS PART OF THE DGIF PROJECT.

South on US 29 (35 miles)
Right onto VA 56 (5 miles)
Left onto VA 151 (1 mile)
Right onto VA 778 (4 miles)
Right onto VA 668 (4 miles)
Left onto VA 827 (3 miles)
Turn left into gated-off trail after traveling on VA 827 for approximately 3 miles. Trail is right before single story green house (on left side of road)
properties.OlacNotes: Allinite mined

properties.Directions: Take Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 North to county road 620. Turn left on US Route 11 heading North.  Next turn right on county road 666.  Then left on county road 608.  At the bend in the road, an abandoned house with be on the left with an unpaved driveway leading around back past small fallen buildings to a gate.  The gate is unlocked.  Follow the path to reach the creek.  The site is located to the northwest.

Take Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 North to county road 620. Turn left on US Route 11 heading North.  Next turn right on county road 666.  Then left on county road 608.  At the bend in the road, an abandoned house with be on the left with an unpaved driveway leading around back past small fallen buildings to a gate.  The gate is unlocked.  Follow the path to reach the creek.  The site is located to the north.

I -64 W from Charlottesville (30 miles)
I-81 S (40 miles) 
Rt 60 E to Buena Vista (5 miles)
Left onto Green Forest Avenue (200 yards)
Right onto gravel road.
Drive up gravel road to pine stand.
Walk to site from there

I-64 West from Charlottesville to Staunton
South on I-81 to Steele’s Tavern
Take Rt 11-S, and then Rt. 56E toward Raphine.
L on Rt. 608
Right on Fauver Rd.
Proceed to end of road and park.
Site is across stream and SW of parking area at end of road.
properties.OlacNotes: Kelly Bank iron/manganese mines, besides this report, includes DMM051589, DMM051590, DMM051591, DMM051592, DMM051593 and DMM051594.

properties.Directions: FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 EAST TO ROUTE 601. GO NORTH ON 601 FOR 1.6 MILES THEN LEFT ONTO DIRT ROAD. AFTER TURNING ONTO DIRT ROAD GO 0.2 MILE THEN BEAR LEFT AT FORK.  TAKE THIS ROAD TO THE NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILROAD GRADE CROSSING.  PARK AND WALK NORTH ALONG THE RR SERVICE ROAD TOWARD RR CURVE SOUTH OF HIGH BRIDGE.  AT THE MIDDLE OF THE CURVE, FOLLOW ROAD TO RIGHT MARKED BY VERTICAL POSTS (RR TRACKS USED FOR POSTS).   GO 450 FEET TO THE TRACE ON THE RIGHT.  FOLLOW TRACE FOR APPROX 2000 THROUGH THE WOODS BEARING N 30 DEGREES E  TO SITE.  THE SITE MAY BE ABLE TO BE REACHED FROM THE FARM LOCATED ACROSS THE TRIBUTARY FROM THE QUARRY BUT WOULD REQUIRE FORDING THE TRIBUTARY.
FROM THE TOWN OF HENRY, TAKE ROUTE 606 SOUTH THEN RIGHT (S/SW) ON ROUTE 672.  ON ROUTE 672 GO 0.6 MILES TO FARM GATE ON RIGHT.  PARK AT GATE AND WALK ACCESS ROAD N/NW TO SITE.
properties.OlacNotes: KAOLINITE

properties.Directions: FROM THE TOWN OF HENRY, TAKE ROUTE 606 SOUTH THEN RIGHT (S/SW) ON ROUTE 672.  ON ROUTE 672 GO 0.6 MILES TO FARM GATE ON RIGHT.  PARK AT GATE AND WALK ACCESS ROAD N/NW TO SITES.
properties.OlacNotes: KAOLINITE

properties.Directions: 29S, left on 624.  Park in turnaroudn area - walk on path (chain-link gate).  Walk through woods until clear cut area.  Left on pathway in clear-cut on right.

Route 624 past early lake farms until you come to a curve in the road with a opening and gated road on your right, then straight into the woods until you come across a large clear cut. Site 907 is the furthest south workings and is a pit.
properties.OlacNotes:
Merged with DMM041596 on 2/27/2017, record by Sutphen (UVA).

Double checked by Epp 03/10/2010.  Photos uploaded and observations annotated into record.

properties.Directions: from Road 220S, left on Road 734.  Park at road bend.  Walk down to path (house on right).  Site is on right side of road/path.
OUTSIDE OF WARSAW ON ROUTE 360 WEST.  ACROSS FROM INTERSECTION OF ROUTE 360 AND ROUTE 624, LISTED ON TOPO AS SANDPIT.
FROM GRETNA TRAVEL WEST TO ROUTE 605.  TAKE LEFT AND TRAVEL FOR 4/10 MILE TO DIRT ROAD ON LEFT.  GO THROUGH FIELD.  ALTERNATIVELY GO INTO WOODS BEFORE YOU GET TO RT. 605.  MINE IS MARKED ON TOPO.
Follow 617 East then take 693 south until the second dirt road on the right.  A gate will be in front path.  Follow the path along and the site will be on your left and is visble through the forest.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM041577 on 2/28/2017, record by Varun Soni

properties.Directions: Take Blue Ridge Parkway South, take a right onto route 603, after 4th stream crossing there will be a house on your left, pull over to side of the road.  Go through gate near house and walk up stream bed until the site is on your left.

Take 64W to 81S, get off at the Buena Vista exit.  Follow signs to route 501, take a right onto it.  Take a left onto 12th street and then a right onto Hawthorne.  Follow Hawthorne (it is a loop) until you are about to take the second right in the loop.  Park the car and go up the hill where the large storm drain is.  The site is 40 feet up from the road.

Take 64W to 81S, get off at the Buena Vista exit (60 East).  Follow 60 East out of Buena Vista until you see a run away truck ramp on your left.  The site is just up the ramp, but do not park there or else you will get a ticket.

From Interstate 81, take Rt.11 North from Lexington. Right on Rt. 714, left on Rt. 706 when 714 ends. Right on Rt. 714 at Donaldsburg sign. Left at the fork, cross railroad tracks and turn right onto Rt.608/South River Rd. Take 603 into the George Washington National Forest, cross river and continue to path on left. Hike approx. 1 mile up path to the top of the ridge.

From Interstate 81, take Rt.11 North from Lexington. Right on Rt. 714, left on Rt. 706 when 714 ends. Right on Rt. 714 at Donaldsburg sign. Left at the fork, cross railroad tracks and turn right onto Rt.608/South River Rd. Take 603 into the George Washington National Forest, cross river and continue to path on left. Hike approx. 1 mile up path to the top of the ridge.

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, take Rt. 603 west. With creek on left and as land on left flattens out to a field, before crossing creek there is a gated road on the right. Hike up trail to the right of the road to the top of the ridge. Site is approx. 200ft ahead on right.

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, take Rt. 603 west. With creek on left and as land on left flattens out to a field, before crossing creek there is a gated road on the right. Hike up trail to the right of the road to the top of the ridge. Site is approx. 500ft ahead on right as the ridge flattens out.

Blue Ridge Parkway South, turn right onto 603.  From 603, before the first right turn on 603 there is a white house located near a gate.  Gate is entrance to mine area.  This site is located less than 30ft away from the gate to the left of it.

FROM MARTINSVILLE GO NORTH ON U.S. 220 TO ROUTE 657 (APPROX 2 MILES SOUTH OF OAK LEVEL).  FROM 220 TAKE A RIGHT (EAST) ON 657.  ACCESS ROAD TO QUARRY IS ON THE LEFT (NORTH) SIDE OF 657 IMMEDIATELY BEFORE 657 CROSSES REED CREEK.

FROM MARTINSVILLE TAKE U.S. 220 NORTH.  AT OAK LEVEL TAKE ROUTE 674 WEST.  SITE IS 0.9 MILE PAST INTERSECTION OF ROUTE 674 AND ROUTE 672 SOUTH AT MID-POINT IN CURVE.   SITE IS RECLAIMED AND IS NOW PART OF THE LAWN AREA OF HOUSE NUMBER 3335 ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF ROUTE 674 (PHILPOTT DRIVE).

FROM FARMVILLE GO EAST ON ROUTE 460 THEN EAST ON ROUTE 307 TO ROUTE 616.  TAKE 616 NORTH TO INTERSECTION WITH ROUTE 620 AT RODOPHIL.  BEAR LEFT ON 620 (RODOPHIL ROAD).  GO 1.1 MILES TO GATED ACCESS ROAD ON LEFT (11600 RODOPHIL RD).  GO DOWN LANE TO 3 BAY GARAGE WITH APT. ON TOP (OWNERS HOUSE).  SITE IS NOW UNDER THE LARGE POND TO THE WEST.

FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 EAST TO RICE THEN ROUTE 307 EAST TO ROUTE 616 NORTH.  TAKE 616 NORTH TO INTERSECTION WITH ROUTE 620.  BEAR LEFT ON 620 (RODOPHIL ROAD).  GO 0.8 MILE ON 620 TO GATED ACCESS ROAD ON RIGHT (PRIVATE HUNTING CLUB).  PARK AT GATE AND WALK TRAIL TO SITE APPROX 1 MILE N/NE OF GATE.

FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 EAST TO RICE THEN ROUTE 307 EAST TO ROUTE 616 NORTH.  TAKE 616 NORTH TO INTERSECTION WITH ROUTE 620.  BEAR LEFT ON 620 (RODOPHIL ROAD).  GO 0.8 MILE ON 620 TO GATED ACCESS ROAD ON RIGHT (PRIVATE HUNTING CLUB).  PARK AT GATE AND WALK.  GO APPROX 1500 FEET.  SITE IS IN THE WOODS APPROX 50-75 FEET TO THE SOUTH.

West on Interstate 64 out of Charlottesville (15 miles); Take Afton exit (99) and get on Blue Ridge Parkway (.4 miles).  Travel South on Blue Ridge Parkway to VA 56 (22 miles); Travel on VA 56 for approximately 4 miles and turn onto a pulloff on left side of road after crossing a small bridge. Cross road and hike to site.
properties.OlacNotes: NATIONAL FOREST SERVICE  SITE

properties.Directions: Take the Blue Ridge Parkway to 56East (Tye River Rd).  Turn right on county road 608 (S. Bottom Rd).  Turn right on county road 702.  Cross the RR tracks and follow the road to the “end of road maintenance sign”.  Follow the left trail by foot to the lake.  When looking at adit 815, prospect 902 is on the left.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 South. Left exit 180-A, Natural Bridge.  Take State road 11 South to the Natural Bridge.  Turn left on State road 130 East, then right on County road 759.  Turn left on County road 782.  Drive to end and park.  Take trail to the field, follow along the field to view the sites.
Off Rt 654(Feldspar Rd) Between the creek and the railroad tracks
properties.OlacNotes: Information added by Rubinstein 01/05/2015

properties.Directions:
I-64 West from Charlottesville to Staunton
South on I-81
 Left exit at 180A on ST. Rt. 11 South at Natural Bridge
Left on Rt 130 East
Right on County Rd 759
Left on County Rd 782
Drive 11.2 miles to end and park on right
properties.OlacNotes: Revisited on 2/15/2007. Site still has foundations and structures.  To the north of the pit/adit, there is a gushing spring.  It is pouring out about 25-30 gal/min of water into the creek.  It almost seems as if there's a "plumbing" system under the ground.  Perhaps old underground workings?  pH meter was not calibrated, so an accurate measuerment of pH was not possible.

properties.Directions:
I-64 West from Charlottesville to Staunton
South on I-81
Left exit at 180A on ST. Rt. 11 South at Natural Bridge
Left on Rt 130 East
Right on County Rd 759
Left on County Rd 782
Drive 11.2 miles to end and park on right

To get to site 105, take Interstate 81 South to the Raphine/ Steeles Tavern Exit towards Raphine and go on US 606.  When you reach the intersection with US 613, go left.  Continue on 613 until you see a sign for 620.  Take 620 going left and continue until you come to the intersection with 604.  Keep going on 620, but right after the left continuation with 620, pull over.  You should have gone up a small hill, and park next to a small mobile home.  If you have found site 103, hike to the south of it about half a mile and you will come to site 105.

To reach site 107, head on Interstate 64 West towards Staunton.  When you reach the intersection of 64 and 81, bear right, onto Interstate 81N.  Get off at the Fishersville/ Staunton 250 exit.  Bear right onto 250 towards Staunton.  Continue on 250, through the town of Staunton until you reach 42 South.  Continue on 42 South until you reach the town of Goshen, and 39 East.  Take 39 East and continue about 2 miles.  You will see the quarry from the road.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 South.  Take exit 168 (Arcadia).  Turn left off the exit.  Then an immediate left on Lee Highway.  Turn right on county road 622 (Rocky Road).  Travel about 4 miles.  You will pass an open quarry entrance on your right.  There will be a white mailbox on the right.  Turn right here and follow the unimproved road to the private property, no trespassing, no hunting sign.  The land owner is very helpful.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 South.  Natural Bridge exit 180A.  Turn left on State road 130 East.  Turn right on county road 759.  Stop at the Glenwood Furnace sign on the left.  Head into the brush and uphill, follow along the clearing to the left (SE).

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 South.  Take the Arcadia exit, number 168.  Turn left off the exit.  Continue straight on county road 614.  Pass county road 622 on both the left and right sides.  The iron prospect is located approximately 40 feet before Jefferson National Forest sign on the right.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 South.  Take exit 168 (Arcadia).  Turn left off the exit.  Continue straight on county road 614.  Turn right on county road 622.  Arcadia Baptist Church is on the left.  The quartzite quarry is directly behind the church.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 South.  Take exit 168 (Arcadia).  Turn left off the exit.  Then an immediate left on Lee Highway.  Turn right on county road 622 (Rocky Road).  Travel about 4 miles.  You will pass an open quarry entrance on your right.  There will be a white mailbox on the right.  Turn right here and follow the unimproved road to the private property, no trespassing, no hunting sign.  The land owner is very helpful.

Take Interstate 81 South and get off a the Raphine/ Steeles Tavern exit.  Bear left, and head towards Steeles Tavern going East on 606.  When you get to US 11, get on 56 (should be a turn off on your left to get onto 56).  Continue about seven tenths of a mile until you reach 608.  Take a left onto 608, and continue about ¾ of a mile until you see a road that goes over the train tracks.  Park at the end of the driveway, and walk along the path.

To reach site 501, head on Interstate 64 West towards Staunton.  When you reach the intersection of 64 and 81, bear right, onto Interstate 81N.  Get off at the Fishersville/ Staunton 250 exit.  Bear right onto 250 towards Staunton.  Continue on 250, through the town of Staunton until you reach 42 South.  Continue on 42 South until you reach the town of Goshen, and 39 East.  Take 39 East and continue past the sign for the Boy Scout Preserve a little more than 1 mile and there is a small dirt road on your left.  Go down the dirt road, and park at the Swinging Bridge Parking Area.  Go over the bridge, and head north on Hunter’s Trail.  The sites will be on your left.

To reach site 107, head on Interstate 64 West towards Staunton.  When you reach the intersection of 64 and 81, bear right, onto Interstate 81N.  Get off at the Fishersville/ Staunton 250 exit.  Bear right onto 250 towards Staunton.  Continue on 250, through the town of Staunton until you reach 42 South.  Continue on 42 South until you reach the town of Goshen, and 39 East.  Take 39 East and continue past the sign for the Boy Scout Preserve a little more than 1 mile and there is a small dirt road on your left.  Go down the dirt road, and park at the Swinging Bridge Parking Area.  Go over the bridge, and head north on Hunter’s Trail.  Hunter’s trail splits.  Bear to the right, and head down Little Peak Trail.  This trail will split too, and when it does, bear left and go down the Round Knob Trail.  This site is on your right.

To reach site 107, head on Interstate 64 West towards Staunton.  When you reach the intersection of 64 and 81, bear right, onto Interstate 81N.  Get off at the Fishersville/ Staunton 250 exit.  Bear right onto 250 towards Staunton.  Continue on 250, through the town of Staunton until you reach 42 South.  Continue on 42 South until you reach the town of Goshen, and 39 East.  Take 39 East and continue past the sign for the Boy Scout Preserve a little more than 1 mile and there is a small dirt road on your left.  Go down the dirt road, and park at the Swinging Bridge Parking Area.  Go over the bridge, and head north on Hunter’s Trail.  Hunter’s trail splits.  Bear to the right, and head down Little Peak Trail.  This trail will split too, and when it does, bear left and go down the Round Knob Trail.  Continue until you come to a Y intersection, and head down Viewing Rock Trail, the site should be on your right.

Head on Interstate 64 West towards Staunton.  When you reach the intersection of 64 and 81, bear right, onto Interstate 81N.  Get off at the Fishersville/ Staunton 250 exit.  Bear right onto 250 towards Staunton.  Continue on 250, through the town of Staunton until you reach 42 South.  Take 42 South, and turn left on 615.  This will take you over the railroad tracks and over a 1 lane bridge.  Continue up this road, past a small house until you reach a Y intersection in the road.  Park at this intersection, and climb up the hill directly in between the two roads.  This will take you to site 111.

Head on Interstate 64 West towards Staunton.  When you reach the intersection of 64 and 81, bear right, onto Interstate 81N.  Get off at the Fishersville/ Staunton 250 exit.  Bear right onto 250 towards Staunton.  Continue on 250, through the town of Staunton until you reach 42 South.  Continue on 42 South until you reach the town of Goshen and see signs for 39 East.  Go on 39 East, through Goshen Pass until you reach the down of Cedar Grove.  At the intersection of 39 East and 252, right left, and into a small abandoned gas station called “Anderson’s”.  The site is to the west of the gas station.

From Route 808 near Midvale head south then cross the woodenbridge across the river.  Following along the path until a path appears to your left in the woods.  Follow the path until the fork in the path and head left past the buildings and foundations.  Continue along the path until it ends.  The site will be on your right.
.6 MILE NW OF WILDERNESS.  NE SIDE OF STATE HWY. 3 TO THE LEFT OF THE DAM AT LAKE OF THE WOODS.  SMALL PIT IS PRESENT, NOT OTHER SITES NOTED.
ON RIGHT SIDE OF ROUTE 624, 1/10 MILE SOUTH FROM BRIDGE AT CAT POINT CREEK.
From Stapleton travel west down 624 until the second valley on your left.  Treck up the ridge along the ridge line to the site.

Following 603 east until the road has a sharp bend and turns northeast, there will be a trail that heads north on your left.  Follow the path trail north along the ridgeline the site is right off the trail.

Follow 603 west, along the gravel part there is a hunting lodge on your left on the other side of the river.  Follow the path behind the house after crossing the river twice follow the path until it intersects another path .  A stream will be on your right the site is in between the path and the stream.

Follow 603 west, along the gravel part there is a hunting lodge on your left on the other side of the river.  Follow the path behind the house after crossing the river twice follow along the path for approximately one mile the site will be on your right.

From Road 601, make a right onto Road 501.  Make a left onto 10th Street.  Make a right at the dead end.  Make a left into Perry McCluer High School.  At hilltop walk down to trail and follow to site.

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, take Rt. 603 west past the second road on left. Approx. one mile after getting on 603, and 30ft after creek on left comes together from a split a gated road (driveway in appearance) leading to an abandoned house will be on left. Hike up road approx. 1000ft, past house, crossing creek three times. Site is on the left before passing creek again.

Driving Directions: Route 11 South, left onto 714, right onto 706, left onto 714, pass the railroad tracks, make a right at the end of the road.  There is a bridge where the red arrow is, that leads to a path. Travel the gravel path, this site is located at the right of the fork in a clearing, with no trees.

US 29 South from Ch'ville to Va Highway 56, go west to Va Highway 151 and turn north to Va 678 and turn left (west) at St. James Church. Go approximate one mile to the second left turn and park.  Road is blocked. Hike southeast ~0.25 mile to the site.
TAKE ROUTE 360 WEST OF HALIFAX APPROX 14 MILES THEN RIGHT ON ROUTE 698.  GO TO WHERE 698 CROSSES SANDY CREEK.  SITE IS ON THE SOUTH BANK OF SANDY CREEK AT THE 698 BRIDGE CROSSING.
FROM BUSINESS ROUTE 29 AT CHATHAM TAKE ROUTE 57 WEST, THEN LEFT (NORTH) ON 834.  GO APPROX 1,000 FT ON 834 - SITE IS ON LEFT (WEST) SIDE OF 834.

FROM BUSINESS ROUTE 29 AT CHATHAM, TAKE ROUTE 57 WEST TO CALLANDS, THEN ROUTE 41 SOUTH TO LIBERTY CHURCH LOCATED ON RIGHT APPROX 1,000 FT. SOUTH OF ROUTE 817 INTERSECTION.  PARK IN CHURCH LOT.  EVIDENCE OF RAW MATERIAL JUST TO THE REAR OF CHURCH CEMETARY WEST OF CHURCH.  MAIN PROSPECT IS ON WOODED KNOLL WNW OF CHURCH.  FOLLOW DRAINAGE WEST OF CHURCH CEMETARY TO EDGE OF FARM FIELD.  FOLLOW EDGE OF FIELD TO THE NW PAST DENSE PINES TO PROSPECT SITE AT WOODED KNOLL ON THE RIGHT.

FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 WEST TO ROUTE 608.  TURN RIGHT (NORTH) ON ROUTE 608 AND CROSS APPOMATTOX RIVER AT VENABLES BRIDGE. PARK AT GATE ON WEST SIDE OF ROUTE 608 IMMEDIATLEY AFTER CROSSING THE RIVER.  WALK OLD ACCESS ROAD APROX. 500 FEET TO REACH QUARRY WHICH IS LOCATED ALONG THE NORTH BANK OF THE RIVER.

Go US Interstate 64 East towards Richmond and get off at the US20S/Scottsville exit.  Continue down US20S past the town of Scottsville and cross over the James River.  Look out for route 747 on your right.  Continue until you reach the quarry on your left.

FROM SPROUSES CORNER TAKE ROUTE 60 EAST THEN ROUTE 45 SOUTH TO BELOW RAINES TAVERN THEN LEFT ON ROUTE 657 TO GREEN CREEK CHURCH THEN RIGHT ON ROUTE 600 TO RR TRACKS.  PARK AT ELECTRIC SUBSTATION ON WEST SIDE OF ROUTE 600.  WALK EAST ALONG RR RIGHT OF WAY.  SITE IS SEVERAL HUNDRED FEET ALONG RR RIGHT OF WAY IMMEDIATELY TO THE NORTH OF THE TRACKS.
FROM FARMVILLE TAKE ROUTE 460 EAST THEN RIGHT (SOUTH) ON ROUTE 636.  SITE IS A ROADSIDE BORROW PIT ON THE EAST SIDE OF 636 EXACTLY 0.5 MILES AFTER TURNING ONTO 636 FROM 460.

West on Interstate 64 out of Charlottesville (15 miles)
Take Afton exit (99) and get on Blue Ridge Parkway (.4 miles)
Travel South on Blue Ridge Parkway to VA 56 (22 miles)
Travel on VA 56 to VA 608 (7 miles)
Travel East on VA 608  (1 mile)
Take a right onto first major paved road (1 mile)
Park at end of road.

West on Interstate 64 out of Charlottesville (15 miles)
Take Afton exit (99) and get on Blue Ridge Parkway (.4 miles)
Travel South on Blue Ridge Parkway to VA 56 (22 miles)
Travel on VA 56 for approximately 4 miles and turn onto a pulloff on left side of road after crossing a small bridge. Cross road and hike to site.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 South. Left exit 180-A, Natural Bridge.  Take State road 11 South to the Natural Bridge.  Turn left on State road 130 East, then right on County road 759.  Turn left on County road 782.  Drive to end and park.  Take trail to the field, follow along the field to view the sites.

Take Interstate 81 South and get off a the Raphine/ Steeles Tavern exit.  Bear left, and head towards Steeles Tavern going East on 606.  When you get to US 11, get on 56 (should be a turn off on your left to get onto 56).  Continue about seven tenths of a mile until you reach 608.  Take a left onto 608, and continue for about 4 miles and you will pass 666 on your left.  From 666 about two tenths of a mile you will encounter a very hard turn to the left.  Right after this turn, you will see a small rundown house on your left, with a gate behind it.  Open the gate, and continue down the trail until you reach an impassable stream.  Park your car, you are there.

Take Interstate 81 South and get off a the Raphine/ Steeles Tavern exit.  Bear left, and head towards Steeles Tavern going East on 606.  When you get to US 11, get on 56 (should be a turn off on your left to get onto 56).  Continue about seven tenths of a mile until you reach 608.  Take a left onto 608, and continue for about 4 miles and you will pass 666 on your left.  From 666 about two tenths of a mile you will encounter a very hard turn to the left.  Right after this turn, you will see a small rundown house on your left, with a gate behind it.  Open the gate, and continue down the trail until you reach an impassable stream.  Park your car, you are there.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 South.  Natural Bridge exit 180A.  Turn left on State road 130 East.  Turn right on county road 708.  Follow the road to the Rockbridge/Botetourt county line.  Pass a brick house under renovation on the right.  The pit is on the left in the field.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 South.  Left exit 180A at the Natural Bridge exit.  Turn left on State road 130 East.  Right on county road 708.  Turn left on the unimproved road, that runs parallel to the railroad tracks.  Follow the RR tracks.  You will cross over a stream feeding into the James River.  After this stream, the quarry is located 2 power lines further down the tracks.

From Glasgow, VA:

Go North on US Route 501 ~0.5 miles.  The site is ~0.25 miles directly east.  There is a unclear unmarked trail that leads approximately to the site.  The site is not visible from the road.

From Glasgow, VA:

Go North on State Route 679 ~0.5 miles.  Walk on an unmarked unimproved road east 0.25 miles.  The site is on the South facing slope, and is visible from the road.

From Goshen, VA:

Go south along country road 39 ~5 miles, park at designated parking area near swinging bridge.
Walk northeast 0.75 miles on Hunter’s Trail
Walk east 0.5 miles on Little Peak Trail.
Walk north 0.75 miles on Round Knob Trail to junction with Viewing Rock Trail.

Site located 50 yards north of Round Knob Trail approximately 0.125 miles past Viewing Rock trail junction

From Lowesville:
1) S along Rt. 778 ~4.5 miles to junction with State Route 678
2) Go west 0.2 Miles on Rt. 678.  Walk  north 0.125 Miles to Site

From Lowesville:
Go south on State Route 778 ~1 mile to junction with State Route 694
Walk To north of State Route 621, to site. The pit is directly across from St. Mary's church. 

 American Cynamid Wood Pit:
Intersection of Rt. 778 and Rt. 621 at St. Mary's. Pit #1 directly across from church. Pit #2 is a claypit.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM8940 on 2/27/2017, record by Allen Bishop (DMME), inspected on 7/20/1989. Associated clay pit is described in DMM051752.

properties.Directions:
From Lowesville:
Go south on State Route 778 ~1 mile to junction with State Route 694
Walk directly south of State Route 621, to site.
properties.OlacNotes: Includes photos taken by A. Bishop on 7/20/1989.  Associate with large quarry described in DMM051738.

properties.Directions:
From Scottsville Junction of State Route 20 and State Route 6:

Go ~2 miles east on State Route 6.
Walk south along ATV trail, leads to quarries.  Site is ~100 yards from road.

From Raphine, VA:

	Go west on State Route 606 ~0.5 miles.  Turn north and follow State Route 613 ~4.5 miles north.  Turn west on State Route 675, and continue for ~0.5 miles.  The site is immediately off 
	the road to the north.

From Vesuvius, VA:
Go Southeast on State 
Route 56 ~1.5 miles.

Site is immediately off 
the road to the north

From Vesuvius, VA:

Route 56 ~0.5 miles to junction with State Route 608.  Go northeast on State 
Route 608 ~0.75 miles, then turn right onto an unmarked country road.  Drive 
~0.5 miles then park at unoccupied dwelling.  Walk ~0.5 miles beyond 
dwelling on trail; Site is located in bottom area visible from trail.

From Natural Bridge 
Station, VA:

Go South on State Route 759 ~0.75 miles through Greenlee, VA, turn east on State Route 782.  Go ~1.75 miles to the end of the road.  Go directly south ~0.25 miles on the unmarked trail.  The site is located ~120 yards directly to the east.

From Natural Bridge 
Station, VA:

Go South on State Route 759 ~0.75 miles through Greenlee, VA, turn east on State Route 782.  Go ~1.75 miles to the end of the road. Go ~0. 5 miles east on the walking trail.  Continue on the trail past the gate ~.25 miles.  The site is visible uphill to the south of the trail.

from Charlottesville, VA:
- Route 29 South to I-64 East to I-81 South
- Get 501heading East
- Site is right before 501E runs into 663
 River Road is on the left-hand side, by a residential building 
- Continue on overgrown, dirt road for 0.5 miles
- Continue onto dried streambed in SE direction for less than 0.25 miles
- Site should be visible at this point

from Charlottesville, VA:
- Route 29 South to I-64 East to I-81 South
- Get 501 heading East
- Site is near the bridge crossing of Bennet's Run
FROM ROUTE 263 AT BASYE TRAVEL RIGHT ONTO ROUTE 717 FOR APPROX. 1.2 MILES, TO ALUM RUN.  SITE IS ON SIDE OF ROAD AT MYERS FURNACE.

Following 603 east until the road has a sharp bend and turns northeast, there will be a trail that heads north on your left.  Follow the path trail north along the ridgeline the site is right off the trail.

Follow 603 east until the road changes from a gravel road to a paved road.  An white house with a green house will be on your left along with a stream.  Follow the stream along until reaching a path on your left.  Hike up the path to get to the site.

Follow along 603 east until the road returns back to a paved road, once reaching a clearing on your right with a blocked off forrestry road.  Hike along the ridge line, and the site will be on your right.

Follow 603 west past the church until a stream appears on the left side of the road, that cuts to the east.  There will be a gated forestry road right next to the stream . Take the forestry road to the top of the mountain.  The site is towards the northwest end of the mountain.
Take Blue Ridge Parkway and make a left on 650.  Site is off of the road, but further down the hill than is marked on the map

From Blue Ridge Parkway, make a left onto Road 130.  Make a right onto Road 650.  Pull into driveway of house with sign "Ironridge Station," located at house number #2158.  Pits are on either side of driveway.

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, take Rt. 603 west past the second road on left. Approx. one mile after getting on 603, and 30ft after creek on left comes together from a split a gated road (driveway in appearance) leading to an abandoned house will be on left. Hike up road approx. 1000ft, past house, crossing creek three times. Continue up the ridge on path approx ¾ mile. Site will be up the ridge approx. 40ft on the left..

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, take a right onto Rt. 605 at Irish Gap. Approx. ¾ mile on your right will be a gated forestry road. Continue on road, crossing the creek 20ft past gate, approx. one mile. Creek will now be on right. Site is up the ridge on left approx. 60ft.

From the Blue Ridge Parkway, take Rt. 603 west past Irish Creek and church on right. When the creek on right is crossed and is now on left, there is a gated road on left. Hike approx. ¼ mile, site is on the right of the road down approx. 25ft.

From Rt. 29 south, take Rt. 460 east to Rt. 726, to Rt. 609. Take a left on Rt. 799 and continue straight until the road dead ends. Continue going straight through driveway, site approx 5ft from fence of back yard.
Route 220 South, left onto 734.  Park at road bend. Pass house on the right, follow the forest service road.  This site is located to the right, past the clear field, and entering the wooded area.
Route 220 South, left onto 734.  Park at road bend. Pass house on the right, follow the forest service road.  This site is located to the left, very visible from the gravel path, because large.

- I-64 West from Charlottesville to Staunton
South on I-81
 Left exit at 180A on ST. Rt. 11 South at Natural Bridge
Left on Rt 130 East
 Site is approximately 12 miles on left by Creek

From Charlottesville, 64 W to 81 S.  East on 671, after ~25 miles.  South on R11.  east on R666, progress through Lofton.  Left on R608 when R666 ends.  left on small access road, after .75 miles.  park, and walk about .5 mile to site
Take 64W to 81S. Continue towards Vesuvius.  Get on 56E, and go through Vesuvius.  Stay on 56E for ~4 miles and park at hollow with ephemeral stream.  Walk about 1 mile to site.
64W, to 81S.  Take 81S to 664 E.  Continue on 664E to Glasgow, then take 501 north.  Park east of Brady Hill and walk to the top of the hill for the site

From Charlottesville, VA:
-Take Route 29 S to I-64 W
-Get onto US-11 S until 698, head South until about 0.5 miles from Augusta/Rockbridge County boundary
-Turn left heading SE on dirt driveway until it ends and continue on foot for less than 0.25 miles
-Quarry 805 access roads will be visible on right in southerly direction
-Continue on access road, which continues in a circle around prospects 808-811 
-Site will be visible from access road
64W, to 81S.  Exit on 664 towards Glasgow. Continue into Glasgow, and take right on 130W, about 1.5 mile.  Turn off on small side road, crossing railroad tracks.  Site is .1 mile off road.
64W, to 81S.  Left on 664E to Glasgow.  In Glasgow, turn left on secondary road ~.25 mile after water tank.  Follow till the end of the road and site is off the road.

64W to 81S.  Turn left on R11 south of Red Hills. Go through Natural Bridge, and turn onto R130 going East.  Continue on this road through Natural Bridge Station and then take a right on R708.  Site is off the road, near the railroad track

From Charlottesville, VA:
-Take US-29S on to Va-56W
-Get on to 666 heading West
-Turn onto 678 heading South
-Site should be visible from the road on the right (West)
*Railroad grade runs parallel to 678
*Across the road, there is a clearing where there is a barn

From Charlottesville, VA:
-Route 29 South to I-64 East to I-81 South
-From 81S get onto 622 due south
-Veer right onto unimproved gravel road that crosses a stream
-Road ends at residential property
-Continue onto grass trail which will run by sites 406-408

From Charlottesville, VA:
-Route 29 South to I-64 East to I-81 South
From 81S get onto 622 due south
-Follow 622 in southerly direction, road sharply curves left and passes 
Robinson Cemetery 
-Cross creek and intersection of 622 and 614 into Arcadia
-Turn left immediately after Arcadia Baptist Church and follow for 100 ft.
-Trail is visible and runs along ridgeline to 401 and 701, which are visible from the trail

From Charlottesville, VA:
-Route 29 South to I-64 East to I-81 South
-Take 759 in southerly direction toward Natural Bridge Camp for Boys
-Before Faith Church, Glenwood Furnace historical site is visible on left off road
-Follow trail behind Glenwood Furnace to sites 303 and 304

From Charlottesville, 250W to Churchville.  Go right on R42 in Churchville.  Continue through Craigsville, until Goshen.  Turn on R39 and go South.  Turn off on small secondary road about 2 miles down.  Drive .25 mile and note the pit visible from the road.

From Charlottesville, take 64W to 81S.  South of Red Mills, turn left on R11, and take road to Natural Bridge.In Natural Bridge.  Proceed on R130 through Natural Bridge Station, and get on R759 going south, which will cross James River.  Take left on R782, and then take a right on R767.  Continue to the end of the road, park and walk to the quarry site.

From Charlottesville, take 64 W, to 81S.  Turn left on R11 south of Red Mills.  Continue to Natural Bridge, then get on R130, and go through Natural Bridge Station.  Cross over James River on R759 and go south.  Continue till R781, and take a right on this road, heading E. Continue on this road till the site passes, directly off the road.

From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take  VA 684 east to VA 608 E.  This will meet back with VA 684 E, which you should take for about 1.25 miles.  Site 702 is just off the road on the left hand side.
From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 north to Red Mills Rd.  Travel about a mile north along the road to the T-intersection.  Site is about 1000 ft NE of intersection.

From Charlottesville, take US 64 east to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 N.  Proceed along road for short while until VA 11 forms a junction with VA 130.  Travel about 0.5 miles north of junction and strike off road.  Site is several hundred feet west of the road.
From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 south to VA 252 E.  Take VA 725 north, travel about 0.25 miles and site should be within about 500 ft from road’s right-hand side.
From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 south to VA 620 W.  Take VA 604 east and proceed about 0.75 miles.  Site should be about 1000 ft SE of road
properties.OlacNotes: Bauxite

properties.Directions: From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 south to VA 56 E.  Travel slightly over half a mile past the second VA 56 / VA 608 junction.  Take right onto unimproved road and travel to its end.  Site should be about 0.25 miles SW of road.

From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 south to VA 56 E.  Proceed about 2.25 along VA 56 E past the VA 56 / VA 608 junction.  A spur in the road indicates the position from which to disembark.  The site should be about 0.5 miles north of road.
properties.OlacNotes: Rechecked by Edward Epp (DMME-DMM) on 11-21-2006.  Weather was cold and clear.

properties.Directions: From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 north to VA 56 E.  Proceed about 1 mile past second VA 56 / VA 608 junction.  Follow ephemeral stream feature about 2000 ft into steep valley.

From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 north to VA 56 E. Proceed about 2.5 miles past second VA 56 / VA 608 junction.  Strike off the road in a northerly direction where the road’s attitude changes from E-W to N-S.  The site should be about 2000 ft off the road.

From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to the Blue Ridge Parkway S.  Take VA 130 west as far as the point where the road separates from the James River.  This distance is roughly 5 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway / VA 130 junction.  Strike off the road NW.  Site is located on hillside, within a couple hundred feet of the road.
From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to Blue Ridge Parkway S.  Take VA 130 west until reaching the mouth of the Maury River.  Strike off the road due east.  Site is within 0.25 miles of road.

From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 south to VA 130 E.  Follow VA 130 just past Natural Bridge Station and turn right onto the unimproved road.  Travel several hundred feet along this road until locating the power-lines.  Follow the power lines east for a short distance.  Site is located just south of the lines.

From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 south to VA 56 W.  Take VA 666 west to VA 827 N.  Follow VA 827 N about 3 miles until the road splits at a Y junction.  Strike off the road due south.  The site is 1000 ft from the road.
properties.OlacNotes:
Allinited mined.

Revisited 6-21-07.  Can't find feature #707.  Pit may have been back-filled during recent logging activity.  Pit documented during originial visit could not be found.  Photos added.  -Epp 9/4/2007

properties.Directions: FROM LEDA, GO EAST ON 647.  SITE IS IMMEDIATLEY SOUTH OF 647 AT BRIDGE OVER RUNAWAY CREEK

FROM THOMPSONS TAKE 676 NORTHEAST THEN LEFT ONTO 674.  GO SEVERAL HUNDRED FEET TO CHURCH.  PARK AT CHURCH.  SITE IS APPROX 200 FEET NORTH AND UPSLOPE FROM THE CHURCH.  THE CHURCH IS CALLED BLUE ROCK CHURCH ON QUAD -- NOW CALLED CHRIST TEMPLE HOLINESS CHURCH.
properties.OlacNotes: KYANITE

properties.Directions: FROM BUSINESS RTE 29 IN CHATHAM, TAKE RTE 57 WEST, THEN SOUTH ON RTE 823, THEN EAST ON RTE 703, THEN SOUTH ON RTE 822 (PONDEROSA DR.)  GO APPROX 2,000 FT ON RTE 822 TO FARM ACCESS GATE ON RIGHT.  PARK AT GATE AND WALK APPROX 800 FEET TO THE SOUTHWEST ACROSS PASTURE TO PROSPECT AREA (TWO DISTINCT DEPRESSIONS EACH APPROX 5 FT IN DIAMETER)
FROM ROUTE 600 NE TAKE ROUTE 748 TO END OF STATE ROAD AND TRAVEL FOREST ROAD TO SECOND STREAM FORD, SITE IS ON RIGHT STRAIGHT UP MOUNTAIN.

Route 29 South to 56 West.  Then head South on Route 151.  Turn right onto county road 778 and then left onto county road 666.  Bear right at the fork to stay on 666.  Turn left onto county road 827.  Just before a house with a green roof and small creek cutting through the front yard is an opening leading to a path.
properties.OlacNotes: Allanite mined.

properties.Directions: From Charlottesville, go on I-64 W to Staunton. Go on I-81 S to Buena Vista. Take Rt. 60 E to Buena Vista. Go L on Green Forest Road after passing the Visitor Center.  Take the second right on a gravel road, park, and walk northeast to the site.
3 miles SE of New Hampden on Rt 640; 3 miles NW of Monterey.
From Rt 640 take Rt 637 3miles south - on left side.~ 2.25 miles NW of Monterey
On the Robinson River thru a farm near the intersection if Rts 603, 639 & 638.
on the right side of Rt 231 heading north out of Madison
Drive in on Rt 651 at Deep Hollow and hike in from nearest farm at toe of mountain.
On Rt 670, just past Rt 600, NW of Criglersville
On the right side of Rt 211, approx. 1 mile east of Thornton Gap-Skyline Drive.
On Skyline Drive to Gravel Springs Gap; hike in on Bluff Trail.
approx. 0.5 miles north of Zepp on Rt 600
Rt 746 west from Rt600; go past "End of State Maintenance" sign ~ 1000ft.
Rt 746 west from Rt600; park hike in
Rt 746 west from Rt600; hike into woods
Rt 600 to Rt 713; park and hike in
on the north side of Rt 600 at Little North Mountain
Rt 55 out of Strasburg to Rt 660, north on Rt600 to Wilde Acres and in development.
~1 mile S of Wilde Acres along Rt 600
intersection of Hwy 55 and Rt600.
approx. 1000 ft from intersection of Hwy55 and Rt600 on east side
at the intersection of Rt 604 and Hwy 55
Mineral Ridge Mine at the intersection of Rt 600 and Paddy Creek

From US Route 29 South take US Route 460 east.  At the intersection with State Route 626, take 626 north.  Continue following State Route 626 until ½ mile past the border between Campbell and Appomattox Counties.  The site is approximately ¾ of a mile to the northeast of the road on the ridge top of Chestnut Mountain.

Take 29 south to Lynchburg, then take 460 E for about 10 miles. Then take 726 N for about 9 miles. Take the left fork in the road when it arises about 7 miles while on this road. Follow along the creek and park at the top of the hill. There should still be a large mountain on your left. Walk NW to the top of the mountain. Your site is located a few steps west of the peak of the mountain.

Take 29 south to Lynchburg, then take 460 E for about 10 miles. Then take 726 N for about 11 miles. Take the left fork in the road when it arises about 7 miles while on this road. The land will start to get steep, then level off, then become steep again. This is when you park. Walk NE for about 1.5 miles to the top of Chestnut Mtn. The site is on the peak of this mountain.
Rt. 144 just after you cross the Appomatox River and enter Prince George county.  The site is on your right just after the bridge.
OFF OF RT. 144 JUST AFTER YOU CROSS THE APPOMATOX RIVER INTO PRINCE GEORGE COUNTY FROM CHESTERFIELD AND COLONIAL HEIGHTS.  SITE IS ON YOUR RIGHT JUST PAST HARLEY DAVIDSON STORE.
RT. 144 JUST AS YOU ENTER PRINCE GEORGE COUNTY PAST INTERSECTION OF RT. 645.
Nature park

Drive I-64 to Exit 10
Drive east on rte 60 ~.5 miles to county rd 600 (Rumsey Rd). 
Drive County Rd 600 to FS 159 (Jingling Rocks Rd)
Park at first 90 turn in road and hike to sites.
From the intersection of 522 and 618 in Mineral on the Mineral Quad, drive approximately 1 mile east on 618 and park on the side of the road where the creek crosses under the road.
From the intersection of 522 and 618 in Mineral on the Mineral Quad, drive approximately 1 mile east on 618 and park on the side of the road where the creek crosses under the road.
From intersection of 618 and 703.  Drive 2000ft to creek bottom intersection.  Walk North 1000ft.

FROM INTERSECTION OF ROUTE 10 WITH INTERSTATE 95 INTERCHANGE TRAVEL EAST TO RIGHT ON RT. 732.  GO TO RT. 618 TAKE LEFT AND GO PAST MAIN POWER LINES AND TAKE FIRST ROAD TO RIGHT.  GO TO END OF ROAD AND SITE IS THERE.
FROM INTERSECTION OF ROUTE 10 AND INTERSTATE 95 INTERCHANGE TRAVEL EAST TO FIRST TURN ON RIGHT AND LOOP AROUND HOTELS AND BUISNESSES UNTIL YOU SEE PITS.
FROM INTERSECTION OF ROUTE 10 WITH INTERSTATE 95 INTERCHANGE TRAVEL EAST AFTER LAST EXIT TAKE YOUR FIRST RIGHT AND LOOP AROUND HOTELS AND BUSINESSES UNTIL YOU COME TO SITE.
FROM INTERSECTION OF INTERSTATE 95 WITH RT. 10, TAKE RT. 10 EAST FOR APPROX. 3/4 MILE,  TAKE LEFT INTO PARKING LOT.  MINE IS WHERE PARKING LOT, STORAGE AREA IS.
ON RT. 36, 3.9 MILES NORTH OF PETERSBURG, TAKE RT. 645 TO THE LEFT AND TRAVEL UNTIL YOU SEE THE AIRFIELD ON YOUR RIGHT AND JUST PAST THAT IS THE RL REMEDIAL SITE.  THIS IS THE SITE.
From 15 South, take a right on a gravel road after road 714.  Gravel road should have a gate at the entrance before proceeding through a clear cut area.  Gravel road is North of road 630.

From the intersection of U.S. Route 15 and State Route 20 go south on Route 15 until the intersection with country road 714.  Take 714 West until road ends at Pembleton Estate.  Park and walk South along fencing for approximately three quarters of a mile to site 303.

Willis Mountain
MRV103B103
From the intersection of state route 20 and US route 15, go south on US route 15.  Take the first right after 714 and go 1.75 miles down the dirt road.   Site is located less than a quarter of a mile northwest.

Go east on U.S. Route 211 and turn right (south) on State Road 646.  Go approximately ¾ of a mile south on 646 to an unpaved, unnamed road on the left (east).  The road is diagonally across from the Gander farm.  Walk down this road approximately 200 feet to two adjacent quarry.

Go east on U.S. Route 211 and turn right (south) on State Road 646.  Go approximately ¼ of a mile south on 646, the site is on the left (east), and visible from the road.  Several yards down the road is the remains of a decaying building foundation.  The quarry is across the road and several yards from the South Fork of the Shenandoah River.

From Luray, west on U.S. 211. Turn right on 652, left on 647, then right on 645, which goes down a long hill and ends at the S. Fork Shenandoah River. Park near the last gate on the left, walk around the gate, and follow the unimproved road. The river will be on the right, and the quarry building and highwall will appear on the left.
Follow rt 640 in the SW direction from Andersonville about a mile.  Take a left onto rt 612 and go about a mile.  Turn right onto Cole Road and go approximately a mile and park along the roadside.
South on US Route 15, turn left (east) onto driveway immediately before 600. Stop at house, site is in the woods across from house.

From Luray, west on U.S. 211 to community of Hamburg, turn right on 776, right on 647, park at the low water bridge over Mill Creek. Walk in along creek for about 500 feet. Carefully ascend to top of escarpment looming over north bank of creek. Walk west along top of terrace until see first of three drainage gulleys, 5 to 10 feet deep. Second and third gulleys are 50 feet and 80 feet further west, respectively.

From 640 in Andersonville, go south on 638 1/4 mile. Park where road bends to left near 2 houses on left side. Walk into woods along fenceline that starts at corner of pine grove. When fenceline ends at start of clear-cut, stay on broad ridge of high ground heading southwest for another 1/4 mile. Recent logging road covers most of this stretch. From highest point of ground, look for 3 pits w/ tailings piles just NW of logging road, and another pit 200' down hillside to the NW.

From Andersonville, go south on 638, turn left on 637, and left on 609. A quarter mile (or less) along 609, turn right into driveway for Claude Morris farm. Easiest parking is at house. Follow dirt farm road east through gate, across small stream ford, and up into pasture on a hill. Go to easternmost end of pasture and look for site 50 to 100 meters further east in the woods.
From Lynchburg take 640E approximatetly 2 or 3 miles.  Take a left onto rt 726 and continue for approximately half a mile to a mile.

From the intersection of state route 647 and state route 615, drive north along 647.  At the intersection of state route 600 and state route 647 turn left onto dirt road.  Veer right away from the barn and go approximately 0.5 miles until you reach the next fork.  Again veer right and go a little over a half of a mile, where you will meet the next fork and veer left.  Follow that road until you reach the stream, then follow the stream northeast approximately 800ft.  The site is located on the ridge to the southeast of the stream at an approximate elevation of 60ft.

From the intersection of state routes 647 and 615, travel south along 647 about 0.6 miles until you reach a farm entrance on the right (approximately 250ft before a cemetery on the right). Follow the farm road until the end and then travel due north in order to locate the stream.  Follow the stream until you find the fork, then follow the more northerly branch upstream about 800 ft.  The site is located to the east of the stream at an elevation of 20 ft above the stream.

From the intersection of state routes 615 and 614, go northeast along 614 about 0.6 miles and take the first right toward Mt. Sinai Church.  Go straight past the church until you reach the end of the road.  Site is located just north of the end of the road.
From Lynchburg take 640E approximatetly 2 or 3 miles.  Take a left onto rt 726 and continue for approximately half a mile to a mile.

From Lynchburg take 640E approximatetly 2 or 3 miles.  Take a left onto rt 726 and continue for approximately two miles.  Park at the Joshua Falls parking lot immediately before the road bends sharply to the right.
Take 29 S from Charlottesville to 6 E, follow 6 E for approximately 3 or 4 miles.  There  will be an access road with a gate on the left approximately 1 mile past rt 639.

From route 60 take 623 South until running into a hunting lodge on your right.  The road right before the hunting lodge will lead to the cemetary.  Follow the path around to a curve passing the clearing on the right  Once seeing a path perpindicular to the one your on head to the right into the woods.  The site is on the side of the hill.

From town of Amherst, west on 60 about 18 miles . (If you reach the Appalachian Trail crossing you've gone just barely too far.) Turn left on FR38 (Forest Service Fire Road 38). Stay on FR38 as 636 comes in from the left. At T-intersection turn left on FR39. After a little over a mile, turn right on FR311. Go about a mile. At a sharp bend to the right, park and look across the creek at the hillside. The adit entrance should be visible, about 120 feet away.
properties.OlacNotes: Reclaimed by U.S. Forest Service, summer 2008 (Epp, 8/4/2008)

properties.Directions: From Amherst, go west on 60 about 16 miles. Turn left on National Forest Service Fire Road FR38. (If you reach the place where the Appalachian Trail crosses Rt. 60, you've gone just barely too far.) Stay on FR38 until the T-intersection with FR39. Turn left on FR39, go about a mile, and turn right on FR311. After about half a mile, turn right on FR315. Go about a mile on FR315. Park at the highest point of a saddle, just before the road starts to go downhill again. Walk into the woods on a trail heading southeast, along a ridge. The trail will cross over a small rise, a small saddle, and then start to ascend a peak in earnest. The site straddles the ridgetop at the north end of the peak.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: From Lynchburg take 640E approximatetly 2 or 3 miles.  Take a left onto rt 726 and continue for approximately half a mile to a mile.
properties.OlacNotes: 5B 1C

properties.Directions: From Andersonville, head south on 638 then west on 636 take the forestry road past 684.  Head north of the pond on private property.
Take 29 S from Charlottesville to 6 E, follow 6 E for approximately 3 or 4 miles.  There  will be an access road with a gate on the left approximately 1 mile past rt 639.
Take 29 S from Charlottesville to 6 E, follow 6 E for approximately 3 or 4 miles.  There  will be an access road with a gate on the left approximately 1 mile past rt 639.

from the intersection of State Route 211 and country road 675 on the quadrangle, drive 4.5 miles northeast until you pass the gap creek trail sign.  the site is 50ft north of the sign on the opposite side (northwest) of the road.

From the intersection of state routes 600 and 647, go south along 647 approximately 0.5 miles.  Take the first right after the cemetery and go about 0.2 miles where the road turns to the left.  Proceed straight heading south west from the turn in the road.  Follow the drainage down slope.  Site is located 50 ft east of the start of the stream and 300 ft due south of the road turn.
Take 60 E off of 81S, and then take a right onto 501 S.  After approximately a mile, take a left onto 12th St.
Take 60 E off of 81S, and then take a right onto 501 S.  After approximately a mile, take a left onto 12th St.
From Schuyler, take rt 693 S for approximately 2 miles, then turn right on 722 going in the SW direction for approximately 1 mile.  Turn right onto a dirt road and park at the gate.

Take 460 East.  Take a left on 726 North, then a right on 609 East.  Take a dirt road on left after passing under some power lines.  Follow the dirt road to the left until you reach the same power lines again.  Follow these to the left (South) for a few hundred feet, site will be on the left in a wooded area.
From 460 East, take a right on a small unnamed road next to Opossum Creek.  Site will be across the creek on the left after crossing a small bridge.

29 South to 681 East, left on 833 North, Right on 672 South.  Follow 672 to old farm.  Walk down Farm Road to old Norfolk and Western Railroad bed, follow to the right (West) for about half a mile along the James River.  Site will be on the Right.
From 220 North, follow a drainage on your right as indicated on topo map.

Take state route 609 east about one mile until you reach the active mining operation Boxley Aggregates on the right.  Directly across the road is a steep road cut, which can be followed about halfway to the site.  An overgrown trail can be followed the rest of the way to the base of the hill and the site.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: From Buena Vista, take Road 631 North, then a right on 733 East at McCutcheon Church.  Follow 733 to the gate at the George Washington National Forest boundary, which was closed when we visited.  From the gate, walk downhill until you reach a stream.  Follow this stream downhill and downstream to Chalk Mine Run, site is on a point just beyond the intersection of these two streams.

Take 631 North from Buena Vista City. Take a right on 733 East at McCutcheon Church.  Stop at the gate on the boundary of George Washington National Forest, closed when we visited.  Walk downhill to a small stream.  Follow this downstream to Chalk Mine Run.  Follow Chalk Mine Run downstream to the next stream on the left, and follow this upstream.  Mine site is located 20 to 40 feet uphill from the stream on the right.
properties.OlacNotes: 5B 1C

properties.Directions: From the intersection of state routes 710 and 706, travel southeasterly on 710 until it meets state route 808.  Park at that intersection, and use th hanging bridge to cross the South River.  Follow the trail that traces the southeastern side of the river southwest until you reach a tributary that extends to the east.  Follow that tributary approximately one mile.  The site is located uphill on the southern side of the river.
take route 812 North from route 130. follow route 812 all the way to the end and come up on a dead end. at the dead end is a gate from which the site is visible.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: Park at the intersection of state routes 710 and 808.  Use the hanging bridge to cross the south river.  Then head southwesterly on the trail that borders the southeasterly side of the river.  Continue until you reach the tributary extending to the east and then follow the trail on the river’s south side.  Stay on that trail approximately one mile until you reach a distinct right turn in the trail with a clearing on the left. The site is located in that clearing, northeast and downhill from the trail.

Follow road up to the big DANA factory in Buena Vista. The site is licated half a mile to the south of the parking lot. There is a trail leading from the parking lot to the site (this is the old road).
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: Take the trail off route 632 and head south. As you pass under the rail road bridge the road turns sharply to the left. The site is located on the north side about 30 yards away from the road.
located on a trail about 40 yards south of extended 29th street. the site is in a clearing on top of a plateau.

Take route 703 east from rout 11 and go over a hill until you reach route 675 where you take a left and head north about 2 miles. the furnace foundation is on the left about 100 yards from the road near the furnace lutheran camp.
at intersection of route 615 and 675
Walk in from intersection of I85 and Route 46
Walk in off dirt road intersecting with Rt46
walk in on north side of Meherrin River from Rt 715
on Rt 623
enter from Rt 617
properties.OlacNotes: 5B 1C

properties.Directions: From 630 bear right onto 721, the next left after the old Centenary Church is the quarry, there will be a chain across the gravel path.  Travel 30’ down the road the quarry and its workings will all be on your right, with the tailings piles on the left.

From 6 east turn onto 727 north until reaching the first road (driveway) on the right.  Follow the driveway along to pass the house.  Follow the stream along until seeing the tailings pile on the right.
From 6 take 800 take a right onto 602 south and onto Three Pines Road.  The site will be on your left directly before reaching the first house on Three Pines Road.

From Danville, take route 58 West to Axton.  Go right on route 647 approx. two miles.  Turn left at large farm road.  Proceed down to the large barn, near the lake.  Park, and walk approximately 200m west until you reach hill.  Walk down hill to marshy site.

From Danville, take route 58 west.  Turn right onto route 614.  Drive nearly 5 miles up this road until you reach 2 red cottages. turn right here and drive down this road as far as possible. Park, and walk due south through the fields until you reach the site.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: From Danville, take 58 west and then turn right onto 614.  Go about 1.5 miles and turn right onto the dirt road.  Go to the end of the road, park at the cattle guard then walk toward the lake.  The site is on the hill up from the lake.

From Davnille, proceed west on 58.  Turn onto route 614 just east of Axton.  Drive nearly .75 mile and park right off the road. Walk east past the house.  Locate the lake and the site is just up from the lake on the hill along the fenceline with the neighboring property.
From Danville, take route 58 west and then turn right onto route 954 going north.  go about .5 miles, park and walk along the fenceline, until you reach a series of tailings piles

From Danville, take 58 west towards AXton.  Turn right onto route 855 going north.  Then turn right onto 851 at Green's Store.  Proceed about 1.5 miles on 855 and park on the dirt road on the right.  Site is 50 m from the road.

From Danville, take route 58 west to Axton.  Turn left on route 610.  Proceed to the fork in the road and turn right onto route 620.  Go approximately .5 miles on this road and turn right onto dirt road.  Follow dirt road to where it forks and park at this location.  Walk due west about .25 miles to reach the site.
Park along Rt615 and hike into site on dirt road
access from US58
460 East, on left about 1/2 mile after crossing beaver creek.
Off Rt 629 east of Rawlings
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: Rt633 to RockyMillBridge
walk in through residential area behind abandoned BI plant

From the Intersection of VA Rt. 624 and VA Rt. 661, drive south on 661 for 1 mile.  Take a right onto the private road for the Center for the Arts.  Drive north on this road for .4 miles until you see a fenced-in cow pasture on your right.  The pit is on your right and is visible from the road.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: off US15
From the intersection of US Rt. 60 and VA Rt 631, drive north for .5 miles.  Pull into the driveway on your right- the highwall is visable from the road.
From the intersection of US Rt. 60 and VA Rt 631, drive east on Rt. 60 for a mile.  Park on the clearing on the right side of the road.  Walk .4 miles uphill, northeast into the woods.

From Schuyler, take rt 800 in the NE direction for approximately ¼ mile.  Take your second left after the New World Stone Quarry/Factory.  Continue for about a ½ mile and park on the side of the dirt road.
From the intersection of US Rt. 60 and VA Rt 631, drive east on Rt. 60 for a mile.  Park on the clearing on the right side of the road.  Walk .3 northeast, uphill into the woods.

From the intersection of US Rt. 60 and US. Rt 501, drive south on Rt. 501 for about 5 miles.  After you pass Lowry Run Hollow, take a right on the dirt road and drive for .6 miles.  The site is on top of the hill 50 yards west, on the right side of the road.
properties.OlacNotes: 1A 5B

properties.Directions: From intersection of Rt 130 and Rt. 812, go North on Rt 812.  Go all the way to the end on Rt. 812 and park at the gate.  Walk E-NE all the way up the old trucking road (about .35 miles).
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: From the intersection of US Rt. 60 and US Forest Route 39 (Across Rt. 60 from VA Rt 605), drive south on Rt. 39 four about 8 miles.  Take at right at BM 1105, and drive for about 1 mile.  503 is on your right directly off of the road.
properties.OlacNotes: Reclaimed by U.S. Forest Service, summer 2008 (Epp, 8/4/2008)

properties.Directions: From the intersection of US Rt. 60 and US Forest Route 39 (Across Rt. 60 from VA Rt 605), drive south on Rt. 39 four about 8 miles.  Take at right at BM 1105, and drive for about .5 miles.  Take a right on the fire road and drive north for 2 miles.  Park and walk east, uphill into the woods for .25 miles.

From the Intersection of Rt. 638 and Rt. 782, travel north on Rt. 782 for 3/4ths of a mile.  Take your first right, drive to the end of the driveway.  Walk northeast through the horse field for about 400 yards to the site.
From the intersection for Rt. 640 and Rt. 642, travel north on Rt. 642 for 1 mile.  Park at the top of the hill and walk 300 yards southwest, downhill, through the clear-cut field, to the site.
Take the bridge across the river at the intersection of route 608 and 710. take the trailwhich is about 60 yards upstream from the bridge. Walk along the trail for thirty yards and find the site.
Going east on Old 57 State Road, bear right (south) onto State Route 777.  The site is a few hundred feet down, directly on the left (east) side of the road.
take 603 to where the stream runs paralell to the road near a 90 degree right turn. follow the stream for about 1.2 a mile and reach a cut out area which is the site.
From US Rt. 220 South, take US Rt. 220 Business South for about ¼ of a mile.  Park across from the mini-mart and walk about 150 yards east of rt. 220 business.

Going east on State Road 87, turn left (northeast), onto State Road 750 and go approximately ¼ mile, passing a trailer park to the west, and turn right onto a private road.  Walk down private road to tree line and proceed northwest, parallel to the ravine for about 500 feet on foot until you reach the site.

Going east on State Road 87, turn right (south), onto State Road 637 and go approximately ½ mile, passing New Bethel Church to the west, and turn and park on the road passed on the left.  Walk approximately 200 feet east, parallel to the gully, and the site is on the northeast slope.

Going north on State Road 782, and immediately after the intersection with state road 638, turn left (west) onto Cemetery Road.  This road is unpaved; park here and walk southwest into the tree line about 100 feet to the site.

Going northeast on County Road 706, turn right at the fork onto State Road 711.  Go down the road to a 3-way intersection, park and walk down a private gravel road to a small cabin.  Cross the adjacent bridge over the stream, and proceed south-southeast alongside the stream to the site.  It is on the left 15 feet before the train tracks.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: off roadside on Rt606
at Intersection Rts 735/734

On Rt. 11, go about 5 miles north of New Market and turn left onto Rt. 730.  Go about 2.5 miles on this road, you will pass a visible quarry on the side of the road.  Past this will be a long dirt road/driveway off to the left with a house on left side of it, up on the hill.  Quarry is just up this road about 50 yards, on the right side of road.
corner at Rts734/776
off Rt 737

Take 60 E off of 81S, coming from Charlottesville, and continue on 60 E until you see the Buena Vista visitor center on you left.  Take a left just past the visiter center and park in parking lot at the top of the hill.

At Lovingston, take Rt. 56 south.  At Dentons Corner take Rt 60 east, then right onto Rt. 633.  Get off on Rt. 640, go through Enonville, then to Andersonville.  Turn off onto Rt. 638, south to Rt. 636 east.  After about 1 mile, take right onto Rt.609.  After about 1.75 miles there will be a long dirt road on right, running parallel to the right side of a large farm field.  Walk up this past an old cemetery and straight into the hills along the road.  After .75 - 1.0 miles past the cemetery, head off to the right up very steep slope.  Site 802 is on top off a ridge, just below the peak and the two holes are behind some big granite boulders.

Off Rt. 15, take Rt. 6 east at Dixie.  Just over 2.5 miles, take a right onto Rt. 656 and then a right onto Rt. 654.    After the road passes through Cloverdale, go about 0.75 miles and take a left onto long dirt/gravel road through the woods.  This road runs along a very flat area of woods.  After about 0.5 miles you will reach a place where the road curves around.  Park here, keep walking along the road until it reaches a stream crossing.  The site is on west side of the creek on the hillslope.
properties.OlacNotes: dimension stone cut from the granite.

properties.Directions: From Duncan’s Store in Cumberland County, take Rt. 510 east for about1.25 miles.  Take gravel road on left for about 0.5 mile and park.  Follow creek to east of road through woods until you reach a concrete bridge.  Prospects are across the bridge.
properties.OlacNotes: Produced Dimension Stone

properties.Directions: Take Rt. 60 going out of the northeast end of Buena Vista.  Across from the turnoff onto Maple Ave. (which will be on the right) there is an entrance into a warehouse/distribution center parking lot on the left of Rt. 60.  Park in their parking lot, closest to the woods.  Walk through the woods, slightly west, until you reach Chalk Mine Run.  Go up this stream drainage until you see the red blazes marking the National Forest Boundary line (about 1 mile from parking lot).  Near here is a stream coming into the Chalk Mine Run from the right side.  Follow this stream up until you reach a well-worn path running parallel to Chalk Mine Run.  Keep following the stream (or up the ridge that parallels the stream) about 1/8 of a mile.  Site is on the hillslope to the right of the stream and is an adit-looking pit.

Take Rt. 60 going out of the northeast end of Buena Vista.  Across from the turnoff onto Maple Ave. (which will be on the right) there is an entrance into a warehouse/distribution center parking lot on the left of Rt. 60.  Park in their parking lot, closest to the woods.  Walk through the woods, slightly west, until you reach Chalk Mine Run.  Go up this stream drainage about 1.25 miles until the stream turns sharply to the right and a large stream comes into Chalk Mine Run just upstream of this sharp curve.  The site is up this new stream, going north, and is situated on left side, on flat part of hillslope.  The site is quite broad.

Off Rt. 29, take Rt. 6 east and go about 2 miles to the Mt. Shiloh Church.  Park there and walk back west along the highway about 100 yards.  The site is in a wooded area on south side of the road, about 100 ft. below a house and uphill from a very small creek.  The shallow prospect sites about 250 ft. off of Rt. 6.

From Rt. 6, take Rt. 721 going north.  Go about 0.5 mile and you pass Oak Ridge Church.  Shortly after, you can see a big open quarry on right side of road (these are sites 514-516).  Park at entrance just past the quarry.  Walk past first quarry and water-filled quarries along a dirt road.  Walk directly SW over hill and sites 517-518 are directly on other side of hill.

Take U.S. Route 60 through Buena Vista.  Take a left at the Fitzgerald Lumber and Log Company and park.  Go around the logging camp to an access road behind it.  Follow this for around 100 m.  Go due East about 75 m upslope.

Go southeast on State Route 714 into the town of Midvale.  Turn left onto State Route 808 and park along the road close to a forest path on the other side of the river.  (There are several passable points of the stream and two small bridges as well for crossing)  Hike up the path, parallel to the stream to the top of a small crest. The site is southeast several hundred feet off of the path in a clearing.

:  From intersection of Rt. 340 and Rt. 211 near Massanutten Mountain, take Rt. 211 east for about 1.75 miles.  Entrance to old quarry is on left side of road, a gravel/dirt road, just past a set of barns.  Old machinery and piles of gravel, dirt sit within the site which is just off the road, but highwall faces away from road so is not visible from the road.

From intersection of Rt. 340 and Rt. 211 near Massanutten Mountain, take Rt. 211 west for about 3 miles through New Market Gap.  Site is on left of highway after George Washington National Forest visitor center, right pas a barn-red house, up on hill.
intersection of Rts737&602

From intersection of Rt. 20 and Rt. 15 near Dillwyn, take Rt. 15 south.  Get off on Rt. 640, go through Enonville, then to Andersonville.  Turn off onto Rt. 638, south to Rt. 636 west.  Take Rt. 612 for just over a mile.  Park at State Forest gate on left.  Site is just to the northeast of gate.

Take Rt. 60 going out of the northeast end of Buena Vista.  Across from the turnoff onto Maple Ave. (which will be on the right) there is an entrance into a warehouse/distribution center parking lot on the left of Rt. 60.  Park in their parking lot, closest to the woods.  Walk through the woods, slightly west, until you reach Chalk Mine Run.  Walk up this stream about 0.5 mile.  Site is on left side of stream about 60 ft. away from the water.  The adit is in the small hillslope above the floodplain.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: Take Route 260 and park on an access road 70m South of the older one shown on the map. Follow road East, past a pasture upslope. At the Y-intersection take the right branch until it crosses a creek. Follow the creek northward around one fourth a mile. Go up the East bank about 100 m into a large field about 70 m after crossing a  tributary creek coming in from the East.
properties.OlacNotes: 6C

properties.Directions: Off Rt. 29, take Rt. 6 east.  Go about 3 miles (just past county line) on Rt. 6 and park on gravel turnoff on left side of road where gate blocks a long dirt road.  Take access road on northwest side of Rt. 6 and walk slightly over one mile to the Faber Lead mines.  The shafts are on steep west side of Shiloh Mountain.  Site 204 is a large adit which is very visible from the intermittent stream.  Also included in this site are some cement foundations and stone walls just downstream of the adit.
park on 719 at bridge over Difficult Cr and walk in on northeast side of creek

properties.Directions: From Staunton bypass (275), go north on Rt. 613 about 5 miles. Just after crossing the Middle River, turn right on 732. Park at the road bend and walk through opening in fence into small field on southeast side of road. Ascend steep bank to the southeast. Site is somewhat obscured in trees on the hillside, less than 100 feet up the bank.

Go about 4 miles and after Morris Cemetary the road will make a sharp turn to the right and then there will be open pastureland on both sides of the road.  Stop once the forest starts again and walk on the right side of the road to the back left corner of the pasture where it meets the creek and there is a logging road that runs parallel to the forest line.  The sites are right along this road..

Turn right onto 714 and then left onto 706 at the “T” intersection, followed by an immediate right back onto 714. There are paths up the ridge on the left every hundred yards or so, but the best places to cross and climb up seemed to be the second bridge from your current location or at the hunting lodge about 300 yards down the road on your left.  The sites are about a mile up on the ridge.

properties.Directions:
Grayson Prospects/Oglesby Branch Prospects:

A number of prospects are documented in this area, however, they are surface occurrences which were not extensive.  The group lies on the south side of Oglesby Branch due west of Galax.  Two prospects were recorded to the north of Oglesby Branch, however, the property was not inspected due to cattle grazing the lands and on the basis of conditions at the prospects occurring on the side of the Creek.  The current resident was interviewed and noted there were no significant depressions or openings on the lands.

properties.Directions:
Meadow Whitaker Mine and local prospects:
The knob of land across the river from Fries, VA which rises to approximately 2600'.  The locations of prospects and the Whitaker are referred to in Stose's writing in DMR Bulletin 72.  There are remnants of disturbances throughout the upper elevations and along the toe areas of the knob.  No significant depressions were found and the ridge appears to have been cleared in the recent past.  There are residences and improved roads along the ridges on the south and west portions of the knob.  Two gentlemen from North Carolina were interviewed, along the bank of the New River, at the discharge of the valley running NE from Beulah Church.  One had purchased lands contiguous to the New River and they were inspecting the proeprty for planned improvements.  They were interested in getting the roads to this part of the knob improved to a level equal to roads on the southern and western areas.
properties.OlacNotes: NO ACTION NEEDED.

properties.Directions:
Kyanite Prospects:
A number of kyanite prospects are documented in this area which were explored around the hill structure at Reavistown (Hwy58), Pilot Knob (east of Reavistown), and west of the Galax Armory.  None of the locations explored indicated any significant excavations and the areas are inundated with development.  People were interviewed who live at the sites and comments generally indicated that the grounds have been worked over as either farms or residential developments.  Pictures of the Galax area especially show how farms and residential units have intertwined and are traversed heavily.  The Pilot Knob area did show some residential effects of land disturbance (altered slopes on creek), however, fairly high-price residential property abuts the drainage valley.

There are paths up the ridge on the left every hundred yards or so, but the best places to cross and climb up seemed to be the second bridge from your current location or at the hunting lodge about 300 yards down the road on your left.  The sites are about a mile up on the ridge.

After this clearing is a large area where the woods have been cut/burned and there is a muddy road.  The site is about 1/2 mile from the main road down this muddy road, directly north of the road.

properties.OlacNotes:
Manganese occurs as vein of Spessarttite.

Stose notes that manganese was sought in an old mine known in 1941 as Higgins Mine and approximately 0.5 miles southwest along Beaver Creek/Rector Road in pits dug by Binkley Coal Co.  Both occurrences were located with help of Higgins relatives.  The pits were filled and it appeared the mine was also, although it was reported that a shaft of 40ft was operated.  However, the area showed disturbed land at the site of the Higgins Mine, but it appeared the shaft had been filled as there was no serious depression.

NO ACTION RECOMMENDED.
