properties.Directions: Head on Interstate 64 West towards Staunton.  When you reach the intersection of 64 and 81, bear right, onto Interstate 81N.  Get off at the Fishersville/ Staunton 250 exit.  Bear right onto 250 towards Staunton.  Continue on 250, through the town of Staunton until you reach 42 South.  Take 42 South, and turn left on 615.  This will take you over the railroad tracks and over a 1 lane bridge.  Continue up this road, past a small house until you reach a Y intersection in the road.  Turn left in the intersection.  You might want to park your car here, as the terrain gets a little muddy and the car might bottom out.  Continue along this road past a stream and the site will be on your left.  If its still there at all.

Head on Interstate 64 West towards Staunton.  When you reach the intersection of 64 and 81, bear right, onto Interstate 81N.  Get off at the Fishersville/ Staunton 250 exit.  Bear right onto 250 towards Staunton.  Continue on 250, through the town of Staunton until you reach 42 South.  Take 42 South, and turn left on 615.  This will take you over the railroad tracks and over a 1 lane bridge.  Continue up this road, past a small house until you reach a Y intersection in the road.  Continue up 615 until you reach a major bend in the road.  Park your car on the edge of the road, and continue up a small dirt trail until the land levels out, and you will see on the left of the dirt trail the series of holes and unturned rocks.

Head on Interstate 64 West towards Staunton.  When you reach the intersection of 64 and 81, bear right, onto Interstate 81N.  Get off at the Fishersville/ Staunton 250 exit.  Bear right onto 250 towards Staunton.  Continue on 250, through the town of Staunton until you reach 42 South.  Continue on 42 South until you reach the town of Goshen and see signs for 39 East.  Take 39 East and go approximately 1.1 miles from site 107, making a right onto an old dirt road.  This road is usually closed, so you want to park your car here. You will pass the sign that says, “Goshen Wildlife Management Area”.  The road almost a stone’s throw from that sign.  Head up this road, past site 113, and continue passing in and out of Boy Scout Preserve Land.  You will pass a Tree Farm on your right.  When you reach the Y intersection, head right, and continue a little ways, and up a hill to reach site 404.

To get to site 105, take Interstate 81 South to the Raphine/ Steeles Tavern Exit towards Raphine and go on US 606.  When you reach the intersection with  613, go left.  Continue on 613 until you come to the intersection of 613 and 620.  Make a right at the intersection.  You will see the Old Providence Church as you turn left.  Continue on 620 past Spottswood School and turn left onto 617.  Continue on 617 through one major turn and park before the other major turn.  The site will be Southeast of the road, in the wooded area in the middle of the field.

To get to site 107, take Interstate 81 South to the Raphine/ Steeles Tavern Exit towards Raphine and go on 606.  When you reach the intersection with 613, go left.  Continue on 613 until you see a sign for 620.  Take 620 going left and continue until you come to the intersection with 604.  Keep going on 620, but right after the left continuation with 620, pull over.  You should have gone up a small hill, and park next to a small mobile home.  If you have found site 103, hike to the south of it about half a mile and you will come to site 107.

FROM STEELES TAVERN ON RTE 11 TAKE RTE 56 EAST TO RTE 608 NORTH THEN RIGHT ON ST. MARYS ROAD THEN LEFT ON COAL ROAD.  GO 0.7 MILES ON COAL ROAD TO OLD SITE ACCESS ROAD (NOW BLOCKED) ON THE RIGHT.  SITE IS A FEW HUNDRED FEET UP THE OLD ACCESS ROAD.
Visible from Route 608 near Stewardsburg
properties.OlacNotes: Visited during geologic mapping of the Cornwall quadrangle.  Overgrown, very small quarry, possibly used for bridge or home foundation material

properties.Directions: Easiest access is across footbridge near Marlbrook and follow existing road/trail network.  Then up slope.  Site is on private property.
properties.OlacNotes: Two circular depressions  Prospects on northern end of Midvale Mn deposit?  Site visited during geologic mapping of the Cornwall quadrangle.

properties.Directions: Take route 608 to FR41.  Follow to trailhead of St. Marys Trail.  Follow trail up Sugartree Branch __ miles.
On Hightop Mt. off of Route 626, just before you get to the Shenandoah Nt. Park Boundary.

From 340 in Stuarts Draft, go south on 608.  Keep straight as it turns into 610, and take a right onto 660.  Take a right onto the Coal Road and continue until you reach the road near the site.  Walk south 150 m.
Reclaimed mine site land is found by taking route 850 west from Lexington and taking a left (south) into the driveway approximately 1,500 feet west of the intersection with route 629 north.
properties.OlacNotes: lat. / long. corrected by L. Coiner 6/9/06

properties.Directions: Take 64 west from Lexington.  Go west on route 850 then north on 780.  The site is on the west side of the road.

Take I-64 north from Williamsburg.  At Burke's Corner take route 646 east then turn right (south) on route 604.  Continue south until you cross Carter Creek Bridge.  Park and walk around on west side of the road.

Take I-64 west from Williamsburg until Burke's Corner.  Take route 646 east then 604 south until you cross Carter Creek Bridge.  East side of road is fenced in Government Property (Camp Peary Naval Reservation Armed forces Experimental Activity Area) where site is located just adjacent to road.
Take I-60 east from Williamsburg; at Carver Gardens take route 199 east to the I-64 cloverleaf and park.  Site is inside the entrance/exit ramps of I-64.

Take route 60 nortwest from Williamsburg.  Turn left (west) on route 658 and continue for about half a mile; park before first big curve in road near housing development.  Site is under powerlines in field on north side of route 658.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM06003 on 3/7/2017, record by LIGGETT (DMME)

properties.Directions: Take 612 west from Williamsburg; go south on 614 at Centreville; turn right (west) on route 633.  Site is just on north side of the road on west side of Jolly Pond.
Follow under power right of way until you hit small creek.  Then follow creek to the east, (site is on same side of creek as road) less than 1/4 mile.

From Charlottesville, Virginia, take I-64 East towards Richmond for approximately 12 miles.  Then take the US-15 Exit 136 towards Gordonsville/Palmyra and continue south for about 9 miles.  Upon reaching Palmyra, head east on State Highway 601.  Continue about 2 miles and the first creek you pass after State highway 625 is Long Island Creek, where Site 103 is located about 200 feet off the road and approximately 600 feet east of the creek.

From Charlottesville, Virginia, take I-64 East towards Richmond for approximately 12 miles.  Then take the US-15 Exit 136 towards Gordonsville/Palmyra and continue south for about 9 miles.  Upon reaching Palmyra, head east on State Highway 601.  Continue about 2 miles and head North on State Highway 625 for approximately ¾ miles.  Long Island Creek and Site 110 is located about ½ of a mile northeast of State Highway 625.

Site 901 can be found by heading down Interstate 81 South and exiting at the Natural Bridge/US 11S exit (left exit).  You will continue down 11 south until you come to a fork in the road between 11 S and US 130.  Bear left, and DO NOT CROSS Natural Bridge.  If you have, you’ve gone the wrong way.  Continue on US 130, passing an intersection with 689.  Pull over about two tenth of a mile past the intersection and the quarry will be on your right.

To get to site 304, take Interstate 81 South to the Raphine/ Steeles Tavern Exit towards Raphine and go on US 606.  When you reach the intersection with US 613, go left.  Continue on 613 until you see a sign for 620.  Take 620 going left and continue until you reach 726 north.  Turn right, and continue until you reach the y intersection with 675 on your right.  You will pass one house, but stop the car before the reach the other house.  This is site 304.

To get to site 105, take Interstate 81 South to the Raphine/ Steeles Tavern Exit towards Raphine and go on US 606.  When you reach the intersection with US 613, go left.  Continue on 613 until you see a sign for 620.  Take 620 going left and continue  until you reach an intersection with 604 on your left.  Take 604 until you reach 252 and turn right.  Continue on 252 for about 1.5 miles and park the car.  The small pit will be through the clearing on the left of the road, and over the small stream.
properties.OlacNotes: Bauxite

properties.Directions: Site 901 can be found by heading down Interstate 81 South and exiting at the Natural Bridge/US 11S exit (left exit).  You will continue down 11 south until you come to a fork in the road between 11 S and US 130.  Bear left, and DO NOT CROSS Natural Bridge.  If you have, you’ve gone the wrong way.  Continue on 130, and enter the town of Natural Bridge Station.  When you see the sign for 759, go right.  You will go over a big bridge.  As soon as you do that, follow the signs for Yogi Bear’s Jellystone Park.  You will be making a left onto 782.  Continue on 782, and park at the end of the road.  Follow the trail marked as the Balcony Falls trail, and you will see the sites on your left of the trail.

Site 203 can be found by heading down Interstate 81 South and exiting at the Natural Bridge/US 11S exit (left exit).  You will continue down 11 south until you come to a fork in the road between 11 S and US 130.  Bear left, and DO NOT CROSS Natural Bridge.  If you have, you’ve gone the wrong way.  Continue on 130, and enter the town of Natural Bridge Station.  When you see the sign for 759, go right.  You will go over a big bridge.  As soon as you do that, follow the signs for Yogi Bear’s Jellystone Park.  You will be making a left onto 782.  Continue on 782, and park at the end of the road.  Follow the trail marked as the Balcony Falls trail.  After finding sites 113 and 114, head due North by North West, and you will soon come to site 203.  This site will be at the edge of the mountain, and you will easily be able to see the river and the clearing next to the river.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 South.  Take exit 168 (Arcadia).  Turn left off the exit.  Continue straight on county road 614.  Turn right on county road 622.  Pass Arcadia Baptist Church on the left.  The Mountain Cove Trail is located just ahead on the left. There is a sign.  Follow the trail until you reach adit 401 on your right.  Continue up the trail as it wraps around.  The prospect hole is on the right side of the trail at the top of the adit.

Interstate 64 West to Interstate 81 North.  Take the 250 Fishersville/Stauton exit to 250 West.  Take State road 42 South.  Turn left on State road 39 East.  Left on County road 609.  Right on unimproved, County road 617.  Follow trail to the fork, turn left on Shore Trail.  The site is on the left up the trail.

Head on Interstate 64 West towards Staunton.  When you reach the intersection of 64 and 81, bear right, onto Interstate 81N.  Get off at the Fishersville/ Staunton 250 exit.  Bear right onto 250 towards Staunton.  Continue on 250, through the town of Staunton until you reach 42 South.  Continue on 42 South until you reach the town of Goshen and see signs for 39 East.  Take 39 East and go approximately 1.1 miles from site 107, making a right onto an old dirt road.  This road is usually closed, so you want to park your car here. You will pass the sign that says, “Goshen Wildlife Management Area”.  The road almost a stone’s throw from that sign.  Head up this road, past site 113, and continue passing in and out of Boy Scout Preserve Land.  You will pass a Tree Farm on your right.  When you reach the Y intersection, continue straight, and turn off the road after about a tenth of a mile.  The site is on your left.

From Goshen, VA:

Go south along country road 39 ~5 miles, park at designated parking area near swinging bridge.
Walk northeast 0.5 miles on Hunter’s Trail.  Site is located approximately 0.125 miles directly to the west of the trail.

From Vesuvius, VA:

Go north on State Route 56 ~0.5 miles to junction with State Route 608.  Go northeast on State Route 608 ~0.75 miles, then turn right onto an unmarked country road.  Drive ~0.5 miles then park at unoccupied dwelling.  Walk ~1 mile beyond dwelling on trail; Site is located on hillslope, 50 yards southeast from trail.

From Vesuvius, VA:

	Go north on State Route 56 ~0.5 miles to junction with State Route 608.  Go northeast on State Route 608 ~2 miles, then turn east onto an unmarked country road paralleling Saint Mary’s River.  Go ~0.5 miles then turn north on unmarked country road before occupied dwelling.  Drive ~0.3 miles north, the site is ~80 yards directly to the east of the road.
properties.OlacNotes:
SITE RECLAIMED

 Site was revisited three times by Edward Epp, DMME.  After first two visits, OLAC committee gave site A priority.  Better documentation was researched.  On third visit, 11/14/2008, groundwater table had dropped.  This exposed the actual shaft with remnant timbering below zone of failure.  Photos were uploaded.  NFS reports they will make plans to close shaft following Dec 08 hunting season.

Site reclaimed by NFS in Oct 09.  Welded portico built over the shaft.  NFS contacts include John Donahue (Glenwood Pedlar Dist.), Tom Collins (Roanoke) Ed Havarlack and Mike Donahue.

from Charlottesville, VA:
- Route 29 South to I-64 East to I-81 South
Get 501heading East
- Petroleum pipeline runs parallel to 501, but there is a section where it runs across the road
- Park at this location, about 1 mile before there is a bridge that crosses the stream
- Follow the dirt trail and walk along the power-lines upslope
- Site should be visible from trail
From Charlottesville, 64 W to 81S.  81S to Spotswood.  West on Route 620.  Follow about 3 miles. park directly after interesction with route 604.  walk .5 miles up hill to sites.
Take 64W to 81S. Continue towards Vesuvius.  Get on 56E, and go through Vesuvius.  Stay on 56E for ~4 miles and park at hollow with ephemeral stream.  Walk about 1 mile to site.
properties.OlacNotes: Rechecked by Edward Epp on 11-21-06 (DMME-DMM).  Weather was clear and cold.

properties.Directions: Take 15 S to Palmyra- turn left on 601.  Site is up the hill from Long Island creek 250 m from road.

From Charlottesville, Virginia, head West on I-64, towards Staunton.  Take the US-340 exit, Exit 94 toward Waynesboro/Stuarts Draft and continue on 340 West until you reach State Highway 608 in Stuarts Draft and head South.  608 turns into State Highway 610 and from there you should take a right onto Lake Road.  When Lake Road forks, continue on it, taking a right, which will lead you to Coal Road.  Take a right onto Coal Road and continue down it for 1500 feet and then look North for a trail connecting to the Coal Road, right before you reach Johns Run and a jeep trail, and you will come across Site 205.

properties.Directions: Take highway 5 west from Williamsburg.  A mile west of intersection with route 614, park and hike north up stream valley for half a mile.  Small pit on west valley wall.

Take 601 south from Palmyra.  Park after crossing over "long Island Creek" and then head north following the creek.  Once you arrive at site 107 (Large Stone Wall) head to the east directly up the incline.  Site is on top of ridge.

Take Rd. 610 until about 1/2 mile from county line.  Stop at large open field on south side.  Cross field, cross creek and climb up incline through briars.  Site 607, 608, and 609 are along this ridge.

Follow stream feature for about 2000 ft until it forks.  Follow the left branch for several hundred ft and the site should be on a hill to the stream’s left.

From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 south to VA 130 E.  Take VA 781 and follow road a mile past the point where the road turns from light duty to unimproved.  Site is just off the road on the left hand side
From Lexington, take route 672 west, site is ~1,500 feet before road splits (672 heads west while 641 follows Sugar Creek south). Site is on south side of road.
Take route 132 south from Williamsburg.  Site is on east side of the road between the hospital cemetary and Cedar Grove cemetary.

From Charlottesville, Virginia, take I-64 East towards Richmond for approximately 12 miles.  Then take the US-15 Exit 136 towards Gordonsville/Palmyra and continue south for about 9 miles.  Upon reaching Palmyra, head east on State Highway 601.  Continue about 2 miles and the first creek you pass after State highway 625 is Long Island Creek, where Site 102 is located about 600 feet off the road, adjacent to the creek.

From Charlottesville, Virginia, head West on I-64, towards Staunton.  Take the US-340 exit, Exit 94 toward Waynesboro/Stuarts Draft and continue on 340 West until you reach State Highway 608 in Stuarts Draft and head South.  608 turns into State Highway 610 and from there you should take a right onto Lake Road.  When Lake Road forks, continue on it, taking a right, which will lead you to Coal Road.  Take a right onto Coal Road and continue down it for just less than 1 mile, about 1500 feet past a jeep trail on the north side of the Coal Road and head north off the trail about 500 feet, along an intermittent stream.
Take route 1 north from Ashland then take route 641 east for almost a mile then park at street called "Riverland Hills".  Walk to backyard of corner home just above creek.
Take route 1 north from Ashland, head east on 698- site is between route 1 and I95 on north side of road (fenced in)
Take 698 east from Ashland- site is on west side of Slayden Creek
Take route 1 north from Ashland, go west on 684, cross tracks (southwest) park at end of road and walk into field.
Route 1 north from Ashland; take 688 east then head north-then northwest on 731for about a 1.5 miles.  Site is big pond.
Route 1 north from Ashland, 30 east almost 3 miles then take 725 north a quarter mile.
Going west on 340 from 64, take a left onto Ladd Rd.  Right on Mt. Torry Road. Turn right onto the Coal Road.  Park at trailhead near Orebank creek, walk SW down trail about 5 km.
Going west on 340 from 64, take a left onto Ladd Rd.  Right on Mt. Torry Road. Turn right onto the Coal Road.  Park at trailhead near Orebank creek, walk SW down trail about 5 km.
From the Blue Ridge Parkway, park at Bald Mountain Overlook.  Proceed down trail towards Green Pond and nav to site.
17 north to 1232 west site is behind apartment building
take route 17 to route 1216 south then turn southwest and park at end of dirt road.
17 north, west on route 614 for 1.5 miles; site is on the north side of the road on the west side of Hayes Pond
From 17 north, take route 636 Providence Road north; turn left (south) on 633 then go southwest on rt. 659 Horsley Rd then turn left on Laurellyle Lane and park on dirt pull-off before creek
take 33 east from West Point, go north on route 14, go southwest on route 614; site is on north side of the road
30 NW from West Point; site is on NW side of road (rt 635) just north of junction between route 636 and route 30
30 north from West Point; go NE on Magnolia Ave; take 1st left (NW) on Chelsea Road and follow to the end; hike up old trail/grassy road through woods to where it ends at open field joins
route 33 west from Eltham 2.5 miles; site is on north side of road on east bank of stream valley
take route 2 north, then route 605 east 1.5 miles then park and walk north up grassy road ~1,500 feet and cross earthen dam creek to north bank
From Dantun in Orange County take 651 north to left on Route 624 to right on route 619.  First farm road on right.  Mines are down this farm road..
Follow Route 675 out of Hamburg/Luray.  Follow the road over the Massanutten Mtn Ridge.  Follow until tight switchback in road and site is on the right side (east) less than 1/4 mile.

Follow Route 730 out of Moreland Gap and past the Subdivision located at street number 1745 on 730.  Go about 1/4 mile and Site is on right side of road (NW side)  and is about 10 ft from road (very visible)
Take route 730 from Moreland Gap and follow it about 2 miles past a subdivision.  Continue about 1/2 mile (pass site 202).  Site is on right side.

From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 south to VA 130 E.  Take VA 781 and follow road a half-mile past the point where the road turns from light duty to unimproved.  Site is just off the road on the left hand side.

Directions:  From 340 in Stuarts Draft, go south on 608.  Keep straight as it turns into 610, and take a right onto 660.  Take a left onto the Coal Road and continue until you reach the road near the site.  Nav to site.
take route 615 south from route 605; turn east up Triangle Lane for ~1,000 feet, site is on north side of gravel/dirt road
route 615 then east on Triangle Lane, site is on south side of road

Follow 730 out of Moreland Gap and past sites 202 and 204.  Continue and pass the ski lift on the left.  Follow 730 about 1.5 miles more and site 104 will be on the right side of the road (north side)

Site 603: Take 15 North from Gordonsville. About 6.5 miles north is Chicken Mountain Road (Rt. 639). From 15 take a right on Chicken Mountain. Where 647 intersects of the left is where you will find 603. Site is right of the intersection on the left of Chicken Mountain Road.

properties.Directions: From Gordonsville, take 15 north, to farm road on right. first right after Gordonsville airport.  Travel to tracks, furnace is in field east of tracks.
From Gordonsville, take 15 north, to farm road on right. first right after Gordonsville airport.  Mine is in hollow across first field.

Follow Route 675 out of the the Shenandoah valley and across massanutten ridge to the Camp Roosevelt/George Washington National Park entrance.  Follow Northern trail through parking lot and up in the forest, site is about 1/4 mile in on the Northern trail.

Take 675 out of Luray and over the Masanutten Ridge.  Park at the entrance to the Camp Roosevelt Recreational Area and follow the Northeastern trail (first trail you encounter when you head up the gravel road)  Site is about 1/2 mile in on the trail, and you will encounter a variety of small features directly on the trail (adits, trenchs, small pits) and the main portion of the mine is to the north of these features and not far off the trail.
properties.OlacNotes: GO LOOK AT !

properties.Directions: Follow Route 608 NE out of Vesuvious Township and take till small road is encountered on the right (2.5-3 miles)  Follow road until you reach "end of state maintanence" sign and then walk up gravel road to the right of sign (SW direction)  All the sites are behind the houses.

Follow Route 608 NE out of Vesuvious Township and take till small road is encountered on the right (2.5-3 miles)  Follow road until you reach "end of state maintanence" sign and then walk up gravel road to the right of sign (SW direction)  All the sites are behind the houses.

That the road to the right and follow about 1/2 mile until you see the parking lot for Saint Mary's Trail.  Follow the trail towards Saint Mary's Falls/ Saint Mary's Trail (Carefully… parts of the trail are washed out) and then follow the signs up to Saint Mary's Trail.  Each site is located along the trail.

Site 904 is located about a quarter mile south of  Stage Junction and a quarter mile into the woods, along a stream, next to a large farm.

Site 904 is located about a quarter mile south of  Stage Junction and a half mile into the woods, along a stream, next to a large farm.

Turn left onto Lofton Road, then right onto Cold Springs Road.  From there take a left onto St Mary’s Road and follow it until the end, where you will find St Mary’s River Trail.  Follow the trail about a half mile until you reach site 405.

From Charlottesville, VA, head west on I-64 toward Staunton.  Merge onto US-11 S / Lee Jackson Memorial Highway via EXIT 213A toward Greenville.  Turn left onto Lofton Road, then right onto Cold Springs Road.  From there take a left onto St Mary’s Road and follow it until the end, where you will find St Mary’s River Trail.  Follow the trail about a half mile until you reach site 406.

If you encounter the Tramway, go back about 1/2 mile. properties.Directions: Follow the Coal Road out of Stuarts Draft and through GW National Forest.  Easily about 10 miles on the Old Coal Road, you will encounter a long straightaway and cross two intermenient streaems.  If you encounter the Tramway, go back about 1/2 mile.  Site located about 20 feet from site 101

Follow the Coal Road out of Stuarts Draft and through GW National Forest.  Easily about 10 miles on the Old Coal Road, you will encounter a long straightaway and cross two intermenient streaems.  If you encounter the Tramway, go back about 1/2 mile.  Follow stream bed channel

Follow the Coal Road out of Stuarts Draft and through GW National Forest.  Easily about 10 miles on the Old Coal Road, you will encounter a long straightaway and cross two intermenient streaems.  If you encounter the Tramway, go back about 1/2 mile.
Park near creek and follow pipeline to creek.  Follow creek and will encounter site

From Fork Union, go east on 652.  Take a left onto 654.  Park at the “end state maintenance” sign and continue walking down road.  There is a trail that leads to the site on the left about 200 meters down this road.
properties.OlacNotes: LOOK AT !!

properties.Directions: From Fork Union, go east on 652.  Take a left onto 654.  Park at the “end state maintenance” sign and continue walking down road.  There is a trail that leads to the site on the left about 200 meters down this road.
Directions: From Byrd Grove Church, go west on 630.  Park near bridge and walk on east side of river north along Venable Creek.  Nav to site.

From Charlottesville, VA head west on I-64 towards Staunton.  Take the VA-624 exit – EXIT 96 toward Waynesboro/Lyndhurst.  Turn left on Mount Torry Road, then a right onto Coal Road.  From Coal Road, turn left onto Turkey Pen Ridge Trail and follow the trail until just before you reach Mills Creek.

Take Route 610 towards Fluvanna-Goochland county line.  After passing three houses and pipeline on the right side, you will see a large cleared field.  Park at this field (located about 1 mile before county line).  Head south across field, encounter creek.  Follow creek to the west and you will find where the creek forks.  The site 617 is located at the fork of the creek.

Take Route 645.  You will encounter a small unlabeled road on the right hand side of route 645.  Turn onto this road and park near a small dump of trash (old trucks, fridge, washer) about 1/8th mile down road.  Head to the east.  Walk about 3/4 mile downhill and will encounter a small creek.  Follow this to the north and will find an old hunting trail.  Follow this trail (it tends to follow the creek).  When you encounter a small lake, site is on the right about 30 feet from trail.

From Charlottesville, take US 64 west to US 81 S.  Take VA 11 south to VA 778 E.  Take VA 678 west for less than a quarter mile.  Strike off the road NE.  Site is located less than a 1000 ft off road.
From Palmyra on 601, take second left onto 625.  Park 300 m after road becomes 678 and hike east.
properties.OlacNotes: look at

properties.Directions: Take route 672 west from Lexington.  Site is directly adjacent to road on the south side.
Take route 850 west from Lexington and turn south on route 638.  the site is on the south side of Keers Creek after you cross the bridge.

Take route 716 north-west from Charleston Heights.  Go west on Queens Drive, left on Holcolmb Drive (route 1301), go left at Main Marion Place (route 1333).  park in Culdesac and walk down cemented drainage ditch.  Walk towards I64 (west).
Take Highway 5 west from Williamsburg then head north on route 614.  Take a left (west) into trailer park- head to the westernmost portion north of the playground.

From Charlottesville, Virginia, head West on I-64, towards Staunton.  Take the US-340 exit, Exit 94 toward Waynesboro/Stuarts Draft and continue on 340 West until you reach State Highway 608 in Stuarts Draft and head South.  608 turns into State Highway 610 and from there you should take a right onto Lake Road.  Follow the signs for Shenandoah Acres and take a left before reaching the camp ground, following the road in which an active mining site is located.  Site 301 is the region directly before the active site.
Take Rd. 610 until about 1/2 mile from county line.  Stop at large open field on south side.  Cross field, cross creek and climb up incline.  Site 607, 608, and 609 are along this ridge.
properties.OlacNotes: CHECK IT

properties.Directions: Take 610 South until 1/2 mile from county line.  Stop at large open field on south side of rd.  cross field, cross creek and follow creek west.  If you reach fork in creek, gone too far.  Site is on south side of creek 1/8 mile down
Rd. 610 south from palmyra area.  Stop 1.2 mile before county line at large field.  cross field and cross small creek and follow creek west.  First site you hit along creek.
NORTH OF EVEROMA ON TRIB OF MT. RUN
Take route 1 North from Ashland, left on 641, take first right on #788 Attkisson Road.  Park and walk northwest up trail parallel to river.
From Ashland go east on 54 for a half mile.  Follow 698 east and park on top of hill at Providence Church.  Site is downhill south from church parking lot.
17 north, west on Crape Myrtle Road- follow to end and walk across street from cemetery
take 30 east, south on route 676 before town of Mattaponi
route 2 north then east on route 605 for about a mile; site is on north side of road behind gate
Take I-81 to Rte.33W.  Drive to parking lot just south of intersection with Old Furnace Road.  Parking lot beside closed, peach colored, building on east side of 33.
Take Rte. 42 N from Harrisonburg ~1-1.5 mi.  Turn right onto Acorn Lane for <0.5 mi. Turn right onto Red Oak St. Entrance is gravel drive way at south end of cul de sac.

From Harrisonburg, take County Road 718 east across the overpass for I-81.  Immediately after the overpass, turn north onto the service road.  Drive appx 1.2 miles north to driveway, on right, appx 200 yards past chicken farm.  Park in front of gate and walk ~.5 mi along gravel drive up hill to old quarry
West out of Elkton on Old Spotswood Trail.  Across from sewage disposal plant on east bank of South Fork Shenandoah River.

602 North into Shenandoah.  Left onto First Street.  (Just under RR tresle).  Follow first street to Railroad Street, turn right, then left onto Second Street.  Site bounded by North First Street, Central Ave, North Second Street and Coverstone Street.
properties.OlacNotes: Visited again by Rubinstein on 04/03/13.

properties.Directions: Take 602 south from Shenandoah to 601.  Turn east onto 601 and drive ~1.5 miles to rown gate, on right hand side of the road, just past the 10th Mt Div. sign.  Walk from gate, along south end of pasture and find trail on east end of pasture.  Hop the electric fence, then walk down to hayfield.  Cross hayfield, with old dredge shovel on right of you.  Go into woods and cross creek.
33 W from Elkton to 639 (~200 m west of South Fork Shenandoah River).  Turn south on 639 for ~ 200 m to dairy farm on East side of road.

In Fort Valley at junction of state road 675 and state road 274, go west on 274 ~o.1 mi and turn south on dirt road ~o.1 mi to site on west bank of creek.  If you reach the ford, you have gone ~100 feet too far.

At intersection of route 501 and 29 in lynchburg, take 501 south for roughly 5 miles.  Turn left onto route 632 (stevens road).  Go 4/10 mile, site 10 feet from the road on left hand side on wooded hill slope.

From 460 take route 501 South about three miles (stop just after you cross under a set of power lines).  On your right, less than 50 feet into the woods will be the beginning of the site.  Directly uphill from the main portion of the site is a set of smaller depressions.
From I-81 in Harrisonburg, drive south on 659 (Port Republic Road).  Quarry is on SE corner of intersection between 659 and 704.  Road going west from intersection is named Buckland Dr.

From Charlottesville, take US 29 S to Lynchburg.  take 501 S.  Turn R on route 670.  stop just before the railroad tracks.  walk S along railroad tracks for appx 100yds. site is down in dry stream bed on the left

From Charlottesville, take I-64 W to I-81 N.  take exit 269 to US 11.  Take Left on US 11 to left on 263.  pass through Mt Clifton, proceed about 3/4 mi further on 263.  pull into the white house on the left.  walk back through the field and cross the creek(appx 150 ft). site is visible once across the creek and up the opposite bank.
FROM STUARTS DRAFT TRAVEL NORTH ON RT 608 TO ITS INTERSECTION WITH ROUTE 649.  KEEP ON RT. 608 TO FIRST GRAVEL RD. ON LEFT.  SITE IS AT THE END OF THIS GRAVEL ROAD BEFORE IT COMES BACK OUT ON 608
FROM ROUTE 658 SOUTH TO 608. MINE IS ON RIGHT ON STONY RUN.
From Charlottesville go N on I 81.  Turn W on 42 at Woodstock exit.  Take Left on VA 675.  Go about 100 yds is before bend in the road.  Extends NW-SE between two neighbors yards.

From 460 West take highway 662 South for about 4 miles, until it intersects with 660.  Just to the left (North) of 662, at the intersection, will be a wooded area, and the beginning of a cut should be visible from the road.

Take Route 615 north from New Castle.  Turn left (east) on Route 611 at church. Turn right (north) onto 685 (there is a sign for Fenwick Mine Recreation Area).  Follow 685 for 1.5 miles and turn right (east) onto Forest Service road P229.  Drive up to picnic shelter and park.  Hike up jeep trail northeast then north for about a quarter of a mile.
properties.OlacNotes:
NATIONAL FOREST SITE     

RECLAIMED: OLP-14-03

properties.Directions: In Crisman Hollow, 100 yards south of State Road 730, 1/4 mile east of Moreland Gap

Directions:  From 340 in Stuarts Draft, go south on 608.  Keep straight as it turns into 610, and take a right onto 660.  Take a left onto the Coal Road and continue until you reach the road near the site.  Nav to site.
properties.OlacNotes: LOOK AT!!

properties.Directions: From Dantun in Orange County take 651 north to left on Route 624 to right on route 619.  First farm road on right.  Mines are down this farm road.

Take the Old Coal Rd out of Stuarts Draft until you reach the intersection with "Saint Mary's Road".  That the road to the right and follow about 1/2 mile until you see the parking lot for Saint Mary's Trail.  Follow the trail towards Saint Mary's Falls/ Saint Mary's Trail (Carefully… parts of the trail are washed out) and then follow the signs up to Saint Mary's Trail.  Each site is located along the trail.
properties.OlacNotes: Merged with DMM96128 on 2/28/2017, record by Randy Clouse (DMME).

properties.Directions: From Charlottesville, head west on I-64 towards Staunton.  Head south on I-81 until you reach Raphine, VA and get off onto route 606 heading east towards Vesuvius.  Head south on route 56 and then continue on to route 608 heading south until you reach South Big Mary’s Creek, where a camp site is located.  Site 702 is located up the first jeep trail about 1/2 of a mile from the camp road.

From Charlottesville, head west on I-64, then south on I81.  Get off onto route 11 heading south and then take a left onto route 56 east.  Then take a left onto 608 and then a right onto Pumpkin Drive Road in Augusta County.  Site 624 is located in the woods, up a fire trail southwest of Pumpking Drive Road.
properties.OlacNotes: GO LOOK AT

properties.Directions: Take 753 N from Harrisonburg, ~2mi from intersection of 42 and 753 to (9xx).  Turn left and follow drive to small gravel road beyond white stucco house.  Follow gravel road down hill to landscaping supply company lot.
From Interstate 81, take Mint Spring exit north to Route 800. Take right on 800 to coordinates given, take gravel road to quarry.
From I-81 Exit 251, take Rte 11 North to 721 W (Longs Pump Rd).  Turn Left.  Drive ~150 meters.  Quarry is on right hand side of road
From I-81 Exit 251, drive north on Rte 11 (~2 mi) to 721 E.  Drive accross I-81 overpass.  Entrance to property is driveway to poultry/livestock farm, 150 meters E of highway.
properties.OlacNotes: Interstate Stone Corp

properties.Directions: From 460 West, take highway 662 South until about 1/10 mile away from the intersection with 660.  The site is on the left side of the road (East), about 500 feet into the wooded area.

Take Rte 11 North to New Market
Turn left onto 211.
Cross the I-81 overpass
Turn Left onto Rte 618, just past the I-81 - 211 interchange.  Drive ~.4 miles to right hand turn, onto straight drive that leads to New Market municipal watertank.  Park in front of tank area, but don't block access to gate.

Drive north on Rte 11 from New Market to 767.  
Turn left onto 767 then cross I-81 overpass.
Take first left onto North Fork Road F240
Drive 0.6 miles to gate and park, or
Continue around 90 right-hand bend and take first left.  Park along fence posted with State Property signs.  Fence has deteriorated.  Find a hole to get onto quarry land.

Take I-81 N to New Market Exit
Turn left onto 211 and cross the overpass.
Turn left onto Rte 619 and drive for ~1 mile to second 90 degree right hand bend
Quarry is on hill to left

Take I-81 Exit (257) to Rte 11. 
Drive N on Rte 11 to 795 (Fairview Ch Rd)
Turn L into driveway opposite 795 (Add. 14241)
Drive 0.3 mi over hill to parking lot and walk NE onto hill (watch your step!)

Drive I-81 N to Exit 257
Drive N on Rte. 11 to 798 Arkton Rd
Turn R and to to Mt. Valley Rd (620)
Drive ~0.5 mi
First left turn after Raspberry Ln (it is Farm Spring Ln) -
properties.OlacNotes: Matt Heller (MJH) also visited this site on 5/13/2009 related to geologic mapping on the Tenth Legion quadrangle.  Location and description, below, modified based on that visit.

properties.Directions: Take route 617 east of timberville for roughly 1 mile.  Take left onto Neighbors Lane and site is 100 feet up the road on left.  Barn is built into/over site.
Take route 881 northwest out of Timberville for 1.5 miles.  Site is on the corner of this road and Vetters Road, 10 feet from the edge.

From 29/460 in Lynchburg, take 501 south for 5/6 mile.  Turn left onto route 666 and go 1.3 miles to railroad underpass.  To access site, follow tracks Northwest 400 yards.  Site is 100 yards to the west of the tracks in the small valley before the final ridge and railroad bridge.

Take US29 south towards Lynchburg.  Then merge onto US460 east.  Turn right at the second entrance of Longwood Circle under the power lines.  The site is located on the left side of the road.  The best way to access the site is by way of the trail that runs adjacent to it.  From Longwood Circle take the trail on the left side of the road:  the site is about 300 ft on your right.  On the opposite side of the trail there is a barn.
Take US highway 81 North to state road 263.  Take 263 east for about 6 miles, until you pass the intersection with state road 42.  The site will be just on the right, on the side of the road.

From US highway 81 take State road 42 south until reaching state road 703 (about 9 miles).  Take 703 northeast for about 3 miles, until just past the intersection with 717.  The quarry is on your right, alongside the road.

From Lynchburg, take 29 South to 683.  Take 683 about 1 mile until Pacoman Road intersects on the right.  Take the old farm road on the left of this interesection for 1/2 mile until it opens into a field.  Where the road makes a 90 degree turn to the right across the field, there is a valley on the left.  Site is located 100 yards up the valley on the left slope.

Exit I-64W onto Rte 40 (just east of Clifton Forge)
Turn right (N) onto Rte 40 and drive ~1 mi
Quarry is beside road on right
ON RT. 613 IN FARM FIELD NEAR UNNAMED TRIB OF MIDDLE RIVER. APPROX. 1 MILE NORTH OF INTERSECTION WITH RT. 612.
NORTH OF INTERSECTION OF RT. 250 & 251.  ACTIVE PERMIT STAUNTON LIME
ON RAMP JUST SOUTH OF STAUNTON ON RT. 252.

From 460 E turn right on VA 662.  Take a left onto a private drive appx 1 mile down the road.  drive to end of driveway, walk down into pasture to pond.  from pond, go downstream past spillway.  site is on the right appx 50yds from pond.

Take I-64W to Exit 35.
Turn R onto 60 then L onto 777.
Drive to Dead End (a couple of miles)
Hike down hill to Interstate and locate site

-or-

Get VDOT permission to park and hop fence

Take I-64W to Exit 35
Turn R onto 60
In ~0.5 mi, park at pull off on N side of road next to NFS gate.  (DON"T BLOCK GATE)
Hike up the nose of Brushy Mountain
Take 15 S to Palmyra, take a left on 601.  Park at Long Island Creek bridge, walk 500 m upstream on the western bank.
Take 15 S to Palmyra, take a left on 601.  Take the second left onto 625.  500 m after it turns into 678, park and walk east to coordinates.

From 340 in Stuarts Draft, go south on 608.  Keep straight as it turns into 610, and take a right onto 660.  Take a right onto the Coal Road and continue until you reach the road near the site.  Walk north 30 m.
properties.OlacNotes: Site was revisited by Epp on 11/14/2008 at request of John Donahue, USNFS.  UVa students had missed a large shaft at base of hill that is associated with this mine.  New photos were taken and uploaded to this record.  Epp may ask OLAC committee to re evaluate site with new information.

properties.Directions: From Charlottesville, Virginia, take I-64 East towards Richmond for approximately 12 miles.  Then take the US-15 Exit 136 towards Gordonsville/Palmyra and continue south for about 9 miles.  Upon reaching Palmyra, head east on State Highway 601.  Continue about 2 miles and head North on State Highway 625 for approximately ¾ miles.  Long Island Creek is located about 3/10ths of a mile east of State Highway 625.
Take Rd. 610 until about 1/2 mile from county line.  Stop at large open field on south side.  Cross field, cross creek and climb up incline.  Site 607, 608, and 609 are along this ridge.
properties.OlacNotes: CHECK IT

properties.Directions: take 646 east about 4 miles from Ashland.  Cross railroad tracks and hike south of road.
Take route 1 north then 602 west  for half a mile then turn left (southwest) on "Mitchel Trail".
Route 1 north from Ashland; then head east on 30 and take left (north) before the Morris Bridge over the North Anna River.
route 1 north from Ashland.  Take 30 east 2.5 miles then take 652 north for about a mile then head west towards river.  Site is downhill from horse farm houses.
take rt. 17 to rt. 1301
Same as DMM-07-001, on east side of two track that follows powerlines, on east flank of Betts Quarry
Take 33 W from Elkton to 979.  Go north on 979 ~200m to the right turn.  At bottom of hill, just south of Quail Run, on east side of road.

From 460 take route 501 South about three miles (stop just after you cross under a set of power lines).  On the right (toward the west), will be a wooded area.  400-500 feet into the wooded area will be a series of small depressions.
ON RIGHT SIDE OF ROUTE 657 JUST PAST ITS INTERSECTION WITH RT. 656. APPROX. 3 MILES WEST OF STUARTS DRAFT.
From 29/460 in Lynchburg take 501 south for 4/5 mile.  Take a left on route 666 and go ~2miles.  Turn right onto private road just before Indian Hill Church.  Go 1/2 mile and site is on your right.

From US highway 81, take state road 263 east for about 6 miles until state road 42.  Take 42 south for about 12 miles to state road 269, adn take 269 east for a mile to 617.  Take 617 for .2 miles until 789.  Take 789 north for a mile and a half.  You will see a clearing on the right side of the road.  Walk straight through the open area to a fence, and straight from the fence about 150 feet to a large tailings pile.

From US highway 81, take state road 263 east for about 6 miles until state road 42.  Take 42 south for about 12 miles to state road 269, and take 269 east for a mile to 617.  Take 617 for just over .5 miles (you will pass a driveway on your right, but it is just before the driveway on your left).  There will be a large open field, and the site should be visible from the road.  Jump the fence and walk in about 150 feet.
properties.OlacNotes:
OLAC requested recheck

Rechecked 05/24/2007.  Site has trash and 30 foot highwalls.  Will update inventory fields (Epp 5/25/2007)

properties.Directions: Take US29 south towards Lynchburg.  Then merge onto US460 east.  Turn right at the second entrance of Longwood Circle under the power lines.  The eastern most part of the site is on the right side of the road just before the third house on the left.  A small road on the right will lead to the trash heaps.  The trash is about 100ft from Longwood Circle road.  The site extends to the west in the wooded area.
properties.OlacNotes:
REVISIT

Updated by Rubinstein, DMM.

properties.Directions: Take US 460 west to state road 659.  Take 659 southwest for about 1/3 mile to a private drive.  Take the private road 1/4 miles south, and then enter the woods to the east for about 100 feet.

Take US 460 west to state road 659.  Take 659 southwest for about 0.2 miles, to where there is a slight valley on the left.  Walk into the woods 200 feet to the south, along the valley.  Site is slightly on right (west) side of valley.

Take I-64 to Rte 220 @ Exit 27
Drive S through Iron Gate.
Turn R onto Rte 633
Turn R @ Bridge Street and cross the bridge into and through Glen Wilton
Continue through GW to for service road.
Park near shaft #707 shown on MRV map.

From West Point, Va
Drive west on Rte 30/33 for ~2.5 - 3 miles
Watch for (Maharani?) Nature Trail on south side of Road.
If you pass the Weir Creek Commerce Park, you've gone too far.

From West Point, VA
Drive east on Rte. 33 ~ 7-8 miles
Immediately after Rte 609 on the north side of the road is a new residential development.  This development was the site of 601

From Gloucester Point,VA
Drive north ~5 miles to Rte 636.  Turn Right
Veer left at the fork and stay on 636
Site is 200 meters ahead on right.

Take I-64 to Exit 27
Take 220 South across the Jackson River
At Iron Gate, turn right onto Earnest Ave
Turn right onto Park Ave and continue to sharp left hand bend in the road
Almost directly across from you will be a small service road.
Drive up to the edge of the woods and park to access site.

Take I-64 to Exit 27.  
Take 220 South
Just across Jackson River Take a right onto old 220.
Follow the road for ~ 1 mile then turn left and work your way up potholed driveways to general area of sites

Drive Rte. 340 N from Berryville appx 2 miles
Turn Right onto Shepards Mill Road (612)
Drive around 90 degree turn
Stop at 3815 Sheppards Mill Rd.  
Walk past chain across drive. 
Site was in hayfield north of the driveway behind metal shed on adjacent property

Drive I-64 to Exit 21
Drive 616 (Rich Patch Road) south ~3.5 miles
Turn Right onto Gravel Road (Fresh Reality)
Follow Road to area where the mines you are looking for are shown
(Road splits after ~2 miles.  You can choose left or right)

Drive 1-64 to Exit 27.
Drive N on 623 (Douthat St Pk Road) thru Douthat St Pk to FS 125
In appx .5 miles (as road makes a sharp left turn into the main hollow for Slim Ridge Branch of Mill Creek Park and hike up the hill.
AT END OF SCANDIA ROAD TAKE LEFT TO FARM GATE.  PITS ARE NOW PART OF FARM VEGETATED AND SLOPED.
SOUTH OF INTERSECTION OF HUGHES ROAD AND RT. 156. SOUTH OF ELKO.
FROM INTERSECTION OF CHARLES CITY ROAD AND HINES ROAD TRAVEL EAST ON HINES ROAD TO FIRST TRIBUTARY CROSSING ROAD.  MINE IS SOUTH OF ROAD, JUST OFF HIGHWAY.
Take route 672 West from Lexington.  Borrow pit is on the south side of the road ~1,500 feet before you get to route 673 on the right (north).  Site is just uphill from the road ~60 feet.

From Charlottesville, Virginia, head West on I-64, towards Staunton.  Take the US-340 exit, Exit 94 toward Waynesboro/Stuarts Draft and continue on 340 West until you reach State Highway 608 in Stuarts Draft and head South.  608 turns into State Highway 610 and from there you should take a right onto Lake Road.  When Lake Road forks, continue on it, taking a right, which will lead you to Coal Road.  Take a right onto Coal Road and continue down it for about 1 mile, where you will find a jeep trail crossing the road, along with Stony Run creek.  Follow the jeep trail south another ½ mile up the hill and you will find Site 202 at the top of the hill, slightly off the trail.
Take 601 South from Palmyra.  Park after crossing Long Island Creek.  Site along Long Island creek, north of rd.  Lies, east of creek

Follow roud until you cross over large creek.  Park at creek and walk south along pipeline right of way and intersects creek.  Follow creek to the Northeast and up bluff.  Site located to the northwest of deerstand.
